loans.name: Gorreti

texts.en:
Gorret is 43 years old and lives in the town of Maganjo in the Kampala north region of Uganda. She is Married and has 6 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Gorret has been working hard to manage her hard ware, which owns a hard ware shop that sales building materials. 

To help expand her business, Gorret has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to invest in more materials for the store for sale, and will help Gorret to generate greater profits and improved her business she managed to add more stock that increased her profits. Gorret hopes that in the future she will be able to start purchasing most of these items by herself in the bigger factories that produce the materials. 

Gorret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gorret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to invest in more materials for her hardware store for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetable seeds to grow for her business

loans.name: Leoniza

texts.en:
Leoniza is 59 years old. She is known in the Ozamiz City area for her food vending business. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and wood. 

She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record -- a matter that she has given a priority, as a microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for, after all her financing needs on her retailing business have been supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails and wood for her house.

loans.name: Guy Efren

texts.en:
Guy Efren is an online tutor who earns through this work. He is a full-fledged member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. 

Recently, Guy Efren applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. He is on his way to renovating his house. He wishes to live comfortably with his family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La Señora María vive y trabaja en Colomi, es viuda su esposo falleció hace mucho tiempo, desde entonces trabaja sola para sustentarse día a día. La señora se dedica a la agricultura con la ayuda de su hija, produce papa como su principal producto agrícola de mayor demanda en el mercado, los ingresos económicos los obtiene a través de la producción y venta de la papa y algunas veces de oca, los mismos son también el sustento para su alimentación diaria (autoconsumo). La señora María solicita un crédito para la compra de abono orgánico, productos agroquímicos y herramientas agrícolas, de esta forma incrementará su producción y tendrá mayores ingresos para mejorar su nivel de vida y su situación social en beneficio de su familia.
texts.en: María lives and works in Colomi. She is a widow as her husband died a long time ago. Since then she has worked alone to sustain herself day by day. This woman works in agriculture with the help of her daughter and produces potatoes which are the agricultural product in highest demand in the market. She gets her economic income through her production and sales of potatoes and at times oca. They are also her sustenance for her daily food. Maria is requesting a loan to buy organic manure, agrochemical products and agricultural tools to increase production and have higher income to improve her standard of living.and social situation for the benefit of her family.

loans.use: to buy organic manure, agrochemical products and agricultural tools to increase production and have higher income for a higher standard of living.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: La señora Marina, tiene 25 años de edad, es casada tiene un hijo dependiente de sus ingresos, vive en una comunidad rural, se dedica a la agricultura porque es lo único que aprendió con sus padres. Este año sus cultivos de papa fueron afectados por una enfermedad llamada Tizon dejándola casi sin nada para cosechar por tal razón presenta una disminución en sus ingresos económicos además los productos agrícolas presentan bajos precios en el mercado. Por estos motivos mencionados su estabilidad económica ha sufrido un desequilibrio, afectandola directamente en la adquisición de sus insumos agrícolas que se requieren para la producción y para la alimentación de sus hijos. La Señora Marina, es una persona respetada en la comunidad donde trabaja, actualmente se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para comprar semilla de papa, abonos y agroquímicos para continuar con su producción y salir adelante.
texts.en: Marina is 25 years old, she is married and has a son who depends on her income. She lives in a rural community and works in agriculture, because it is the only thing that she learned with her parents. This year, her potato crops were affected by a disease called Tizon, leaving her almost with nothing to harvest. For this reason, she has had a decrease in her economic income, and also, agricultural products have low prices in the market. For these reasons, her economic stability is out of balance, directly affecting her in the acquisition of agricultural supplies that are required for the production and to feed her children. Marina is a respected person in the community where she works. Currently she finds herself needing a loan to buy potato seed, manure, and agrochemicals to continue with production and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy potato seed, manure, and agrochemicals to continue with her production and get ahead.

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta started her business in 2014 with her own working capital of $ 300.00.  She had a lot of difficulties because she did not have a good management for her business. So she has one idea to requesting a loan of $ 700.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her management, because she said with borrowed money she could count the income and expenditure in one day. 

She is taking this loan because she wants used to buy more sugar, cooking oil, salt, detergents, coffee, spices, noodles, milk, rice and other things to sell. so that people can be buy in her kiosk. She has been busy with her business but she still happy to do that.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking oil, salt, detergents, coffee, spices, noodles, milk, rice and other things to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 42 years old, married with seven children. Six of her children are in school.

Aida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Aida has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Aida aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bububatma

texts.ru: Бубубатма, 46 лет, она вдова, мама 3 детей, самому младшему сыну - 3 года. У Бубубатмы высшее образование, она работает учителем химии и биологии в школе, получая заработную плату в размере 9,100 сом (KGS). На территории Бубубатмы есть бассейн в виде заводи, предназначенный для разведения рыб, однако бассейн еще не достроен и не готов к эксплуатации. Место расположения хорошее, рядом есть лес, река, водится рыба. Бубубатма обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов для завершения постройки бассейна и начала бизнеса - рыбоводства. В ведении бизнеса Бубубатме будет помогать ее дочь. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в будущее увеличение своего бизнеса и покупку автомобиля для семьи.
texts.en:
Bububatma is 46 years old. She is a widow and the mother of three. Her youngest child is three years old. Bububatma has a college degree; she works as a chemistry and biology teacher in secondary school, receiving a [monthly] salary of 9,100 soms (KGS). On her land plot there is a pond-like pool intended for fish farming, but the pool is still unfinished and not yet ready to be used. This is a good location: nearby there is a forest and a river used for fishing. 

Bububatma has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy construction materials to complete building her fish pool and start her fish farming business. Bububatma’s daughter will help her in the business. Bububatma plans to invest the revenue from her loan in a further development of her business as well as to buy a car for her family.

loans.use: to start her own business, a fish farm, by purchasing construction materials for building a fish pool.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 30 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, 1 of whom is currently in school. For the past 2 years, Grace has been working hard to manage her restaurant business, which sells a variety of cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add different types of food for her restaurant to sell, and will help Grace to generate greater profits and increase her family's income. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to have the best service in her restaurant. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Grace who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to add different types of food at her restaurant.

loans.name: Deling

texts.en:
Deling is 47 years old, married and lives in Ozamiz City, She is a businesswoman running a sari-sari store and also operates their own farm. 

She avails a loan of PHP 5,000.00 to pay labor cost for her house renovation. She wants to maintain her good record as Member In Good Standing (MIGS) to the cooperative because PMPC has been their in supporting her financial needs for her sari-sari store business and farm.

loans.use: to pay labor cost for her house renovation

loans.name: Sembradoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SEMBRADORAS” iniciará el vigésimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de pan, venta de carteras, venta de artesanías en porcelana fría, venta de mantas, venta de ropa para damas.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su mamá que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de artesanía en porcelana fría; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá desde hace varios años. 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de artesanías en porcelana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos 

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y las capacitaciones que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank Sembradoras are starting their 22th cycle with Pro Mujer, working with one of the organisation's regional offices in Cascada. It is made up of nine members, and is managed by a board of directors of which Maria is secretary. The members of this communal bank are all working to improve very different businesses, including: sales of food, bread, bags, cold porcelain handicrafts, blankets, ladies clothing and a local store.

The loan will benefit female micro-entrepreneurs, including Maria. She says that she joined Pro Mujer ten years ago, by invitation of her mother who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business selling cold porcelain handicrafts, she explains that her mother taught her the business several years ago.

This loan will be to increase her stock (to buy handicrafts in bulk) which she will acquire from wholesale merchants in the city of El Alto, which she will then sell at her shopping stall. This type of work allows her to generate the resources to support her family economically, as she is single and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the healthcare and the training that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts in bulk.

loans.name: Rosa Delmy

texts.es: Rosa de 51 años de edad vive con su esposo y es madre de dos niños de 12 y 10 años que se encuentran estudiando actualmente, su vivienda es propia ella siempre se ha esforzado por ayudarle a su esposo por llevar el sustento diario a su casa se ha dedicado anteriormente a la venta de gallinas indias luego decidió aprender la elaboración de pizzas,  ahora que ya aprendió el oficio ella ha comenzado un pequeño negocio de venta de pizzas, para lo cual  las hornea y  posteriormente sale a las calles de su comunidad a venderlas sus clientes se muestran satisfechos con el excelente sabor de sus productos y la demanda de los mismos ha crecido. Por lo que Rosa solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: queso, tomates, harina, pepperoni, hongos, carne, etc. para la elaboración de pizzas y agregar nuevos sabores a estas a petición de los clientes. Ella sabe que con este crédito mejor y obtener mayores ganancias y mejorar cada vez más la calidad de vida de sus hijos que tengan lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
Rosa is 51 years old. she lives with her husband and two children who are 12 and 10 years old and currently studying. She owns her house. She has always made an effort to help her husband to obtain the daily sustenance for her household. She used to raise chickens then she decided to learn how to make pizza.

Now that she has learned the business she has started a small pizza business where she bakes the pizzas and then goes out in the streets of her community to sell. Her clients seem satisfied with the excellent flavor of her products and demand has risen. So Rosa is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cheese, tomatoes, flour, pepperoni, mushrooms meat etc, to make pizzas and add new flavors at the request of her clients. She knows that with this loan she will grow, obtain higher profit and improve the quality of living so that her children have what they need to live.

loans.use: to invest in cheese, tomatoes, flour, pepperoni, mushrooms meat etc, to make pizzas.

loans.name: Arturo Yovani

texts.es: Arturo de 30 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos de 10, 6 y 1 año y medio a quienes a excepción del menor de los tres ayuda con sus estudios. Arturo es muy trabajador y siempre se esfuerza para sacar adelante a su familia apoyado en su trabajo el cual consiste en prestar sus servicios de atención al cliente desde hace cuatro años en una empresa cercana a su vivienda, por lo que se siente feliz de contar con una fuente de ingresos fijos y de esta manera poder suplir las necesidades básicas del hogar. Arturo desea construir dos cuartos en su propiedad y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, hierro, teja y ladrillos para construir los dos cuarto dormitorios en su propiedad y de esta manera ampliar su vivienda. Arturo espera contar con este crédito para poder hacer la mejora en su casa y darle mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Arturo at 30 years old is a hard working man who lives in his own house with his life companion and his three children aged 10, 6 and one and a half year old. Except for the youngest he supports them in their studies. Arturo is very hard-working and always makes the effort to get his family ahead supported by his work. His job consists of attending to clients in a company close to his home which he has done for four years. He is happy to be able to count on a steady source of income and in this way supply the basic needs of the household.

Arturo wants to build two rooms on his property. So he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, re-bar, tiles and bricks to construct two bedrooms on his property and in this way expand his house. Arturo hopes to receive this loan to be able to make the improvements on his house and provide more comfort to his family..

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, re-bar, tiles and bricks to expand his house.

loans.name: Rene Alexander

texts.es: Rene de 33 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 8 y 5 años de edad, en vivienda de su propiedad. Él siempre se esfuerza por mejorar aún más en su trabajo y así llevar el sustento diario a su esposa y sus hijos a los que quiere mucho y su mayor anhelo es que ellos tengan un excelente desarrollo físico y emocional. En la vivienda de Rene el agua se consigue a través de un pozo del cual se extrae con una cubeta, acción bastante peligrosa, por el peligro que con lleva que por una mala maniobra pueda caer al interior del pozo, por lo que Rene solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: una bomba para pozo, tubería, biga central y caja para instalar una bomba eléctrica en el pozo de su vivienda, él espera una respuesta favorable ya que así dejaría de sentirse preocupado que su esposa o alguno de sus hijos tengan un accidente al estar sacando el agua con una cubeta ya que él sabe que no es una forma segura de hacerlo.
texts.en:
Rene is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two children, ages eight and five years old. Rene owns the property where the family lives and has always worked hard to do better at work and support his wife and children. Rene really loves his wife and children and his biggest wish is for them to develop well physically and emotionally. 

At Rene's home, water is taken out in kegs from a well. This is quite dangerous as, owing to bad workmanship, the person taking out water can fall into the well.

Rene is therefore applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy a water pump, pipes, wood, and a box to install an electrical pump in the well at his house. Rene knows that collecting water from the well is not safe and is hoping to be granted this loan as it will stop him from worrying about his wife or one of his children having any accidents when taking out water.

loans.use: to buy a water pump, pipes, wood, and a box to install an electrical pump in the well at his house.

loans.name: Corazones Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CORAZONES” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Loly es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de CD´s, venta de comida, venta de zapatos, venta de muebles, venta de jugos de fruta, venta de  carne de pollo. 
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Loly es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años integra Pro Mujer ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne de pollo; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne de pollo por mayor) que adquirirá de las comerciantes mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The. “CORAZONES” communal bank is starting their 7th cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II regional branch. It is made up of eight members lead by a board of directors with Loly as the President. The businesses of the members of the communal bank are various, amongst them are: food sales, selling CD's, selling shoes, furniture sales, selling fruit juice and selling chicken meat.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit all of these micro-entrepreneurs Loly amongst them. She says that she joined Pro Mujer 6 years ago on the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business selling chicken meat. She indicated that she learned this business on her own a number of years ago.

The loan that she is receiving will be used to increase her working capital (buying chicken meat wholesale) that she will acquire at wholesalers in the city of El Alto and later sell in her sales space. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family economically as she is married and has four children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the training and the health services that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy chicken meat wholesale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 34 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala north region of Uganda. She is Married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her plasic shoe business, which sales plastic shoes in her store. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 2500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes for sale in her store, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and her shoe business is doing well but she would love to add clothes so as to improve on her profits. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to have a bigger shop in town. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more shoes for sale in her store,

loans.name: Lukia

texts.en:
Lukia is 35 years old and lives in the town of Natete A in the Kampala north region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 5 years, Lukia has been working hard to manage her Milling business, which owns a milling machine that makes maize flour for sale. 

To help expand her business, Lukia has requested a loan of 4000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase for more maize,millet for milling, and will help her to generate greater profits and having a well stocked and well known business in town . Lukia hopes that in the future she will be able to increasing more on her sales than before. 

Lukia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like her who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase for more maize, millet for milling,

loans.name: Wilyn

texts.en:
Wilyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Wilyn is 51 years old and has one child still in school.

Wilyn has a buy and sell personal collection business in the Philippines. Wilyn requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional products to sell like beauty soap, cosmetics, body lotion, bag and etc.

Wilyn has been in this business for 3 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like beauty soap, cosmetics, body lotion, bag and etc

loans.name: Madre Selva Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MADRE SELVA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Calixta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de polleras, venta de ropa para niños, venta de zapatos, venta de comida, venta de fresco de linaza, servicio de construcción de viviendas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Calixta es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que con el ahorro para un pequeño capital, inicio este  negocio hace varios años por iniciativa propia. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz y fideo por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de 
Salud y las capacitaciones que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The “MADRE SELVA” communal bank is starting their 3rd loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II regional branch. It is made up of nine members lead by a board of directors with Calixta as the President. The businesses of the members are varied, amongst them are: selling polleras (traditional skirts) selling children's clothing, selling shoes, food sales, selling linseed juice and a house construction service.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit all the members, Calixta being one. She says that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago on the invitation of a promoter from the institution. She currently has a business selling meals. She said that with the savings of a small amount of capital she opened her business on her own initiative.

The loan that she is taking out is to increase her capital (buying rice and noodles wholesale) that she will acquire from sellers in the city of El Alto and later sell in her commercial space. This way of working allows her to support her family economically as she is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she liked the health services and the training that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy rice and noodles wholesale.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 49 years old, married from Ozamiz City. Susana owns and operates a sari-sari store. She has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Susana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. 

Susana is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil and soy sauce. This is her 10th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman, and has four children whom all attends school. She owns a house that  has electricity piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a  poultry farming business which earns her the source of income. She sells to restaurant operators and local neighbours. Her major challenges are high cost of transportation  and seasonality in her place of operation.

With the Ksh 10,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feeds for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feeds for resale

loans.name: Mo'amar

texts.en:
Mo'amar is a 30-year-old, married man from Gaza City. He lives with his wife and two sons. He works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income.

Mo'amar has taken out a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water. This will enable him to provide hot water without using electricity.

Mo'amar appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with five children  four of whom attend school.She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.Her greatest monthly expense is food.
She has operated a business of selling water for the past eleven years selling to the community.She mentioned competition as a major challenge  in her business.
With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase another tank  to use in her business.She decided to join yehu to access loan and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase another water tank  to use in her business

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en: Luvuno is the married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor plumbing. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household items. For more than three years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling out of her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in seasonality and transportation costs at her place of business. She has requested a loan for Kshs 30,000 to buy bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a married woman  with three children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 40,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize
 flour, beans and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize  flour, beans and wheat flour.

loans.name: Pendo

texts.en:
Pendo is a married woman with one child, a who is still young to attend school. She lives at her own house that  neither has electricity nor piped water.Her monthly is food.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital in her business.
With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with nine children, three of whom attends school. She owns a  house that neither  has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married woman, and has five kids who attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry farming business which earns her the source of income. She sells to restaurant operators and local neighbours. Her major challenges are high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Ksh 10,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feeds for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards

loans.use: to  purchase chicks and chicken feeds for resale

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu is a married mother of eight children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that  neither has electricity  nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over four years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transport in her business.
With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Kahoso

texts.en:
Kahoso is a married woman and has been blessed with three children all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over three years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyazi is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. 

Mnyazi has operated a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operation.

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. Cecilia owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Cecilia has operated a firewood selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood  for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood  for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with six children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the loan of 15,000 KES that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated an m-pesa business for the past three years, serving the people in the town and in the neighborhood. She mentioned theft and seasonality as major challenges in her place of operation.

With the loan of KES 50,000, she wants to add float to her m-pesa business. She decided to join Yehu to access a loan and boost her business.

loans.use: to add float to her m-pesa business.

loans.name: Mbodze

texts.en:
Mbodze is a widow with three children, all of whom have completed schooling. She owns a house that neither has piped water nor electricity.Her monthly expenses is food. 

Mbodze  has operated a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs  of 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Nazi

texts.en:
Nazi is a married woman and has been blessed with five school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a dairy farming business, selling at retail and at the market to her local residents and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase medicine for livestock and cow feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase medicine for livestock and cow feed.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with seven children ,four of whom attend school.She owns a house that neither has electricity nor  piped water .Her  monthly expense is food.

 She has operated a a metal shop for the past 20 years selling to the neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in place of operation.
With the loan of 20,000 she wants to purchase a stock  metal items like steel,wire mesh  for resale.She decided to join yehu to access loan and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock metal items like steel ,wire mesh  for resale

loans.name: Kangombe

texts.en: Kangombe is married and lives with her husband and children. She owns a house that has neither has electricity nor plumbing, and her greatest monthly expense is food. For the past five years, she has operated a charcoal-vending business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Kangombe faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation. She has requested a loan for Kshs 20,000 to buy bundles of charcoal to resell. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyazi is a married woman with six children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Mnyazi has operated a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a business of renting houses to the community and people living in the nearby town. She mentioned seasonality and delay in payment as major challenges in her business.

With the loan she requesting of KES 35,000, she wants to purchase cement, sand, and other building materials to construct another rental house. She decided to join Yehu to access a loan and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and other building materials to construct another rental house.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en: Jumwa is married and lives with her husband and children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor plumbing, and her greatest monthly expense is food. For the past ten years, she has operated a charcoal-vending business, selling from her home to neighbors and passersby. Jumwa faces a major challenge in the lack of capital for her business, and has requested a Kshs 30,000 loan to buy more bundles of charcoal to resell. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a married woman with six children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity.

Jumwa has operated a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a widow and the mother of five children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither has electricity nor plumbing, and her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family. For the past three years, she has made a living by selling fruits and coconuts to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. Catherine has requested a loan for Ksh 10,000 to buy sacks of bananas to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy sacks of bananas to resell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is married and the mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither has electricity nor plumbing, and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past three years, she has earned a living by selling cereals to her neighbors and passersby. One of her biggest challenges is the cost of transportation. Julia has requested a loan for Kshs 20,000 to buy maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a solar energy system to illuminate his house.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 49 years old and married. She is from Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte.

She thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can get financial assistance for her chosen business. Nida has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were repaid in a timely manner.

Recently, she took a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides for her corn fields. Nida wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides for her corn fields

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
As a faithful believer of Christ and a devoted member of the Baptist Church, Lilibeth strives to be a model to her family, to other church members, and to the community in terms of her faith and integrity. She wants to be honest when she operates any business or endeavor. She encourages her husband, Juan, to do the same. Together, they operate a small canteen in Caloocan City. Lilibeth maximizes her cooking talent, and even the limited space on the side of their house becomes useful. She displays the cooked food, drinks, beverages, fruit for dessert, and eating utensils. Her regular customers are her neighbors, the local community, students, and working people. Profit derived from her business helps a lot in their daily expenditures but she still needs to save money for her children’s education. She’s planning to cook more meal recipes now that the school year has begun. More students are expected to buy from her and it will boost her income. She needs 10,000 PHP to buy meat, fish, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. You can be a blessing to her through your kind generosity.

Lilibeth aspires that someday, she would be financially capable of helping others. She also wants to continue serving God together with her whole family. She is an inspiration to her co-fellowship members at CCT who  meet weekly to reflect on God’s Words and share stories about life and their businesses. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy meat, fish, vegetables, condiments and seasonings.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 35 years old and married with six children. One of her children is still in school. Dolores works very hard to provide for them.

Dolores runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, cooking oil. etc.

Dolores has been in this business for 5 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, cooking oil etc to sell.

loans.name: Elvina

texts.en:
Elvina is a married woman. She is 59 years old with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Elvina has a buy-and-sell water refilling business in the Philippines. Elvina requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more gallons of water to sell.

Elvina has been in this business for 8 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of water to sell

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. 

Linet operates a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. She mentioned seasonality as a major challenge in her business.

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a married woman and has been blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. She and her husband live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a fish-selling business for the past one year, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces major challenges of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a married woman with two children and owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Josphine has operated a tailoring business for the past three years. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are both ladies and gents. She mentioned transportation as a major challenge in her business.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth, materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase cloth, materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Norlinda

texts.en:
Norlinda is 43-years-old and runs a small canteen inside one of the public schools in Caloocan City. She’s lucky to be granted a space inside the school because she considers the students as "captured customers". She is not the only one who has a slot inside the school. Several canteen operators are  present and compete with each other. Norlinda offers limited meal choices and a few snack items because she has inadequate capital. She requests 15,000 PHP to buy meat, fish, vegetables, frozen goods, and snack items to prepare more meal choices that entice students. It will surely boost her income and sustain meet daily expenses. 

She is married to Rodolfo who also works hard to support their five children (two attend college). The couple want their children to finish their college education and have better opportunities to earn a decent wage. Norlinda also aspires to run a big restaurant someday. She gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet  weekly to share stories of their life and business and to draw strength from the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy meat, fish, vegetables, frozen goods, and snack items.

loans.name: Mary Glory

texts.en:
Mary Glory is a 54-year-old married woman with three children who works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Glory has run a general store for 20 years and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future Mary Glory would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is a 49-year-old married woman with 5 children aged between the ages of 13 and 23. Two attend technical school. 

She has sold spare parts for 6  years. She requests a loan to cover school fees and she plans to pay in installments. After paying school fees, she plans to save more money.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees in  installments.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan has 5 children andworks hard to support her family.

She has a clothing retail business and earns additional income selling personal care products. Susan requests 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy pants, school uniforms, towesl, blouses, and other personal care products to sell to customers.

Susan has sustained her business  through 10 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy  pants, school uniforms, towels, blouses, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a 39-year-old married mother of three children, two in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rosalie has a frozen food retail business in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more frozen foods to sell.

Rosalie has been in this business for three years. In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Benny

texts.en:
Benny is a 47-year-old married woman with one child, who works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store for 15 years and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Benny has borrowed and repaid 25 previous loans from NWTF. She earns additional income from food vending.

Benny aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is  a married mother with six children who works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal  business and earns additional income from a general store. Ana is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more charcoal to resell.

Ana has sustained her business through 24 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Almira

texts.en:
Almira is 33 years old, married and has two children who are both in school. 

Almira is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Almira requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Almira has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Almira would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecillia is a married mother with twelve children, who works hard to support her family.

She has a rice business and earns additional income raising pigs. Cecilia is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy  rice to sell.

Cecilia has sustained her business through 8 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy rice and feed.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a 41-year-old married woman with three children, all  attend school.

Sharon works hard to provide for her family, has run a general store for 10 years, and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase groceries to sell.

Sharon has borrowed and repaid 2 previous loans from NWTF. She earns additional income selling frozen food.

Sharon aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida is 56 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, such as canned goods, personal care products, etc. 

Bienvenida has previously borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns income from fishing. Bienvenida aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store, such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 46 years old and married with five children, three in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jocelyn has been raising pigs for 10 years and earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona works hard to support herself. Chona is single and has a ready-to-wear clothing  business in the Philippines.

Chona requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more clothing to resell.

Chona has been in this business for seven years now and earns additional income from charcoal retailing.

In the future, Chona would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to resell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a 42-year-old married mother of five children, two in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Wilma has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell.

Wilma has been in this business for five years. In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 36 years old and is married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, such as canned goods, personal care products, etc. 

Marissa has previously borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 17 years and also earns income from raising livestock. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store, such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn works hard to support herself. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jenelyn requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

She has been in this business for five years now, and she earns additional income from fish vending. In the future, Jenelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Remia

texts.en:
Remia is 57 years old and married with one child. Remia works very hard to provide for her family.

Remia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Remia has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, shampoo, canned good, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future, Remia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Claudia Abigail

texts.es: Claudia de 33 años de edad, vive muy feliz al lado de su compañero de vida y su hijo de 6 años. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y dedicada en su labor que consiste en la venta de frutas y verduras alrededor de su comunidad, es de esa manera como se gana la vida  y brinda a su hijo lo necesario en la vivienda, además su compañero de vida aporta a la economía del hogar mediante los servicios de mecánico que desempeña en un taller cerca de la comunidad. Claudia solicita un crédito a FUSAI para poder invertir en más mercadería para su negocio, ella comprara frutas y verduras tales como: piña, sandia, melón, tomate, cebolla, papa entre otros productos que demandan sus clientes en su negocio. Claudia con el deseo y propósito de ampliar su negoció y obtener mayores ingresos económicos  espera contar con dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Claudia is 33 years old, she lives very happily with her life partner and their 6 year old son. She is a very hard working woman and dedicated to her work which consists of the sale of fruits and vegetables around her community. This is how she makes a living and provides her son with the necessities at home. Additionally, her partner contributes to the home's economy through the service as a mechanic which he performs in a shop near the community. 
Claudia is requesting the loan from FUSAI to be able to invest in more merchandize for her business. She will buy fruits and vegetables such as: pineapple, watermelon, melon, tomato, onion and potato amongst others which her business' clients demand.
Claudia, with the desire and purpose of expanding her business and obtaining better economic incomes, hopes to be able to receive said loan.

loans.use: purchase: pineapple, watermelon, melon, tomato, onion and potato amongst other which her business' clients demand.

loans.name: Novalyn

texts.en:
Novalyn is a 30-year-old married woman with three school-aged children who is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Novalyn has had a clothing business for 3 years and requests 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy clothing to sell.

In the future, Novalyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Shiary

texts.en:
Shiary is a 42-year-old married woman with two children who has raised pigs for 3 years. Shiary requests 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has borrowed 6 previous times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Shiary would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 58 years old and married. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Delia has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy more ready-to-wear clothing to resell.

Delia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Delia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothing to resell.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
Lorenza is a 71-year-old widow with 17 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Lorenza has a business making and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Lorenza requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her dried-fish business.

Lorenza has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Lorenza would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her dried fish business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 42-year-old married mother of five children, one in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Elizabeth has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Elizabeth would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Glorietta

texts.en:
Glorietta is a 53-year-old married mother of four children, one in school.

Glorietta is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Glorietta requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Glorietta has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Glorietta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is a 54-year-old married woman  with two children who works very hard to provide for them.

Estela has run a general store for 3 years and requests 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase groceries to sell.

She sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and noodles. 

In the future Estela would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen started a small  business and manages her bakery. She has inventory and is able to make a profit. She has  the only bakery in the area and sells delicious breads and pastries. 

She requests a loan from Paglaum to buy ingredients flour & other items. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to buy flour & other items.

loans.name: Retchel

texts.en:
Retchel is a 32-year-old married woman with one school-aged child.

Retchel has raised pigs for 3 years ad requests 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has previously borrowed 6 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Retchel would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a 59-year-old married woman with five children,  she works very hard to provide for them.

Violeta has run a general store for 31 years and requests 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase  milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, and bread.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase  milk, coffee, drinks, spices, canned goods, and bread.

loans.name: Jhaguas Pankarita Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JHAGUAS PANKARITA” iniciará el vigésimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nieves es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de artesanías en miniatura, venta de polleras, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de ropa deportiva.
	
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nieves es integrante, ella indica que hace nueve años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de artesanías en miniatura; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de su hermano.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de artesanías en miniatura por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta  el área de salud que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The “JHAGUAS PANKARITA” group will begin its twenty-second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Focal Center of Villa Exaltation. It is composed of eight members and is led by a board of directors on which Nieves is Treasurer. The businesses that the members of the communal bank run are varied; among them are: sales of miniature crafts, sales of traditional Andean skirts, sales of clothing, sales of cosmetics, sales of sportswear. 
	
The loan that they will take out will benefit women small microentrepreneurs of which Nieves is a member. She states that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for nine years, joining by way of an invitation from a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently she has a business selling miniature crafts; she discloses that she learned this business several years ago from her brother.
 
The loan that she will take out now is to increase the stock (wholesale purchase of miniature crafts) that she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and subsequently market in the fairs of the city of El Alto. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she lives in a common law marriage and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health services that the institution provides.

loans.use: buy miniature crafts wholesale.

loans.name: Roque

texts.es: Roque vive en una comunidad del Departamento de Santa Barbara, tiene 39 años, es casado y tiene 3 hijos y uno de ellos esta en edad escolar. el cultiva Cafe desde los 22 años y tiene mucha experiencia en esta actividad. uno de los mayores anelos de Roque es educar a sus hijos y que tengan la oportunidad de asistir a una Universidad cuando esten grandes. Roque quiere que sus hijas y esposa vivan en mejores condiciones por lo que solicita un prestamo para comprar de Soluz Honduras un sistema de energia solar que les permitira eliminar la forma tradicional de iluminarse que ademas de contaminar el ambiente, daña la salud de su familia, ademas podran recargar su telefono celular que por lo momentos debe viajar largas distancias para hacerlo.
texts.en:
Roque lives in a community in the state of Santa Barbara.  He is 39 years old, married with three children, one of which is of school age.  He has grown coffee since he was 22 years old and has much experience doing it.  One of Roque's greatest desires is to educate his children so that they have the opportunity to attend university when they are older.  

Roque wants his daughters and wife to live in better conditions which is why he is asking for a loan.  He will buy a solar energy system from Soluz Honduras which will allow them to no longer use the traditional way of lighting the house.  Besides not polluting, and not hurting the health of his family, they will be able to use it to charge their cell phone, instead of traveling long distances to do so as they have to now.

loans.use: to purchase a solar energy system to improve his living conditions at home.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: Pedro de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de ganado  de repasto desde hace 20 años, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de ganado de repasto para continuar con la crianza y así poder obtener mejores ingresos económicos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pedro is 42 years old and lives in his own home with his two children.  He has worked in agriculture and raising cattle for the last 20 years.  He sells his products in nearby towns and with his earnings he is able to pay some of the household expenses.

He is asking for the loan to purchase cattle to continue raising them.  In this way he will earn more income and attain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es: Lucia de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su tres hijos, ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado y también al cultivo de maíz tiene 6 años de dedicarse a la actividad agrícola y con las ganancias que obtiene de la venta de los productos logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ganado y así continuar con la crianza para tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Lucia is 31 years old and lives in her own home with her three children.  She has worked raising cattle and also growing corn for the last six years.  With the earnings that she receives from the sale of her products she is able to cover some household expenses.  

She is asking for a loan to purchase more cattle and in that way be able to continue raising them to have more economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Adelaida Elvia

texts.es:
ADELAIDA TIENE 53 AÑOS DE EDAD, SOLTERA, VIVE CON SUS PADRES, EN CASA FAMILIAR, EN UNA COMUNIDAD PEQUEÑA EN LA ZONA URBANA DE CAYALTI QUE PERTENECE A LA PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGION LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERÚ.

ADELAIDA SE DEDICA A LA ACTIVIDAD DE VENTA DE VERDURAS Y ABARROTES EN GENERAL, DESDE HACE MÁS DE 15 AÑOS DE ANTIGUEDAD EN EL NEGOCIO, EN UN MERCADO DEL DISTRITO DONDE VIVE, SOLICITA PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA Y DE ESTA MANERA HACER CRECER MAS SU NEGOCIO, OBTENER MÁS INGRESOS Y PODER MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA
texts.en:
Adelaida is 53 years old, is single and lives with her parents in the family home.  She lives in a small community in the urban area of Cayalti which is in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque on the north coast of Peru.  

Adelaida has sold vegetables and groceries in general for more than 15 years in a market where she lives.  

She is asking for the loan to purchase merchandise.  This will allow her to grow her business, obtain better income and be able to better her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 6 años, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en sacos como muestra la fotografía para luego venderlos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizares, herbicidas, etc. y así poder obtener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
The young man whose face is blurred is 26 years old and lives in a high risk zone.  He has grown corn for 6 years.  

When his crop is ready he bags it up as shown in the photo to then sell it in the surrounding areas of his home.  He lives in his own house with his family.

He is asking for the loan to purchase seeds, compost, fertilizer, herbicide and thus be able to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, fertilizer, herbicides etc.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma makes a living through her retailing business. She runs a sari-sari store in Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte and earns a promising income to support her family. She has signed up for her membership with PMPC to gain access of capitalization. She wants to increase her inventory. 

Now, she has availed a loan of PHP 10,000 to restock her sari-sari store with groceries and soft drinks for retail. Guillerma hopes to sustain her business and dreams to send all of her children to school.

loans.use: to restock her sari-sari store with groceries and soft drinks for retail.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is 67 years old, married and lives at Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City. He avails a loan of PHP 36,000.00 for his medical check up. 

He hopes for a better partnership with the Cooperative knowingly the coop supports his various financial needs.

loans.use: to pay for his medical check up

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Elizabeth was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. 

Recently, she took a loan of PHP 10,000 to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to purchase commodities like canned goods, noodles, soy sauce, oil and detergent soap.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 49 years old, married and has five children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Merlita requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers.

Merlita has been farming vegetable for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Merlita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Chuchi

texts.en:
Chuchi is 57 years old and married with three children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Chuchi is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig.

Chuchi has been in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from general store and farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en:
Thoeurn and wife are farmers (both in the picture standing in-front of their house) living in Taing Khlai Village with 4 children. Beside his and his wife income, his oldest daughter also contributes her salary to family too. He wants to get up early morning and go back late to spend more time on work; however, it is a challenge for him because his house doesn’t have enough energy to generate light. He has to get up when the sun raises high enough to see thing clearly and go back home early before the road is too dark to go. 

As a result, he decided to apply for KIVA to buy solar home systems. He believes he will have enough energy for his family usage and also improve his working hours.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system

location.town: Taing Khlai Village, Svay Chirj commune, Samaki Me

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is applying for a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She is a businesswoman and is selling gasoline. She started to do this business in 2011 with her own working capital of $200. Maria is earning a good income from selling her gasoline because many people like to buy it, and also she lives near the main road so many people come to buy her gasoline every day. She is happy to do her business because it's become her activity.

loans.use: To buy gasoline.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San, an 52 years old man with 4 children, earns a living by farming in Chrok Sangke village. Spending day and time rising 4 children, he wants to have a comfortable life. Currently his 2 children has stared working as a salary workers while he is still keeping on farming and helps his children business. 

San wants to save utility fee and time on using car battery. He needs to recharge battery every week. Seeing the difficulty of using car battery,San's children recommend him to buy solar home system. As a result, San decided to apply for KIVA to buy solar home energy. He believes solar home energy can enhance his living lifestyle in a comfortable condition.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system

location.town: Chrok Sangke Village, Svay Chhouk Commune, Samaki

loans.name: Marta

texts.en:
Marta live in Liquisa and she is a business women.  A $1000.00 is offered to Marta to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as sugar, sardines, noodles, soy sauce, aqua, rice, batteries, tea, hand body lotions, Including soft drinks and other things to sell. 

She has been involving herself in business activities 8 month ago, with her own working capital of $ 500.00. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Marta independent because she can be responsible for her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, sardines, noodles, soy sauce, aqua, rice, batteries, tea, hand body lotions, Including soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and a toilet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Olinda Patricia
