texts.es: Olinda de 31 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella es empleada en un laboratorio clínico y también posee una tienda desde hace 4 años, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y de sus ventas logra salir adelante con su hijo, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando las puertas y encementando el pisto, pero como no posee de suficiente capital está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de las puertas y pago de mano de obra y así ella y su hijo puedan vivir más seguros.
texts.en:
Olinda is 31 years old and a single mother. She lives in her own house with her son and works in a clinical laboratory. She has also owned a shop for four years and, with her earnings from her job and the shop's sales, she manages to get ahead with her son.

She wants to improve her home by fitting doors and cementing the floor but, as she doesn't have enough capital, she is requesting a loan to buy materials to make doors and pay workers. In this way Olinda and her son will be able to live in greater security.

loans.use: to buy materials to make doors and pay workers.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is 49 years old, married, and lives at Celso Village, Doña Josefa, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities.  Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost five years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to PHP 12,000 for the purchase of new nets.  

As much as possible, they have to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch.  She already has floaters to help guard their fish cages.  She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors, so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market where they will fetch higher prices.  In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales.  She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase  new nets.

loans.name: Luminada

texts.en:
Luminada is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 57, a married woman in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, she runs a snack-vending business that primarily supports her family. Every day, she never gets tired of tending her store. 

Luminada is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her loans without record of default. Now she has borrowed another loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase ingredients like sugar, milk, oil and flour for her snack-vending business. Having enough ingredients would mean income opportunities. 

In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like sugar, milk, oil and flour for her snack-vending business

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma, 72 years old, is married and a resident of Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Her husband is a vegetable farmer. The vegetables he harvests are sold to the public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years already. Since she wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing coco land for copra production.

In 2009 both Thelma and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to avail themselves of a loan because they wanted to buy the coco land nearby. But in addiiton to the financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings. She has now applied for a loan of PHP 15,000 to pay the labor cost for clearing the coco land farm. She wishes that with Paglaum’s help, and with the patience and diligence of her husband, she can look forward to being a successful farmer.

loans.use: to pay the labor cost for clearing the coco land farm.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena manages her food-vending business in Tabon, Jose Dalman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She has mastered the business since she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. It has been doing well, supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and would also accept catering for added income. 

Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase more meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more meat and spices for her eatery business

loans.name: Bertilia

texts.en:
Bertilia is a strong-willed woman who pushes her abilities when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family. 

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. In addition to her project of concreting the pig pens, she is thinking of adding pig heads for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed

loans.name: Alex Rodrigo

texts.es:
Alex es un hombre de 25 años, soltero, vive en un sector rural alejado de la ciudad de Latacunga provincia de Cotopaxi en este lugar la gente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales ya que en este sector es apto por su clima favorable, la gente es muy solidaria, trabajadora, emprendedora y unida.
Alex es propietario de un criadero de cuyes de raza desde hace varios años, a pesar de su corta edad es muy dedicado a su trabajo y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante es por esta razón que solicita el crédito para comprar vacas lecheras y asi de esta manera  aumente sus ingresos.
Alex agradece a KIVA por permitirle realizar sus sueños y crecer laboralmente.
texts.en:
Alex, 25, is a single man who lives in a rural area that is alienated from the city of Latacunga, in the province of Cotopaxi. In this area, people raise and sell animals for a living since this sector is suitable for its favorable climate. The people are supportive, hard-working and united.

Alex has been the owner of a purebred guinea pig farm for several years. Despite his young age, he is very dedicated to his work and he has high hopes of getting ahead. This is why he is requesting the loan to buy milking cows so that he can increase his income.

Alex is grateful to Kiva for allowing him to realize his dreams and to grow at work.

loans.use: to buy milking cows so he can increase his income and diversify his business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de semillas de marañón asadas, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 3 años ya tiene clientes fijos, el joven vive con su madre en casa propia, el está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para comprar más semillas de marañón por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así seguir ayudando en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
The young man whose faces is blurred in the photo is 28 years old and lives in a high-risk area. He has been earning his living selling roasted cashew nuts and has been and in this business for three years.  He already has an established clientele. He lives with his mother in their own home. 

He is again requesting a loan in order to buy more cashew nuts at wholesale, as that is his only source of employment, and in this way continue helping with the household expenses.

loans.use: To buy cashews nuts at wholesale.

loans.name: Maksudjon

texts.en:
Maksudjon is a hardworking man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1970. He is living in rural area with his family. He is married and has three children. His wife is a housekeeper and she helps him in the household. Maksudjon is a goal orientated, honest and hardworking man. He does business in agriculture and plants agricultural products on their land and keeps livestock. 

Unfortunately, last season was bad to gain well harvest and he was bankrupt. He decided to buy a tractor  and work at a collective farm and other agricultural sector. He wants to serve farmers in gaining and processing their land. 

His tractor is broken. He needs to repair it in order to continue his work. He wishes to work hard to ensure his family will have a better standard of living. He is asking a loan from IMON and Kiva to repair his car. His car is the tool of his work. He awaits Kiva lenders kindness.

loans.use: to repair his tractor to provide income for his family

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
This borrower’s name is Albert. He is 20 years old, a resident of Silang, Cavite Province, in the Philippines. To earn a living and fulfill his responsibilities to his life partner, he decided to provide tricycle transportation services. A responsible young man, he aims to keep his promise to work hard for the family’s future. Albert has been operating a tricycle for two years. His tricycle will carry up to four passengers. 

In the Philippines, especially in places like Silang, the tricycle is a common means of transportation. Jeepneys (a special form of collective transportation vehicle in the Philippines) and buses are limited. Very few people own vehicles. The townspeople usually ride a tricycle from their homes to market, to church, to their friends’ homes and to other destinations within their community. They even provide transport services between towns.  

Albert humbly asks for financial assistance in the form of a PHP 8,000 loan to pay for his tricycle maintenance. It is important that his unit always be in good running condition, to ensure efficient service and a steady income. He is thanks God, and you, in advance for your support, as this will help him sustain his service and earn a living. Albert plans to acquire another tricycle unit to grow his transportation business. He prays for God's mercy in all his trips and asks for prosperity in all his endeavors. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on the tricycle he uses to provide transportation services.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 48 years old, married, and has three children who are in school. Gemma works very hard to provide for them. She runs a business selling spare parts in the Philippines, and she applied for a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of spare parts to sell. Gemma has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is 68 years old, a widow with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them. Fe runs a business of direct sales of personal collection and Avon products in the Philippines, and she applied for a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell. Fe has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Faalua

texts.en:
Faalua is 36 years old and married with 3 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as snacks,,noodles,tin fish, freezer goods,soft drinks etc. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Faalua needs a loan to buy a display freezer,toiletries,snacks,freezer good,etc. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business and to support her family as well. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a display freezer, toiletries, snacks,goods,etc

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es: Marta de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace 8 años e inicio con capital propio, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulantes por las diferentes colonias, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Marta is 39 years old and lives in her own house with family members. She has worked selling personal products for the last 8 years, which she started doing using her own money. Her business is located in her home, and she also sells by vending to different neighborhoods. With what she earns from her sales, she is able to succeed.

She is seeking a loan to buy wholesale perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoos, deodorants, etc., to be able to continue with her work to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale perfumes, lotions, creams, shampoos, deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Lola

texts.en: Lola is a cheerful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan to a family of workers. She is a widow and has one child. For almost 15 years, she has been trading in traditional men’s wear and hats. She is capable, goal-oriented, wise and an honest person. She has good experience with doing business in the market. She has regular clients among both residents and outsiders. She is planning to broaden her business, in order to get enough income to feed her family. She is applying for financial support from Kiva and IMON to buy additional fabrics and other items, in order to sew traditional men’s coats and hats to sell in the market. She hopes for your support and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other items to use in sewing traditional men’s coats and hats to sell in the market.

loans.name: 01 Lạch Trường Hải Lộc - Big Scallops Group

texts.en:
Mrs Xuân is 33 years old and she is married.   She has worked in agriculture raising marine aquaculture for 4 years.
Xuân lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 
The main hardship that Xuân faces is lack of capital.  

Although this is Thịnh first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, every members agreed to vote her to be the leader of "01 Lạch Trường Hải Lộc - Big scallops" group. She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies to raise scallops for sale.

With her business profit, Xuân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to raise scallops for sale

loans.name: Rahbarniso

texts.en:
Rahbarniso is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1967. She is married and has two children and her husband is a constructor. She has ten years practice doing business in agriculture. She knows well her activity and likes to work hard. She plants cereal and vegetables in her field. 

Beside her duty she works at school; she is a teacher of math. Agricultural business helps her to ensure their family. She wants to gain a good harvest this season and decided to process her land and fertilize it. She appealed to IMON and asked a loan to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals to process her field to obtain a good harvest. She is willing to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals to process her field to obtain a good harvest

loans.name: Tereista

texts.en:
Teresita is responsible and dedicated in her work as a tailor. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life and being allowed to be independent. There she has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive knowingly she is separated from her husband. 

She applied for a loan in order to expand her business and increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her generate more income and be able to cater tailoring services.

loans.use: buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies to make school uniforms

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 51 years old and married with two children, one of whom in school, Cynthia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell .

Cynthia has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Cynthia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Marygn

texts.en:
Marygn, a 39-year-old married mother of three children, all of whom are in school, works hard to provide for her family. For eight years she has operated a charcoal-selling business in the Philippines, and also earns an income from a general store. 

Marygn has borrowed and repaid four previous loans from NWTF and is now requesting a PHP 13000 loan to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong is from  Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 51 years old and lives in a wooden house with with her husband (who is also a weaver) and her son, who is still studying. Her 3 other children are already working and/or married. Her family owns 1.5 hectares of cassava fields. 

In 2001 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Kong makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for the family expenses, to buy diesel and fertilizer for the fields and to extend her lending business. 

Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves !

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol works hard to support her family. Marisol is married and has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dry goods to sell.

Marisol has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Marisol would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is 47 years old, married, and has eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and applied for a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, including canned goods, chips, milk, coffee, and eggs. Elsa has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns additional income by growing vegetables. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store, including canned goods, chips, milk, coffee, and eggs.

loans.name: Lolok

texts.en:
Lolok is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 19 years old. She lives in a wooden pile house  with her parents and her younger brother. She is a young and very motivated weaver. Her family owns 7 hectares of rice fields, 1.5 hectares of cassava fields and 8 pigs. In 2013 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong,  a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. 

Lolok makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and to help her mother pay for animal food, fertilizer and diesel for the field. 

Most importantly, she  wants to make her family business grow thanks to her salary. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Mohbi

texts.en:
Mohbi is a wise woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in to a family of farmers. She is married. She is an older, but has enough strength willingness and power to work in agriculture. She likes to plant and take care about her land. She has an experience working at collective farm as a director. 

Recently, she has land where she plants agricultural products as vegetables and cereal. She applied to IMON and Kiva asking a loan to buy fertilizer, to pay for tractor and rental workers. She is willing to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders compassion.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, to pay for tractor and rental workers

loans.name: N2Thtiến22 Qnham - Funny Women Group

texts.en:
Mrs Sen is 53 years old and she is married.  She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for more than 10 years.
Sen lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this region often suffered by natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. 
The main hardship that Sen faces is lack of capital.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.
In 2012, Sen joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Sen has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Sen hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Hermosilla

texts.en: Hermosilla is 61 years old and a widow. She lives in Maras, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. For the past twenty years, Hermosilla has been a farmer. She earns PHP 6,000.00 each month and is a new member of PMPC. Hermosilla is requesting a 4,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Desida

texts.en:
Desida is 41 years old, married with three children, who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell.

Desida has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from flower shop.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Gulzada

texts.ru: Гулзада, 42 года, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, на протяжении 12 лет она занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы и 17 овец. На 0,20 Га земли выращивает картофель для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулзада планирует вложить в увеличение бизнеса и постройку сараев.
texts.en: Gulzada is 42 years old. She is married and she is raising three children. She has a secondary education. She has been rearing animals and growing crops for 12 years. On her farm she has three cows and 17 sheep. She grows potatoes for sale on 0.2 hectares of land. In order to develop her business further, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to increase the size of her herd. Gulzada plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in growing her business and building barns.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Kalicha

texts.ru: Калича, 48 лет, замужем, воспитывает 5 дочерей, образование - высшее, работает учителем математики. С 2004 года она занимается сельским хозяйством. У Каличи есть 90 овец, ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 19,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Калича планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Kalicha is 48 years old, married, and is raising five daughters. She has a higher education and works as a mathematics teacher. She has engaged in agriculture since 2004. Kalicha has 90 sheep, and her monthly profit is about 19,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy some sheep to increase the size of her flock. Kalicha plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy some sheep in order to increase her flock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Santos Yaneth

texts.es: Santos Yaneth de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz tiene 6 años de dedicarse a la actividad agrícola la cual inicio con capital propio cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra en la fotografía para luego comercializarlos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, gracias a su trabajo es como puede salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, entre otras cosas que necesita para su cosecha y asi poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Santos Yaneth is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She works in agriculture planting corn. She has been doing this for 6 years and she started this activity with her own money. When her harvest is ready, she stores it in the granaries shown in the photograph and then sells them around the area where she lives. 

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control products and weed-killer among others, which she needs for her crop and this way have more income.

loans.use:
compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, entre otras cosas 
to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control products, weed-killers, among other items.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en: Dilbar is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1979. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has two children. She is an honest, hardworking, and goal-oriented person. She has many years of practice working at land and keeping livestock helping her parents. Recently, her husband helps her do to business. She wants to gain a good income from her business in order to ensure her children with an education provider (school and university) in the future. She is planning to enlarge her business and buy additional livestock. She is requesting a loan to buy livestock. She hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to enlarge her business and buy additional livestock

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 31 years old and married with two children.

Susan works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, breads, and other personal care products.

Susan has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Susan aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, breads, and other personal care products

loans.name: Fenna

texts.en:
Fenna is divorced with five schoolgoing children. They live in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a Khanga (women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business. In addition she also operates a soap-selling business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khangas for resale

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a divorced woman and has four children whom all attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past past years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
Sophy’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sophy does work as tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Suubi Development Group Bweya

texts.en:
Simeon is a new client of Ugafode microfinance ltd. He is a single father of 3 children  He is practicing agriculture where he grows food crops on a small scale majorly for his family use and usually sells the surplus to earn an income. 

In a bid to increase his income/expand his business, he has applied for a loan of 500,000/= to help him buy improved and fast growing seedlings.  These he anticipates will increase his output and sales. He dreams of expanding his plantation and being able to earn more income that will help him to adequately meet his family needs. 

Simeon is very grateful for the support Ugafode microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to his since she is now able to fund his business.
The extra person front row(left) is the UGAFODE credit staff in charge of the group.

loans.use: to buy improved and fast growing seedlings for his agriculture business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a widow, 79 years old. She is known in Ramon Magsaysay, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte as a retired public school teacher. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the co-op offers.

She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, so she applied for a loan of PHP 50,000 to to purchase bags of cement and plywood and to pay for labor for renovating her house.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and plywood and to pay for labor for renovating her house

loans.name: Juana Mirian

texts.es: Doña Juana de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de empanadas (pastelitos de plátano con leche y azúcar) y plátanos desde hace 32 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de plátanos por mayor, leche, azúcar entre otros ingredientes para la elaboración de los alimentos  y poder continuar con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Juana, aged 60, lives in her own home with her family. 

For 32 years, she has been earning a living by selling empanadas (a small pastry turnover made with plantains, milk, and sugar) and plantains. Her business is located at her home, and she has many customers. With the profits from her sales, she manages to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan to buy plantains wholesale, milk, and sugar, among other ingredients, to make her food. In this way, she will be able to continue with her sales so that she can have a better income.

loans.use: to buy plantains wholesale, milk, and sugar, among other ingredients.

loans.name: Ciriaco Antonio

texts.es: Ciriaco un hombre de 53 años de edad vive junto a su esposa en la pequeña vivienda que con mucho esfuerzo construyo hace 15 años, por lo que se siente muy feliz de poder disfrutar de su casita. Ciriaco se caracteriza por su espíritu trabajador y que siempre pone todo su empeño, sobre todo cuando presta sus servicios de seguridad de una empresa cercana desde hace 5 años. Desde hace unos días a Ciriaco se le han presentado problemas en su vivienda ya que el piso de él corredor de su casa es de tierra y con las lluvias y el agua que se filtra forma masas de lodo en la entrada de su vivienda y corre el peligro él y su esposa de sufrir un accidente, es por ello que está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, chispa y ladrillo de piso para encementar el piso de la entrada de su vivienda, de esta manera evitar algún futuro accidente que puedan lamentar espera de la aprobación de su crédito para mejorar sus vivienda.
texts.en: Ciriaco is a 53 year old man who lives with his wife in the small home that with a lot of effort, he constructed 15 years ago, and for this reason, he feels very happy to be able to enjoy his home.  Ciriaco is known for his hard-working spirit and for always putting everything into his endeavors, above all at his employment providing security for a nearby business, where he's worked for the past 5 years.  For some time, Ciriaco has had some problems with his home, since the floor of the entrance to his home is made of dirt and with the rainfall, the water forms lots of mud at the entrance and he and his wife run the risk of suffering an accident.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and floor bricks to cement the floor of the entrance of his home, and in this way, avoid any future accident that could hurt them.  He is waiting for the approval of his loan to improve his home.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and floor bricks to cement the floor of the entrance of his home.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married woman, 45 years old, with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Emily has a dried fish-making business in the Philippines. Emily requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish, sacks of salt, and other materials for her business.

Emily has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, sacks of salt, and other materials for her business

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Michelle is 34 years old and has two children are currently in school.

Michelle has a buy-and-sell dry goods business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks of dry goods to sell.

Michelle has been in this business for one year. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Jimrel Rodolf

texts.en:
Jimrel Rodolf wants to fulfill his dreams and complete a degree. He religiously pays attention to earning good marks every semester. For another school year, Jimrel Rodolf is in need of a loan to pay for his school fees.

Jimrel Rodolf has big dreams to help his family and his siblings as well, which is the reason why he works hard for his education

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee

loans.name: Reyna Cecilia

texts.es: Reyna de 29 años de edad quien habita en vivienda propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 5, 9 y 14 años de edad. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora quien con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación a sacado adelante a su familia brindándoles los insumos básico necesarios, ya que cuenta con un comedor con el cual ella genera sus ingresos y  al que llegan numerosos clientes que la conocen y la recomiendan por ser muy amable con las personas. Reyna desea mantener su negocio por mucho tiempo es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tomates, cebollas, arroz, frijoles, bebidas frías, queso, harina, etc.
texts.en: Reyna is 29 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their three children, ages 5, 9 and 14.  She is a very hard-working woman who with a lot of effort and dedication has helped her family get ahead, giving them the basic necessities.  She has a small cafe, through which she earns her income, where numerous customers come and recommend her business because she is kind and friendly to people.  Reyna has wanted to maintain her business for some time and that is why she is requesting a loan with FUSAI to invest in tomatoes, onions, rice, beans, cold beverages, cheese, flour, etc.

loans.use: to invest in tomatos, onions, rice, beans, cold beverages, cheese, flour that she will use in her business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 47 years old, married, and lives at Pangalalan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is managing her hog fattening business together with her husband. She has been in this business for eight years. Through this business, she is able to sustain her family's needs and send her children to school. 

Recently, she availed herself of a loan of PHP 14,900 to buy bags of animal feeds for her hog fattening business. PMPC is a blessing to Lilia because she can rely on the cooperative's services that help small-scale backyard hog farmers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma, 47 years old, is known in the Datu Tangkilan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte area for her sari-sari (convenience) store. She actively participates in the various programs and services that PMPC offers. Wilma has applied for a loan to purchase varied commodities like consumable goods, detergent and beauty soaps, shampoo and other goods to sell. Wilma wishes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase varied commodities like consumable goods, detergent and beauty soaps, shampoo and other goods to sell.

loans.name: Ailene

texts.en:
Ailene is a hard-working woman entrepreneur with two children.

She earns a living by pig-raising in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional sacks of feed to sell.

She supplements this income with earnings from her motorcycle transport business.

Ailene dreams that, one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed to sell.

loans.name: Dilbarhan

texts.ru: Дилбархан, 54 года, замужем, мать 3 детей. Образование-высшее. Дилбархан на протяжении многих лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Дилбархан знает чего хочет и старается добиваться всего своими силами. Благодаря своей трепетной работе и ответственности на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве есть 8 коров, 8 овец. На 0,50 Га растет клевер.  Ежемесячная прибыль семьи составляет 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Дилбархан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья скота.  Доходы от кредита Дилбархан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение ее бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en: Dilbarhan is 54 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She has a higher education. Dilbarhan has been engaged in agriculture for many years. Dilbarhan knows what she wants and strives to achieve everything with her own efforts. Thanks to her careful work and responsibility, today she has eight cows and eight sheep. She grows clover on 0.5 hectares of land. The family's monthly profit is about 8,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Dilbarhan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock to increase the size of her herd. Dilbarhan plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further increasing her business and renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy some livestock to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: fishing nets and labor to repair the ones that he has that are damaged and this way obtain a larger quantity of products.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 34 years old, married, and she has three children. 

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Beverly requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional sacks of feed.

Beverly has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Beverly would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 50 years old, with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, and shampoo.

Letecia has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from a boarding house.

She aspires to repair and renovate her boarding house.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, and shampoo.

loans.name: Unidas Para El Exito Group

texts.es: La Sra. Irma de 50 años de edad, es conviviente con el Sr. Joel con quien tiene 4 hijos pero solo 2 dependen aun de ellos. Irma tiene el cargo de presidenta de la alcancía comunal “Unidas Para El Éxito” conformada por 7 personas muy responsables que decidieron trabajar en equipo. Ella se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir como chompas, polos, chalinas, etc que ella misma atiende en casa y así de esta forma ayuda en la economía del hogar. El préstamo lo invertirá para la compra de materiales (hilos, lanas, telas, etc) que necesita para atender los servicios que solicitan sus clientes. Su plan a futuro es poder comprar otras herramientas de trabajo para poder implementar su taller de confecciones en su propia casa para así brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. En la foto grupal Irma esta parada en medio de las demás personas sentadas.
texts.en:
Irma is 50 years old and is in a common-law marriage with, Joel. They have four children, but only two of them are still dependent on them. Irma serves as the president of the the communal bank, "Unidas para el Éxito" ["United for Success"], which consists of seven very responsible people who decided to work as a team. She makes her living making articles of clothing like jackets, t-shirts, scarves, etc., which she sells from her home. In this way, she helps with the household budget. 

She will invest the loan in the purchase of supplies (thread, wool, fabric, etc.) that she needs to provide her customers with the services that they request. Her plan for the future is to be able to buy other tools of the trade so that she can open a sewing workshop in her home to provide a better quality of life for her family. In the group photo, Irma is one who is standing in the middle of the seated group.

loans.use: to buy supplies, like thread, wool, and fabric.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle, is aged 36, married and they're blessed with three children. She owns and manages a retail store in their village for almost 7 years and earns a net income of PHP 300 daily.

 Due to insufficient capital in her business she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase sugar, coffee, chips, breads, biscuits, canned goods, candies, noodles, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, coffee, chips, breads, biscuits, canned goods, candies, noodles, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon was encouraged that she was granted a 10000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. She is so happy that with her earnings she was able to send her two elementary children to school and fund their everyday needs.

As a working mother, Corazon faces a lot of challenges. She manages their household, takes care of her children and operates her store. But she tackles all her responsibilities with joy and patience in her heart. She sees to it that her children are taken cared of while she runs her store smoothly.   

Corazon would like to ask for a financial assistance of 15000 to fill up her store with grocery items like instant noodles, canned goods, bread, beverages and frozen foods. She wants to make sure that her store offers almost all essential food items to compete with other stores nearby. She is thanking God and you in advance for your support in her livelihood.

Corazon's simple dream is to grow her business and see her children become professionals someday. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies . 

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more quantities of grocery items to sell at retail.

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab is 55 years old. He lives in Kobuleti with his wife and son. Merab is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a plot of agricultural land and grows maize and potatoes. Merab is very hardworking man and does his best to insure in a good harvest. Merab decided to start husbandry business alongside agricultural activities. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan for purchasing a cow. As the cow is purchased the family will start producing dairy products and they will be able to increase the income.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to start a dairy business

loans.name: Hatu

texts.en:
Hatu  is 60 years old; she is a married woman and deals in a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 30000  to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema is 44 years old, a married woman doing a business of animals’ purchase and sale with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 5 children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

She has requested a loan of 30000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria works hard to support her family. Victoria is married with one child and has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Victoria requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like clothes, shoes, and bags.

Victoria has been in this business for two years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like clothes, shoes, and bags.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 45 years old and married with five children who are all in school, Vilma works very hard to provide for her family.

Vilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, and drinks.

Vilma has been in this business for five years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, and drinks.

loans.name: Merson

texts.en:
Merson is 23 years old. His family lives at Solana. He had a young child. 

To gain income and support needs of his family, he buys and sells fish. He sells fish at nearby villages using his motorcycle as transportation. He had been in his business for about two years. 

He is now asking for additional capital to invest in his business. He is asking for P20,000 to buy more fish to sell. Additional revenue gain will be used for the family's emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Mahfizahon

texts.en:
Mahfizahon is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1995 and is single and lives with her family. She has three years practice doing business, serving Tajik women with traditional women clothing. 

She is planning to buy a sewing machine to sew embroidering design on to men’s national costume. She is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine. She is hoping to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders compassion. 

Her business helps her to help her parents with finance.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for making men and women's national costumes and supporting her parents

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy oil, basic grains, toilet paper, milk, eggs, etc. at wholesale.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar is 31 years old and lives in Kakamega. He is married and support six people in his family together with his wife.

He operates a motorcycle transport, a business he has been doing for the last two years. 

He will use the loan to purchase a new motorcycle to serve more customers and make more income to provide for the needs of his family. He will use the anticipated profit to maintain his business and support his family.

His dream is to have a stable business so as to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle to serve more customers and make more income to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.name: Leovigilda

texts.en:
Leovigilda is encouraged and thankful for receiving financial aid to sustain and grow her food stall business. Through her business earnings she is able to support herself and assist her parents. 

She is humbly asking for a PHP 25,000 loan to provide working capital for her food stall. This will help her to maintain her business and prepare all the meals she serves. She is praising and thanking God for your support of her livelihood. 

Leovigilda's simple dream is to have a place of her own in a commercial area. She prays that God will always bless her efforts with success. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.en:
Clarisa works hard to support her family. Clarisa is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy flour, sugar, eggs and other ingredients for her food production business.

Clarisa has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Clarisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, eggs and other ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ma. Judea

texts.en:
Ma. Judea is 45 years old, married with four children, two of whom in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Ma. Judea has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buy and sell rice.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like tailoring.

Regina dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ciony

texts.en:
Ciony is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her business.

Ciony has been in this business for five years. Ciony earns additional income from buying and selling nipa roofing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 36 years married with 4 children. Henry is a primary school teacher and also does retail trading as another source of income. He also does tree planting to protect the environment. Henry has managed to look after his family using the income from those resources.

He has applied for a loan of ugx 1,200,000shs to boost his retail shop by buying more stock for trade in order to meet his customer’s needs. 
 
His dream is to own the biggest shop in his region. He believes with continous financial boost his dream will soon come to pass.

He is honest and hardworking.

loans.use: To restock the retail shop

loans.name: Eteri

texts.en:
Eteri is 25 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and son. 

Eteri is unemployed and wants to start a trading business. The startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan to purchase clothes and linens. Eteri will purchase products from wholesalers and will resell at a higher price. This will give her a chance to generate income and improve the living conditions of her family. Eteri hopes that the business will be profitable.

loans.use: to begin trading clothes and linens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers for his coffee plantation

loans.name: Areli Brillid

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.
En este lugar vive la señora Areli, tiene 21 años de edad,  mantiene una relación de unión libre y  de esta relación tienen una hija de  3 años de edad. Su marido es albañil.
Doña Areli es una  mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido a sacar adelante su hogar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, sale tres  o cuatro días por semana ya sea en la mañanas o tardes, aprovecha cuando su mamá le cuida a su pequeña aunque en ocasiones le toca llevarla a sus recorridos, ella también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando quieren alguna prenda, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada 8 o 15 días. Tiene 3 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Lleva más de 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos mejora su negocio. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su pequeña.
texts.en:
The Maria Del Carmen Credit Group meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, known for the famous shawl straw hats. It is a city with a mild climate and with many tourist attractions in the zone. Areli, 21, lives in this place. She is in a common law marriage, from which she has a 3 year old daughter. Her husband is a mason. 

Areli is a woman who likes to work to help her husband press on with the needs of the household. She makes a living selling clothing of all kinds. She sells door to door three or four days per week either in the mornings or afternoons. She benefits when her mom takes care of her little one, although at times she takes her along on her route. She also sells from her house, where her customers come when they want an item of clothing. She sells on credit to her customers and collects every week or two. She has spent 3 years doing this work with which she earns something for the welfare of her family. She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing. She has spent more than 2 years in the credit group and likes it because with the loans she improves her business. 

Her dream is to give the best to her little one.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Retailing helped Virginia survive for the family. She retails basic commodities like canned goods, condiments and other items that bring in a meager income of PHP 6,000 per month. She found that the business of buying and selling basic commodities is a good business because this is what the families need.

Virginia plans to expand her retailing business. She applied to PMPC for a loan to raise the needed capital. She wants to restock her sari-sari store with canned goods, oil, soy sauce, detergent, and shampoo for retail.

Virginia smiles at the fact that all of her children live a comfortable life despite the fact that she raises them alone.

loans.use: to restock her sari-sari store with canned goods, oil, soy sauce, detergents, and shampoo

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en: Sherly is 39 years old from Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She has two children, one is in high school and the other one is an infant. She is operating a sari-sari store that gives her meager income of PHP 4,500 per month. Her husband works as a driver in a construction company. Recently, she avails a loan of PHP 5,000.00 to restock her store with commodities like detergent, shampoo, condiments and canned goods.

loans.use: to restock store with commodities like detergent, shampoo, condiments, and canned goods

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es: Maria Yolanda tiene 19 años de edad tiene un hijo de 2 años, vive en Guaranda provincia de Bolivar, Ella se dedica a la venta de legumbres y solicita el crédito para capital de trabajo para la compra de legumbres en mas cantidad ya que le saldria mas económico y poder vender, asi mejorar la economia, realiza las compras cada semana en Riobamba, su sueño es mejorar su negocio y en su tiempo libre le gusta pasar junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Yolanda is 19 years old and has a two-year-old son. She lives in Guaranda, in the province of Bolivar. She makes a living through the sale of legumes. 


She is requesting the loan for working capital: to purchase vegetables in big quantities, as it would be cheaper and after selling them her economy will improve. She purchases her stock each week in Riobamba and her dream is to improve her business. In her free time, she likes spending time with her family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables in big quantities

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a repeat customer who has previously benefitted from Kiva funding and is very appreciative of the services and the trust that the lenders have accorded him and fellow beneficiaries. He is slowly beginning on the journey to expand his plantation.

Denis is an agriculturalist who deals in farming and he specializes in coffee growing. He also operates a BODA-BODA business as an additional source of income, Denis has been able to provide for his family with the basic necessities; however his major challenge is paying school fees. 

Denis is applying for a loan of ugx2,100,000shs to buy organic fertilizer and other farm inputs for his coffee plantation.

Denis’s dream is to be the leading supplier of quality coffee seeds in his region.

He is honest and hardworking.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a single woman with three children. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and wheat flour. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize  flour, beans and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: This loan will be used to buy and build a bathroom at their home to improve the access to sanitation and a water source.

loans.name: Deceria

texts.en: Deceria operates a sari-sari store in her place. She is separated with 1 child. Aside from operating a sari-sari store, she also cook snacks which is being delivered to different schools. Recently, she avails a loan of PHP 10,000.00 to restock sari-sari store with commodities like biscuits, milk, sugar, and bottled beverages Deceria believes that Paglaum MPC can help her with her financial needs for her business, so she keeps her records with no defaults.

loans.use: to restock sari-sari store with commodities like biscuits, milk, sugar, and bottled beverages

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.en:
Peregrina is a businesswoman in Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is married and a microfinance member of PMPC. She runs a buy and sell business of various sea foods like crabs and shrimps. Running this type of business has supported her family, especially in the education of her children. 

Recently, she applied for a loan of PHP 14,900.00 to purchase more stocks of crabs and shrimps. Peregrina believes having enough inventory would allow her to cater to her customers' needs. She is thankful that she has signed up for membership with PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: to purchase crabs and shrimps for buy and sell business

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda  is 58 years old residing at Calamba, Mis.Occ. She is married and blessed with children. She joined PMPC in order to access the programs and services of the said coop. 

Recently, she's accessing her 9th loan in the amount of PHP 15,000.00 for additional working capital of her existing business to buy variety of commodities which is selling a variety of food products in the local community.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with five children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge with transportation in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase beans, maize, rice, maize flour and wheat for resale. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase beans, maize, rice, maize flour and wheat for resale.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a married mother of three children, two of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 30,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. She has operated a farming business for the past three years. She mentioned transportation as a challenge in her business.

With the loan, she wants to invest in her farming business. Janet plans to purchase seeds and fertilizer to do farming for her business.  

She decided to join Yehu to improve her family's living standards

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer to do farming

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida lives with her son in Lukashin Village in Armavir Region, Armenia. They work hard on their farm cultivating wheat, barley and tomatoes. Aida and her son also have an orchard where 210 plum trees are grown. 

To be able to invest in her farming business, Aida asks for this loan from you. She plans to purchase fertilizer, natural pesticides for crop cultivation and also pay rent for land. This will help her a lot to maintain the farm and earn a living.  

This is Aida's second loan. Unfortunately the first loan, which she got from local financial institutions, was very difficult to pay back, and Aida faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, Aida and her son have been able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

Aida has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The Second Chance Loan Program provides loans to people who have bad credit history and no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, natural pesticides for crop cultivation and also pay rent for land.

loans.name: Fazlan

texts.en:
Fazlan is a 45-year-old, married woman. She is running a business of selling milk with her husband. 

She has buffalo and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  

Fazlan’s job is to look after the buffalo and collect their milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Fazlan has requested 55,000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers, thus providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela, who is 25 years old and is a hard-working woman, lives in Kutaisi, West Georgia. She has 2 little daughters and a husband, who was unable to start any stable job or private activity. 

In order to make a living-wage, Lela started clothing trading business. She sells various kind of clothing in her community with price mark-ups and makes a small income. However, her little daughters needs more and Lela is unable to satisfy all her family's needs. She wants to start additional business and requested financial support among local credit providers. She couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions, because of the family's poor living condition, until the Start Up program began which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. The program allows poor people Like Lela to get a chance for starting or re-starting business. 

Lela will start trading with fruits and vegetables, purchase all needed inventories and also have money for working capital. 
She is very enthusiastic and hard working person with a great desire to ensure her children with good education for progressing in life.  This credit will be a great support for the family. Lela is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving her a chance to increase the financial conditions of her family.

loans.use: To start additional business and trade with fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rahimal

texts.en:
Rahimal is a 38 years old woman and she deals in a business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 45000  to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bathroom, septic tank and a toilet at their home for improvement of access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Bibishoi

texts.en:
Bibishoi is a talented woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1954 and is living in a beautiful village with friendly residents. She is widow. She has a small store where she sells grocery products. She has 35 years experience trading and doing business. She has regular customers and well serves each of them. She is polite, honest and attentive person. She likes her duty and wishes to have a successful business. 

She is asking financial support from Kiva and IMON to buy grocery products. She hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy grocery products for sale in her store

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is a 54-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and six children. She works hard to show her determination of being able to improve her family’s way of living. She started her own job by opening a bakery in her house where she produces delicious bread and manakish (flatbread) since 2009.

Today she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to increase her inventory of ingredients such as flour and oil. She states that the loan will positively help her extend her job and increase her income by a large percentage. In the future, she plans to borrow more Kiva loans to further develop her work.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of ingredients such as flour and oil.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity  is a married woman with four children, all of whom attends school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. In addition she always operates a farming business of selling bananas.She faces a major challenge of transportation and perishability in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is married woman with one child, which attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned transportation  as her major challenge. Penina dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking fat oil

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is a 30-year-old married woman from the village of Mukhiani. She lives with her father-in-law and husband, who has just arrived in the country and has no source of income. Tamara's income, however, is not enough to meet the basic needs of her family. 

With the help of her family members, she is extensively engaged in agribusiness, which is the most important source of her family's income. For more than 17 years, Tamara has been involved in cattle and pig breeding and in the cultivation of nuts and lemon. They sell the agricultural products in the local market. 

As it becomes harder to earn a living over time, Tamara wants to make another source of income in order to more effectively meet the daily costs of her family. A loan of 6,000 GEL will be a great support to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling her to purchase a car and get income from a taxi business.

Tamara's husband will work as a taxi driver and make his bit for the family's welfare, which will greatly increase the family's living condition. 
Tamara and her husband rely on the good will of Kiva lenders and will be very grateful for the help.

loans.use: To purchase a car and get income from a taxi business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman with seven children, two of whom attend school. She lives in her own house house that has neither electricity nor piped water. With the loan, Jane plans to purchase seeds and fertilizers to do farming in her business. She mentioned seasonality and transportation in her business. She decided to join Yehu to boost and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to do farming in her business

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en:
Rizwana  is a 33-year-old, married woman, and a mother of five children. 

In order to assist her husband in taking care of the family, she began selling milk. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffalo for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. 

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en: Khalida is a 39 years old, married woman. Her husband is running a business of milk selling for many years to support the needs of the family members. For the improvement of her husband's business,  she has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, now, she has requested for a loan of 50000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill their dream of providing better living conditions to their children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children

loans.name: Ruqiya

texts.en:
Ruqiya is a 36 years old, married woman. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earns profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earns profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy assorted jewellery to sell.

loans.name: Mererani 'a' Group

texts.en:
Joyce, who is in her late 40s, is married with six children. Four of them are grown-up and two are still in school. Joyce has been buying big stones and making them into small quarrying stones for two years now. She does not have a specific time for working: whenever the big stones are found, they call her and she goes to collect the stones and start making them in small quarries. She has been able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Joyce's forth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase on the load of tones twice, and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to buy more loans and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan, bought a plot of land and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy more loads of stones to crush them in small pieces for selling, it's used for making concrete during building.  She dreams of opening food business.

Joyce will share this loan with her loan group 'Mererani A' which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more loads of stones for her business.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María de 39 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 21 y 18 años de edad. María es una mujer muy trabajadora que posee un negocio de venta de pupusas en su casa de habitación con el que gracias a los ingresos por las ventas logra solventar los gastos del hogar. María con el deseo de brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la instalación de energía eléctrica ya que no cuenta con este servicio en su hogar y para ella a diario cuando llega la noche se vuelve problemática ya que su casa se hunde en total oscuridad. Con el monto solicitado ella piensa comprar: tomacorrientes, lámparas y pago de un electricista.
texts.en:
