Maria is 39 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and two children, who are 21 and 18 years old.  Maria is a very hardworking woman who owns a business selling pupusas [filled corn tortillas] from her house from which, thanks to the income from her sales, she is able to cover her household costs. 
 
Wishing to provide a better quality of life for her family, Maria has decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in installing electrical power, because she does not have this facility in her house, and it becomes difficult for her at night when her house is plunged into total darkness. With the amount she has requested, she intends to buy sockets and lights, and pay an electrician.

loans.use: to invest in electrical sockets and lights, and to pay an electrician.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is getting ready for the next cropping season. She wants to prepare well, especially for the much needed land and seedbed preparation. 

She wants to have enough supply of corn fertilizer, for which she applied for a loan from the Cooperative. 

Teresita hopes to save enough for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer for her corn fields

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora has big plans for her retailing business and also the renovation of their home. 

Flora hopes to live comfortably with a house of good roofing supported by her loan of Php 5,000. 

Flora hopes to sustain her business so that she can timely repay all her coop obligations.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for house renovation

loans.name: Dioleta

texts.en:
Dioleta works hard to support her family. She is single and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Dioleta requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig.

Dioleta has been in this business for four years now, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transportation.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with five children two of whom attend school and the other three have completed schooling. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 30,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize
 flour, beans and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize  flour, beans

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that  neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past 20 years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 30,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned transportation as a  challenge in her business. Grace dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking fat oil

loans.name: Londa

texts.en:
Londa is a 59-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and two grandchildren in Zugdidi district. Londa's husband serves locals as a taxi driver and generates income.

Londa wants to start a business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan for purchasing bee hives with bee colonies. She will start producing honey to sell and will increase her family's income.

Londa is very motivated and hopes that the business will be profitable.

loans.use: to purchase bee hives with bee colonies

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is 27-years-old and he lives in Hargiesa. He finished his University in 2012 especially faculty of education. Ahmed is single and he works in his own shop which he started 2014. He needs to increase his working capital so he requested a loan of $300 from Kaaba and he wants to use the loan to by buying sugar, rice, soda and water drinks. Now, Ahmed is on the wait list. 

Kaaba will provide the goods as a loan, and Ahmed will then make monthly repayments. In the future Ahmed wants to expand his shop to a bigger shop.

loans.use: To buy sugar, Rice etc to increase the stock of his small shop

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 67 years old, single, and a resident of Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Being a microfinance member of PMPC, she diligently pays all her obligations from the earnings of her store. 

Recently, she applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase canned goods, condiments, bath soaps, shampoo and detergent bars.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, condiments, bath soaps, shampoo and detergent bars for the sari sari store

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Geneveive

texts.en:
Geneveive is 26 years old, residing at Mantic, Tangub City, Mis.Occ. She joined PMPC in order to access the programs and services of the said coop. 

Recently, she's accessing her second loan in the amount of PHP 6,000 for additional working capital of her existing business to buy a variety of commodities; she is selling a variety of food products in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence has a 10-acre farm in the village of Ruriine in Kenya where she lives with her family. The farm has 1 dairy cow, 15 heads of poultry, 300 trees and a small garden filled with cash crops. She sells her farm produce at Meru, which is a local market near her home. She started farming 20 years ago, and through the years, she has had no difficulty in satisfying her customers’ needs. The biggest growth constraint for Florence is lack of access to capital to buy agricultural inputs necessary to increase her farm’s productivity. She lives in a part of Kenya where there are no banks. She is seeking a loan to buy agricultural inputs that she needs to plant more bananas. With your lending, Florence will be able to access capital from a credible source to buy important farm inputs that will increase her farm’s productivity and family income.

loans.use: to plant more bananas on her farm

loans.name: Alexander Jose

texts.es:
Alexander es un pescador de 39 años de edad, residente de la zona de lorica, hombre que diariamente se  enfrente al océano para atrapar peces que sirven para el alimento de su familia que la conforman su pareja y 4 hijos y para la venta, obteniendo recursos con los que paga las demás obligaciones.

Hoy Alexander solicita tu ayuda para seguir desarrollando su actividad, el motivo es que solicita un préstamo para la compra de plomo para atarraya, nylon para redes, estos insumos son de vital importancia para reparar sus implementos de pesca.
texts.en:
Alexander is a 39 year old  fisherman who lives in area of Lorica. Every day he goes out into the ocean to catch the fish that will feed his family, which is made up of his partner and 4 children. 

He also sells fish in order to have the resources with which to pay for the rest of his obligations. 
  
Today Alexander is asking for your help in order to continue developing his livelihood.  He is applying for a loan in order to buy lead for casting and nylon for nets.  These supplies are of vital importance in order to repair his fishing equipment.

loans.use: to buy lead for casting and nylon for nets. These supplies are of vital importance in order to repair his fishing equipment.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 28-year-old, hardworking, married man with four children (two attend school) in Hoima, Uganda. He ventured into selling sugar, soap and general merchandise, among other items, alongside owning a hardware  mainly welding of doors  and other metals. 

He hopes to grow and expand his business as well as pay school fees for his children despite being affected by price fluctuations and inflation. 

He will use the loan to buy more of stock items like sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock of items like sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Yhomar

texts.es:
Yhomar es un hombre casado de 35 años de edad que tiene una panadería y un sueño de comprar una vivienda propia, es padre de un hijo, le genera buena calidad de vida a su familia pero tiene una deuda pendiente la cual es comprar una vivienda propia.

Yhomar quiere progresar, este hombre busca tener la mejor panadería de la zona por ello invierte inteligentemente en su negocio y al no tener mucho capital de trabajo, aprovecha la ayuda de los préstamos y hoy quiere que apoyes su proyecto, un incentivo servirá para que Yhomar compre estanterías, equipo de panadería, insumos para su negocio, mejorando y variando los productos en venta.
texts.en:
Yhomar is a 35 year old married man who has a bakery and dreams of buying his own home.  He is the father to one son.  He is able to provide a good quality of life for his family but he has one outstanding debt, which is to buy his own home.  

Yhomar wants to make progress and have the best bakery in the zone.  To do so, he invests intelligently and as he doesn't have much capital to work with, he takes advantage of the help the loans provide.  He hope you will support his project, which will allow Yhomar to buy shelves, bakery equipment, and supplies for his business, and improve and diversify the products in his shop.

loans.use: to buy shelves, bakery equipment and supplies for his business, and improve and diversify the products in his shop.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is age 36. He is married with two children aged 6 and 10 years. He operates a retail shop in Hoima, Uganda, mainly selling sugar, plastics, soap and other general merchandise, alongside farming — he is growing cassava mainly to sell. 

He dreams of constructing his permanent house only to be limited by inadequate capital. 

He is seeking a loan facility to buy more stock items like sugar, salt and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock items like sugar, salt and soap to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, flour, oil, sugar, and beans to resell strengthen her business.

loans.name: Eloy

texts.en:
Eloy is 42 years old. He is still living with his parents, and he is helping them with expenses. Eloy is still single, and he doesn't have children.

Eloy needs a loan to buy paper for his printing business.

He hopes you can help him again. He is working hard, but he needs some help. Eloy is healthy, and he promises he will repay all the loans he requested.

loans.use: to buy paper for his printing business

loans.name: Suma Sartawhi 2015 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SUMA SARTAWHI 2015” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Fabiola es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de prendas de vestir, venta de mantas, venta de comida, venta de abarrotes, venta de café y té, venta de joyas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Fabiola es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer desde hace cuatro años, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de prendas de vestir; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió desde hace ocho años por iniciativa propia.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de chompas y poleras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, la capacitación y las reuniones de pago que ofrece la institución.

En la foto solo aparecen siete integrantes porque la señora Deysi Yanapa, despues del desembolso, se fue a su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
The “Suma Sartawhi” credit group will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional hub.  It is made up of eight members and is lead by a board of directors where Fabiola is the president.  The businesses that the group members carry out are varied; among them are: selling clothing outfits, selling blankets, selling food, selling groceries, selling coffee and tea, and selling gems.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small-time micro-entrepreneurs, one of whom is Fabiola.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer four years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the organization.  Currently, she has a business selling clothing outfits.  She shares that she learned this business eight years ago through her own initiative.

The loan she is now taking out is for an increase in working capital (to buy sweaters and shirts in bulk).  She will get these from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto and later will sell them in her sales space.  This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family financially, because she is single and has a child.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the area of health, the trainings, and the payment meetings that the organization offers.

Only seven members appear in the photo because Deysi Yanapa left for her sales space after making her payment.

loans.use: to buy sweaters and shirts in bulk

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower such as her. 

Marichu was able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store wth bottled beverages and bags of rice for retail. 

In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store wth bottled beverages and bags of rice for retail

location.town: Tangub-Mantic, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mi

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es: Carlos tiene 22 años de edad habita en vivienda propia. El es un hombre muy trabajador el se dedica a  prestar sus servicios como motorista desde hace 5 años ya que cuenta con vehículo propio y es así como el se gana la vida día con día. Carlos necesita reparar su vehículo por el cual se transporta de un lugar a otro y así asegurar que todo esté bien, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cambio de llantas, amortiguadores, y mano de obra de su vehículo y otros imprevistos que le vengan después ya que es su única fuente de ingreso.
texts.en: 22-year-old Carlos lives in his own home. He is a hardworking man who has worked as a driver for 5 years. He has his own vehicle which enables him to earn his living. He needs to have some repairs done to his car which he uses to get around and to ensure that everything is working correctly. This is why he has applied to FUSAI for a loan which he will use to buy new tyres and shock absorbers and pay for repairs to his vehicle and any other unseen circumstances which might arise, as his car is his sole source of income.

loans.use: to buy new tyres, shock absorbers and repairs to his vehicle which is his sole source of income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more retail goods to sell especially used plastic containers which can be re-used for carrying water in her area

loans.name: María Sebastiana

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 63 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 6 hijos mayores de edad, uno  de ellos aun viven con ella, su esposo es comerciante, pero casi no trabaja por la edad. 
Doña María es una mujer muy luchadora que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para así con sus ganancias luchar junto a su marido para salir adelante, ella se dedica al  comercio, tienen un negocio junto a su hijo, ellos compran y venden pescado, cuatro veces por semana ellos  envían el pescado a Quito, ciudad en la cual vive otro de sus hijos es el encargado de recibir y vender en dicha ciudad, ella también por su parte en su casa vende aguas, colas, gelatinas y otras golosinas con lo cual se gana algo extra,  llevan más de 20 años con la venta de pescado y 2 años con sus ventas de  golosinas.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado, colas, aguas, jugos, entre otras. Está desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho razón por lo cual está muy agradecida con la fundación y con las personas que le ayudan con los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The María Del Carmen communal bank meets every fifteen days in the Montecristi Canton where the famous straw hats come from. It’s a city with a cool climate and many natural tourist attractions. 

María, 62, lives here. She’s married and has six adult children, one of whom still lives with her. Her husband is a merchant, but barely works due to his age. 

Doña Maria is a very scrappy woman who has always liked to work in order to use her earnings to strive alongside her husband to get ahead. She is a merchant, she has a business with her son, they buy and sell fish, four times a week they send fish to Quito, the city in which another one of her sons lives. He’s in charge of receiving and selling in that city. For her part, in her house, she also sells water, soft drinks, gelatins and other snacks, with which she earns a little extra. They’ve been selling fish for more than 20 years and selling snacks for 2 years.

This loan is to buy fish, soft drinks, water, juice, among other items. She has been with the communal bank from the beginning, and she likes it because the loans help her a lot, for which she is very grateful to the foundation and to the people who help her with the loans. Her dream is to get ahead.

loans.use: buy fish, soft drinks, water, juice, etc.

loans.name: Genessis Alexandra

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.
En este lugar vive la señora Génesis,  tiene 22 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene un hijo de 4 años el cual este año empezó a estudiar en un jardín de infantes de la ciudad. Su esposo es comerciante. Ella hace años atrás aprendió belleza.
Doña Genesis  es una mujer muy trabajadora que  realiza los créditos para ella y para su marido, ella se dedica a  realizar trabajos de belleza como cortes de cabello y pintado de uñas entre otros trabajos, ella también vende cosméticos. Parte del crédito ella se lo da a su marido para  que él lo utilice en sus actividades,  él se dedica a la venta de pescado, casi todos los días compra pescado para vender por libras y luego en su carro  sale a vender por la localidad y lugares cercanos donde tiene sus clientes. Lleva más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo para el bien familiar. 
Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar pescado, cosméticos y herramientas de belleza que ella necesita. Lleva más de 4 años en él  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan  los créditos.  Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The “María Del Carmen” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi subdivision where the famous straw hats come from. It’s a city with a cold climate and many natural tourist attractions.

Twenty-two year-old Génesis lives here. She’s in a common-law marriage and has a four year-old son, who started preschool this year in the city. Her husband is a merchant. She learned beauty services years ago. Genesis is a very hardworking woman who takes out the loans for herself and her husband. 

She works doing beauty services such as hair cuts and painting nails, as well as selling cosmetics. She'll give part of the loan to her husband, who sells fish, so that he can use it in his business. He buys fish almost every day to sell by the pound and then he goes out in his car and sells it in the area and nearby places where he has clients. He has been doing this work for more than five years, with which he earns something for the family's wellbeing. 

The loan will be used to buy fish, cosmetics and beauty tools that she needs. She’s been in the communal bank more than four years and likes it because of the help that the loans give her. Her dream is to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cosmetics and beauty tools.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es: María de 41 años es una carismática mujer que inició su negocio con la premisa de que el tiempo se debe ocupar y que mejor forma que generando recursos para su familia, fue entonces que decidió hace 7 años adecuar un espacio de su casa y exhibir productos de uso personal desde una vitrina y en estanterías prendas de vestir.  Ella reside en un barrio del municipio de soledad en compañía de su cónyuge y sus tres hijos, ella considera que esta actividad le permite atender sus labores en el hogar y dedicarle tiempo a su familia. Sus principales clientes son sus familiares, vecinos  y  amigos, quienes diariamente pueden llegar a su vivienda y conseguir calzado, prendas de vestir, cosméticos, perfumes, artículos para el hogar entre otros.  María requiere de un mayor capital para surtir con nuevos artículos para su negocio que le permitan reactivar las ventas, para ello está aplicando a su primer credikiva  con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Gracias a este financiamiento ella obtendrá beneficios económicos que la acercaran más a su meta de fortalecer su capital  y ofrecer una educación integral a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a charismatic 41-year-old woman who started her business with the premise that time must be occupied and what better way to do it than generating resources for her family. It was then that she decided 7 years ago to adapt a space in her house and display products for personal use in a display cabinet and clothing on shelves. 

She lives in a neighborhood of the town of Soledad with her husband and three children. She considers that this work allows her to tend to her tasks at home and spend time with her family. Her main customers are her family members, neighbors and friends, who may come to her home daily to buy shoes, clothing, cosmetics, perfumes, and items for the home among other things. 

Maria needs more capital to be able to stock up on new items for her business which would allow her to revive her sales. For this reason she is applying for her first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Thanks to this financing, she will get financial benefits that will bring her closer to her goal of securing her capital and providing comprehensive education to her children.

loans.use: stock up on new items for her business.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es:
Ella es Ángela es una mujer de 45 años de edad que se separó de su esposo, quedando a cargo de un hogar formado por 4 hijos de 10, 8, 9, 6 años de edad, ella no tiene trabajo, cuenta con poca experiencia laboral y no tiene una persona que le cuide los muchachos mientras trabaja, por tal razón desea solicitar un préstamo para la creación de un negocio que es la cría de pollos.

El dinero será destinado en la adecuación de un galpón, pollos de engorde y alimento.

Su principal sueño es superar esta crisis y mostrar la calidad de mujer que es sostenimiento y generando calidad de vida en su familia.
texts.en:
Ángela is a 45 year old woman who separated from her husband, leaving her responsible for a household made up of her four children, who are 10, 8, 9, and 6 years old. She does not have a job, has little work experience, and doesn't have anyone to take care of her children while she works. Because of this, she wants to request a loan in order to create a business of raising chickens. 

The money will be used for the modification of a shed, broiler chickens, and chicken feed. Her main dream is to overcome this crisis and show the quality of woman that she is, sustaining and generating a good quality of life for her family.

loans.use: Start a chicken raising business.

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es: Josefina esta en sus 52 años de edad, ella es casada pero su esposo es de la tercera edad y con esfuerzo puede caminar por sí solo, Josefina  tiene 3 hijos que ya son mayores de edad y ya trabajan al jornal, Josefina vive con su esposo, una hija y 2 nietos. Josefina  tiene pequeños galpones para trabajar en la crianza de pollos, Josefina solicita el dinero del credito para comprar pollos.La aspiración de Josefina es la de comprar mayor cantidad de pollos y asi lograr aumentar sus ingresos para que no le haga falta el alimento para su familia sobre todo para comprar lo necesario para su esposo.
texts.en:
Josefina is 52 years old and married, but her husband is elderly and struggles to walk on his own. Josefina has three sons who are all adults and work as day laborers. She lives with her husband, one daughter, and two grandchildren. She owns small sheds which she uses to raise chickens.

Josefina requests a loan so she can purchase chickens. Her aspiration is to be able to buy a larger amount of chickens so she can increase her income so that her family never goes hungry, and so she can buy whatever is necessary for her husband.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Rimsha

texts.en:
Rimsha is a 23-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of one child. Her husband owns a printing shop. Her husband is the guardian of the family and is responsible for fulfilling the family members' needs. Rimsha has been running her own beauty salon for the past one year, and she also contributes her income with her husband's to manage the household.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, creams, hair brush, and other accessories for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints she is not capable of buying these items for her business purpose. Therefore, Rimsha has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help her to earn a maximally profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

Rimsha is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to increase her parlor business

loans.name: Mukhtar

texts.en:
Mukhtar is 30 years old and lives in Hargeisa city. He is married and has two children. He has three additional dependents that live in his house. 

In 2012, Mukhtar established his local food restaurant in Hargeisa. He began his restaurant because he wants to help his family meet their basic needs. He works all the days of the week and 10 hours per day, and he earns around $200 every month from this business. 

Now Mukhtar needs a loan of 300 USD to buy more local foods such as maize and corn to increase his working capital and he requested the loan from Kaaba MFI. Kaaba will provide the goods as a loan, and Mukhtar will then make monthly repayments. In the future Mukhtar wants to expand his restaurant by increasing the space of the restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more local foods such as maize and corn to expand his local food restaurant

loans.name: Wacays Group

texts.en: Xaawa is a 55-year-old businesswoman. She has 11 children, and she is the head of her household. Xaawa is a unique woman. She works multiple jobs. She sells sheep and goats, and she also sells clothes and perfumes. She started these jobs in 1998 and has worked them until now. She struggles to meet the needs of her family, as she pays for school fees, clothes, and household utilities. Now, Xaawa wants to buy more livestock to increase her income-generating activity, so she requested a loan of $500 from Kaaba MFI. Xaawa is the Leader of Wacays group, and she is the one sitting in the middle of the group. This group consists of seven women, and all them have pre-existing small businesses.

loans.use: to buy more sheep and goats to increase her income-generating activity.

loans.name: Telman

texts.en:
Telman is 53 years old IDP (internally displaced person)  and he is father of two sons.His wife is a housekeeper and educates children. Telman earns money for family working as a butcher for 25 years. People address him when need to cut cow or sheep meat properly. He gets for this 200 AZN monthly. 
Buthcery is one of the oldest and prevalent professions. Azerbaijan cuisine is very famous and various. There are a lot of different delicious dishes from meat. Some of the receipts require meat to be specially cut.  In these cases most of people refer to butchers. Telman is the most famous butcher in his region. Many restaurants’ chiefs know him and prefer his butchery.
Being IDP makes Telman ’s family’s life hard. He can’t provide his children education and isn’t able to cover demands. He applied for 1200 AZN loan in order to buy new butchery tools and new husbandry for his small business.

He has already borrowed four loans from Aqroinvest in the past. With a good loan history, he has applied for fifth loan. Telman thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy new butchery tools and new husbandry for his small business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay college tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install sewage pipework in her home.

loans.name: Monte Fresco Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Monte fresco está conformado por tres mujeres laboriosas, quienes solicitan por décima vez el financiamiento en ADIM, el grupo es coordinado por Marizol una mujer luchadora de 40 años de edad, casada y madre de tres hijos quienes son su mayor motivación, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y fritanga desde hace 8 años, una de sus metas es desarrollar el negocio por lo que solicita el crédito para la compra de blusas, camisetas, pantalones y chores, uno de sus logros con el crédito anterior fue mejorar su casa. La segunda socia es Norma de 37 años de edad quien es propietaria de una pulpería y la tercer socia es doña Elsa de 61 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de nacatamales desde hace cuatro años.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Monte Fresco (Cool Mountain) is made up of three hardworking women who are requesting financing for the tenth time with ADIM.  The group is coordinated by Marizol, a determined 40-year-old woman who is married and is the mother of three children who are her greatest motivation.  She has worked selling clothing and food for 8 years.  One of her goals is to develop the business.  For that reason she is requesting the loan to buy blouses, t-shirts, pants and shorts.  One of her achievements with the previous loan was improving her house.  

The second member is Norma, 37 years old, who is owner of a small grocery store and the third member is Doña Elsa, 61 years old, who has worked selling nacatamales (corn, meat and rice wrapped in a banana leaf) for four years.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, t-shirts, pants and shorts.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en: Rosalia is 53 years old and married with 4 adult children. She has a farm that she tills with her husband. She grows various vegetables like eggplant, tomatoes, peppers and other high valued crops. This business helps her support the needs of her family as well as sending her children to school. Currently she avails of a loan of PHP 10,000.00 to purchase bags of fertilizer for farming activities to ensure high productivity.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer for farming activities

loans.name: Viviana Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.
En este lugar vive la señora Viviana, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad el cual es su vida. El marido trabaja en una fábrica. 
Doña Viviana con la intención de ganarse algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar y crianza de su hijo  desde hace mas de 4  años atrás se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo  y productos de  Yanbal y  Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale en sus ratos libres y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, deja a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, ella siempre aprovecha los productos de oferta ya que compra bastante y luego vende al precio real lo cual le deja buenos ingresos.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa, zapatos, cremas, perfumes, entre otros. Lleva más de 3 años  en el  Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos aprovecha para comprar más ofertas. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su pequeño.
texts.en:
The María Del Carmen credit group gathers every 15 days in the Montecristi Canton, home to the famous Panama hat; a city of cool weather that has many natural tourist attractions that are characteristic of the area. It is in this place that Mrs. Viviana lives. She is 23 years old and is in a common-law marriage through which she has a 3-year-old son who means the world to her. Her partner works at a factory.

With the intention of making some money of her own, and to help her partner with the household expenses and those pertaining to the raising of her son, Doña Viviana has worked in the sale of all types of clothing and products from Yanbal and Belcorp (which include beauty items, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women) for the past 4 years. She sells door to door in her free time, as well as from her home where the customers she knows the best come. She allows her customers to pay in installments and collects payments every 8 days. She always makes the most out of products which are on sale, given that she buys in bulk and afterwards sells at the actual price, which generates good income for her.

She will use the credit she is requesting to purchase clothes, shoes, beauty creams, and perfumes, among other items. She has been part of the María Del Carmen credit group for over 3 years and she likes it because she is able to make the most out of special offers with the help of loans. Her dream is to be able to give her little one the very best.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, shoes, beauty creams, and perfumes, among other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more salt,sugar, rice and biscuits for sell and help pay school fees from the profits

loans.name: Damal2 Group

texts.en:
Abdirahman is a 49-year-old man, with 8 children, 4 girls and 4 boys. He is an engineer who has a cement-brick production machine in the town of Borama. In the photo, he is standing on the left and is raising his hand. 

He is the leader of this group, known as Damal2, which consists of 2 male members.Abdirahman and Ali who are co-owners and who bought the brick production machine in 2009 with $2,500 in Hargiesa.  He produces from 700 to 1,400 bricks per day. He produces two different sizes of bricks and sells them for $0.43 and $0.53 each, respectively, or uses them to build houses, as both of are engineers. 

Now, Abdirahman needs to further expand his brick production, so he requested a loan of $2000 from Kaaba Microfinance Institution. Kaaba will provide Abdirahman and his colleague Ali the cement and required materials as Kaaba provides its loans in kind.

loans.use: To purchase more cement to expand his cement-brick production business

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Sabina operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Canela Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres (AMALIA, MARITZA MARGARITA y SHORLEY MARISOL) de la etnia miskita de la comunidad de Lamlaya, en vocablo miskito significa agua mansa, del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios; se organizaron hace 12 meses para acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana.

Amalia: Es integrante del grupo solidario CANELA, es una señora luchadora de tiene 36 años de edad, madre soltera de un pequeño de 5 años de edad, con el propósito de sacar adelante a su hijo, Desde hace siete años se dedica a la venta de pescado y mariscos. Está solicitando préstamo para comprar más productos de mariscos y pescados para vender e incrementar sus ingresos y atender a más personas que demandan este producto que constituye uno de los alimentos básicos en Bilwi. Ella sueña con llegar a contar con suficiente capital para establecer una pulpería y venta de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three women (Amalia, Maritza Margarita, and Shorley Marisol), of the miskita ethnic group, in the community of Lamlaya, which in the miskito language means "calm water," in the Puerto Cabezas municipality. They are very enterprising women who struggle every day to grow their small businesses. They formed their group twelve months ago to apply for guaranteed loans together with Pana Pana. 

Amalia is a member of the CANELA group, she is a hard-working thirty-six year-old woman and single mother to a five-year-old boy, her goal is to help her son succeed. For the past seven years she has worked selling fish and shellfish. She is applying for this loan so she can buy more shellfish and fish products to sell, and increase her earnings, and serve more customers who want this product, which is one of the staple foods in Bilwi. She dreams of one day having enough capital to open a general store and sell fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy more shellfish and fish products

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen del Carmen está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida. Están también dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todos a través de la encuesta de los 50 indicadores luchan por poder crecer.
La Sra. Olga solicita de este préstamo para la compra de prendas variadas, como ser remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones, blusas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su negocio el cual es la venta de prendas variadas. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora que está luchando para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias.
Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante lo mismo que las demás integrantes de su grupo.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Carmen group is in its first cycle in the women's committee program. All of them work and help each other get ahead and improve their quality of life. They are also in the poverty elimination program and all of them are fighting to grow in a survey with 50 indicators.

Olga is asking for this loan to buy various articles of clothing such as t-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, blouses and more. This way, she can continue with her business, which is selling clothing. She is a very enterprising person who is fighting to improve and her her family's quality of life.
 
She is thankful for the opportunity she is receiving to grow and get ahead, as are the other members of the group.

loans.use: to buy various items of clothing such as t-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, blouses and more.

loans.name: 23 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
El grupo 23 DE OCTUBRE está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, se destaca la Sra. Esmerita, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, es decir que ha mejorado mucho su situación de pobreza a través de su esfuerzo y esfuerzo.
Ella tiene una humilde despensa que monto con mucho trabajo y sacrificio, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que con esfuerzo está luchando por salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carne, frutas, lácteos, panificados y otros, y con ello poder seguir luchando por mejorar en su emprendimiento. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de superarse.
texts.en:
The group "23 DE OCTUBRE" is in its sixth loan cycle of the women's committee program, where they all work and help each other to get ahead. Esmerita stands out. In the latest survey, she showed a level of poverty within level three. That is to say that she has much improved her situation of poverty through her efforts.

She has a modest store that she started with much work and sacrifice. She is a very hardworking and hard-fighting woman who with effort is fighting to get ahead.

She is asking for this loan to buy vegetables, meat, fruits, dairy products, baked goods and other things. With that she can continue fighting to improve her entrepreneurship. She is grateful for the opportunity she receives to better herself.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, fruits, dairy products, baked goods and other products.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 37-year-old married mother of four children. In 2012, she started her own job by opening in her house a small room to prepare and sell homemade foods in order to help her family's way of living. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy food stuff and raw materials to give the best products to her clients, earning extra money, vending all products and expanding her business area. 

In the future she plans to open her own shop.

loans.use: to buy food stuff and raw materials

loans.name: Mariela Vanesa

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.
En este lugar vive la señorita Mariela, tiene 24 años de edad,  es soltera y vive en casa de los padres. 
Doña Mariela es una joven mujer que le gusta trabajar para así ganarse lo propio y con sus recursos ayudar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa ya que ellos son de escasos recursos y los gastos son muchos, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo,  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale a vender por la localidad casi todos los días ya sea en la mañana o tarde,  ella deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada 8 días, lleva 4 años con su negocio el cual empezó con uno de los créditos que recibió del grupo, por lo cual está muy agradecida con la fundación y con las personas que le ayudan a obtener su crédito.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, ropa de niños entre otras prendas. Lleva más 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
María del Carmen Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton, the city of the famous "toquilla" [or "Panama"] straw hats.  The climate is cool and there are a lot of natural tourist attractions in the area.

This is where Mariela lives.  She's 24 years old and single, and she lives in her parents' house.  Mariela's a young woman who likes to work to earn her own money and help her parents with the household expenses, because they have few resources and many expenses.  She earns a living in sales, selling all types of clothing.  She sells door-to-door, going out into town almost every day, either in the morning or the afternoon.  She leaves items on credit with her customers and collects weekly.

She has had this business for four years, having started with a group loan she received.  That's why she's very grateful to the foundation and the people who help her get her loan.  Mariela has been in the communal bank for more than four years and she likes it because she started her business with loans.

This loan is to buy pants, shirts, children's clothing, and other garments.

Mariela's dream is to improve her life.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, children's clothing, and other garments

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.en:
Timoteo is a businessman in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 56 years old, married and a microfinance member of PMPC. 

Timoteo runs a retail store selling dried fish. He also has a water refilling business. This type of business has supported his family. 

Recently, he applied for a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase dried fish for his buy-and-sell business. 

Timoteo believes having enough inventory would allow him to cater to his customers' needs. He is thankful that he has signed up for membership with PMPC as his financing partner.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish for the buy-and-sell business

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 60 years old. She is known in the Calamba area for her sari-sari store. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. 

She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails and sticks. 

She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record - a matter that Leonora has given a priority, as a microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for, since all her financing needs on her retail business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
In the year 2003, Benedicta learned of Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, she tried her luck and borrowed a loan to start her rice production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Benedicta feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used for her business. 

Recently she availed a loan to purchase seedlings and pay for land preparation. 

Benedicta wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and pay for land preparation

loans.name: Ricardo Andrés

texts.es: Aprovechando su experiencia en publicidad, Ricardo de 21 años decidió independizarse y creó  su  agencia publicitaria, la cual funciona desde la comodidad de su hogar, él habita en un barrio del municipio de Soledad y sus principales clientes son sus vecinos, amigos y referidos.  Ofrece servicio de diagramación, diseño de estampados para camisetas, folletos para cartas de restaurantes, pendones publicitarios, tarjetas de presentación y demás propuestas que le soliciten. Con esta actividad ha logrado un sustento económico digno y creciente que le ha permitido ayudar a sus padres con los gastos de hogar. Ricardo está convencido que con un mayor capital podrá ampliar su clientela e incrementar sus ventas por lo cual está tramitando con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  su primer Credikiva, recursos que planea invertir los insumos de su negocio como papel, cartulinas, tintas y demás.  Su sueño de prosperidad es organizar una agencia de publicidad y generar  los ingresos que le permitan continuar con el apoyo a sus padres.
texts.en:
Making the most of his experience in advertising, Ricardo—aged 21—decided to become self-employed and set up his own advertising agency, which he runs from the comfort of his home. He lives in a neighbourhood of the Soledad municipality, and his main clients are his neighbours, friends, and referrals.

The services that he offers include layout design, t-shirt printing design, restaurant menu brochures, banners, business cards, and whatever his clients require.

Through this occupation, he has managed to earn a decent and growing income, which has allowed him to help his parents out with the home expenses.   

Ricardo believes that with a larger capital, he could expand his client base and increase his sales. For this reason, he is applying for his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the loan to purchase supplies for his business such as paper, poster board, ink, and the like.

His dream for prosperity lies in organizing the advertising agency and generating the income that will allow him to continue helping his parents.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his business such as paper, poster board, ink, and the like.

loans.name: Colleta

texts.en:
Colleta is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned transportation as her major challenge in her business. Colleta dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, cooking fat oil

loans.name: Bopha

texts.en:
Residing in Battambang province, Bopha is 45 years old and a mother of 4 children. For her family's living, she earns income via fish-raising and teaching in school. Moreover, she can earn more income via selling vegetables and fruits. For Bopha, this is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loan completely. 

She will use her loan portion to buy more fish to raise and buy more vegetables to sell. 

She hopes that she can get more income from her business to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more fish to raise

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor de 25 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa con quien hace meses comenzó una vida matrimonial. Él es un joven trabajador que se desempeña como empleado de una tienda de pinturas desde hace tres años, y es gracias a ello que va saliendo adelante poco a poco junto a su familia. Víctor anteriormente adquirió un crédito que utilizo para poder terminar de construir el corredor de su vivienda y encementar su cuarto dormitorio, pero con el propósito de ver su casa cada vez más bonita ha decidido solicitar un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, y ladrillo de piso para colocarlo en su cuarto de habitación el cual encemento anteriormente.
texts.en:
Victor is 25 years old. He lives in his own home along with his wife, with whom he began married life months ago. He is a hard-working young man who has been working as an employee in a paint store for the last three years. It is thanks to this job that he is moving forward little by little together with his family. 

Before, Victor acquired a loan that he used to finish constructing the corridor of his home and cementing his bedroom. But, in order to have his house look increasingly beautiful, he has decided to request a new loan from FUSAI, to invest in: cement, sand, and brick flooring to put in his bedroom, the same room that had had cemented before.

loans.use: to buy: cement, sand, and brick flooring to put in his bedroom

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert, 47 years old, is known in the Sindangan area for his sari-sari (convenience) store. He actively participates in the various programs and services that PMPC offers. Robert has applied for a loan to restock sari-sari store with commodities like canned goods, soy sauce, oil and soap. He has high hopes that through his business he will live comfortably in a decent house. He hopes to maintain his membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that he has been given priority as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). He is thankful that all the financing needs of his retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to restock sari-sari store with commodities like canned goods, soy sauce, oil, and soap

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es: Marlon es un hombre trabajador de 29 años de edad, casado y padre de tres hijos, propietario de un kiosco ubicado en una de las principales paradas de autobuses en la ciudad, tiene quince años de experiencia en el negocio, es el segundo ciclo que solicita el financiamiento de ADIM, uno de sus logros con el crédito anterior fué que compró unos barriles de agua que le han servido, para satisfacer su necesidad cuando se va el servicio, ahora uno de sus proyectos es construir su casa a medida que administre bien el negocio y le pueda generar bastantes ganancias, por tanto El crédito lo solicita para la compra de gaseosas, jugos, galletas, caramelos y café.
texts.en:
Marlon is a hard-working man of 29 years, is married and is the father of three children.  His owns a kiosk located at one of the main bus stops in the city, and has 15 years of experience running the business. This is his second loan cycle with ADIM; with the previous loan he bought barrels of water to fill his needs when the service goes out.   

Now, one of his projects is to build his house as business is going well and he is earning enough money; for the above, he is requesting this loan to buy soda, juice, cookies, candy, and coffee to stock his store.

loans.use: to buy soda, juice, cookies, candy and coffee to stock his store.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo se formó en la ciudad de Lambaré,  están dentro del programa de comité de mujeres, y también dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde lucha por poder mejorar cada día.
La Sra. Marina, es una  las integrantes quien en su más reciente encuesta mostró que ha ido mejorando y creciendo, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas frescas, y por medio de este emprendimiento que hace ha ido mejorando para poder ayudar a su familia. Es una mujer muy emprendedora y luchadora que se esfuerza día a día.
La Sra. Marina solicita de este crédito para la compra de más frutas frescas y de esa forma aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The group formed in the city of Lambaré. They are in the program 'comité de mujeres' [women's committee] and also the program 'eliminación de la pobreza' [poverty elimination], where they fight to be able to improve each day. 

Marina is one of the members who, in her most recent survey, showed that she has been improving and growing. She works selling fresh fruits and through this business venture has been improving in her ability to help her family. She is a very enterprising and determined woman who makes an effort day by day. 

Marina is seeking this loan to buy more fresh fruits, and in this way increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El Comité  Mujeres Activas esta en el 1er ciclo, es un grupo nuevo que están iniciando con muchas expectativas que quieren invertir para poder tener más ingresos en la casa y así  poder salir de la pobreza. 
La persona del grupo que se destaca es la Sra. Rossana quien se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante. Comenta que ya tiene sus clientes formados que siempre compra las comidas que hace.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de carne, condimentos, hortalizas y otros productos, de manera a poder seguir haciendo las delicias que prepara y seguir deleitando a sus clientes con las delicias que hace.
texts.en: The Active Women Committee is in its first cycle. It is a new group that is starting with high expectations. They want to invest in order to have more income at home and therefore escape poverty. The person in the group that is highlighted is Rossana. She is dedicated to selling foods that she herself makes and afterwards she goes out to sell them as a traveling merchant. She says that she already has a customer base that always buy the food that she makes. She requests this loan in order to invest in buying meat, spices, vegetables, and other products, so that she can continue making the delicacies that she prepares and continue delighting her customers with the delicacies that she makes.

loans.use: to buy meat, spices, vegetables, and other products.

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
Celestine is a married woman with one kid whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that  has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Celestine operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. In addition she also operates a cloth selling business that earns her a source of income.


With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to establish a small grocery store.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina LA ESPERANZA,  es un grupo muy unido, la integran son mujeres humildes y trabajadoras, se encuentran en el primer ciclo con muy buenas expectativas sobre las actividades que estamos llevando a cabo con ellas.
Estas señoras sostienen la idea de que el trabajo solidario y entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Cayetana, se destaca por su laboriosidad, es muy guapa, cría animales en su casa, y ahora también piensa vender animales y vegetales, es por ello que pide este préstamo para poder comprar animales y vegetales para poder emprender su nuevo trabajo.
Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir luchando.
texts.en:
The bank is called La Esperanza.  It's a very close group made up of humble, hardworking women who are getting together for their first loan cycle with high expectations for the work being carried out with them.  These women support the idea of working together.  

Cayetana stands out in the group for her industry.  She's very attractive.  She raises animals at home and now she plans to sell animals and vegetables, so she's requesting this loan to buy animals and vegetables to start her new job.

She's grateful for his opportunity she has to be able to continue to strive.

loans.use: to buy animals and vegetables to start a new job

loans.name: Balbina

texts.es: Balbina de 65 años de edad vive junto a su grupo familiar. Ella se dedica a la venta de pan dulce y salado, semita, quesadilla, pastelitos de pollo, pan francés entre otros, Balbina tiene ya varios años de trabajar en panadería y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia, el negocio está muy bien ubicado en su residencia y ya tiene muchos clientes por el hecho que elabora el pan más rico de la zona  hecho con material de primera calidad y a precios accesibles,  además el servicio es inigualable porque siempre está a disposición de las personas. Balbina es una mujer trabajadora, activa, y motivada a salir adelante y siempre está en busca de  alternativas que le abran paso a nuevas oportunidades que la lleven al éxito es por ello que busca la forma de  aumentar su producción para así poder aumentar sus ganancias y para ello ha tomado la decisión de solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar harina, levadura, pollo, azúcar, miel, leche, etc. para poder de esta forma cumplir con la demanda de producto de sus clientes y al mismo tiempo aumentar sus ventas en el negocio.
texts.en: Balbina, who is 65 years old, lives together with her family. She works in the sale of salty and sweet breads, semitas (thin cake), quesadillas, chicken cakes, French bread, among others. Balbina has been working in a bakery for several years and this has given her a lot of experience. The business is well-located in her residence and she has many clients because she makes the most delicious bread in the area, made with materials of the best quality and at accessible prices. Besides, the service is incomparable because she is always available to people. Balbina is a hard-working woman, active, and motivated to get ahead, and is always searching for alternatives that will open her way to new opportunities that will lead her to success. This is why she looks for a way to increase her production, to be able to increase her profits. This is why she has taken the decision to ask FUSAI for a loan that will allow her to buy flour, yeast, chicken, sugar, honey, milk, etc. and in this way be able to meet the demand of the product of her customers, and at the same time to increase the sales in the business.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, chicken, sugar, honey, milk, etc. to increase the sales in er business.

loans.name: Rayito De Luna Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RAYITO DE LUNA” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Avelina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de abarrotes, venta de chompas, venta de empanadas, venta de regalos, venta de masitas, tienda de barrio, transporte público, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Avelina es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de regalos; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años y lo aprendió de una amiga a la que ayudaba.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (comprar álbum de fotografías, porta retratos y lámparas por mayor) que  lo adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto para posteriormente comercializarlo en su puesto de venta. 
Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “Rayito de Luna” credit group will begin its sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación regional hub.  It is made up of eight members and is lead by a board of directors, of which Avelina is the president.  The group members carry out a variety of businesses, among them: selling groceries, selling sweaters, selling empanadas, selling gifts, selling pastries, running a neighborhood store, offering public transportation, and selling clothing.

The loan they will take out will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs such as Avelina.  She says that  she joined Pro Mujer five years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the organization.  She currently has a business selling gifts.  She shares that she started this business a number of years ago; she learned it from a friend who helped her.

The loan that she is now taking out will be to increase her capital (to buy photo albums, portrait frames, and lamps in bulk).  She will get these from vendors in the city of El Alto in order to later sell them at her sales stand.

This type of work allows her to generate income in order to support her family financially, because she lives in a common-law relationship and has three children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy photograph albums, portrait frames, and lamps in bulk

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion works hard to support her family. Salvacion is married and has a fishing vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 24000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Salvacion has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is 57 years old, married with two children.

Loida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, breads and other personal care products.

Loida has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Loida aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, breads and other personal care products

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with two children, all of whom attends school. She lives at a own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 41 years old and has four children. Brenda is married and has three children are currently in school.

Brenda is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Brenda requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig.

Brenda has been in this business for 15 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Dzidza

texts.en:
Dzidza is a married woman with four children, all of whom attends school. She lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operation.
With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo es un hombre muy trabajador y emprendedor quien gusta de la naturaleza y tiene medidas amigables con el medio ambiente, vive en la localidad rural de Cotahuasi junto a su pareja quien se lama Teresa. Hugo gusta de la agricultura y ganadería, actualmente desea el micro crédito para poder comprar semilla orgánica de quinua para que pueda sembrar en su pequeño terreno agrícola, ademas parte de ese crédito lo usara para comprar una pequeña vaca orgánica. En el futuro espera poder mejorar su casa para que viva cómodamente junto a su pareja.
texts.en:
Hugo is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial man who appreciates nature and treats the environment responsibly. He lives in the rural locality of Cotahuasi along with his partner, whose name is Teresa. Hugo enjoys agriculture and animal husbandry.

At present, he requests a microloan so that he can buy organic quinoa seeds which he will plant in his small parcel of farmland. Furthermore, he will use part of the loan to purchase a small organic cow. In the future, he hopes to be able to improve his home, in which he lives comfortably with his partner.

loans.use: to plant organic quinoa, and to buy an organic cow.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es:
Narciso es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, esta esforzándose para poder crecer y mejorar cada día, el se dedica a la venta de bebidas y artículos básicos, y comenta que su anterior préstamo le ha sido de mucha ayuda.
Comenta que pide este nuevo préstamo para poder comprar bebidas varias y artículos varios de consumo, y de esa forma poder seguir con su negocio como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Narciso is a very hard-working and determined person. He is making an effort to move forward and to improve every day. He makes a living selling beverages and staple goods. He states that his previous loan has been of great help. 

He is requesting this new loan to buy a variety of beverages as well as an assortment of staple goods so that he can continue with his business. He is thankful for the new opportunity that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy a variety of beverages as well as an assortment of staple goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: chickens, chicken feed and vitamins in order to start up her business buying and selling chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica desde hace 8 años a la pesca artesanal, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de redes y trasmallos para seguir con su trabajo y poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face has been blurred out is 28 years old and lives in a high-risk zone. For 8 years she has made a living in artisanal fishing and sells her products in different markets near her home. The young woman lives with her husband in her own house. 

She is asking for a loan to buy nets and trammels so that she can continue working and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy nets and trammels

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Guapa integrado  por  22 mujeres, de las cuales solo 19 de ellas piden el préstamo en este ciclo, están en  el  ciclo 11 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan  ya que se encuentran en la misma comunidad.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria quien se dedica a la venta de queso y leche, de su misma producción, ella es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha para poder mejorar su condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
Maria pide este préstamo para comprar forrajes, balanceados y otros insumos agropecuarios, para poder seguir con su emprendimiento como lo viene haciendo. Todas ellas son mujeres luchadoras que luchan por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa group is made up of 22 women, but only 19 are asking for a loan this cycle. They are in the 11th loan cycle of the women's committee program in which they work and help each other, since they are all in the same community.

One of the members is Maria who makes a living selling cheese and milk that she makes herself. She is a very hard-working person fighting for a better life for herself and her family. Maria is asking for this loan to buy fodder, feed and other agricultural products in order to continue with her entrepreneurship.

All of the women in this group are fighters who struggle for a better life for themselves and their loved ones.

loans.use: to buy fodder, feed and other agricultural products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional hardware products for her shop like cement and different sheets of steel

loans.name: Dolika

texts.en: Dolika is a hardworking woman with four child living in Bundibugyo Uganda. Her business is mainly buying and selling food stuffs on top of fish mongering and cocoa farming for supplementary income. She is in need of a loan to buy fish to sell to her customers. She has a great desire of accumulating more capital and becoming a prominent business woman in her area although she complains of the difficulty of high transport costs, unpredictable weather changes and limited capital hindering her expected returns.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers in the form of cow dung and mulch to boost  her yields.

loans.name: Rogelio Antonio

texts.es:
Rogelio es una persona emprendedora, trabajadora, soñadora que aspira a tener una buena vida, rodeado de lujos y se sueña en un futuro poder enviar a sus hijos a estudiar a la ciudad de Medellín.

Trabaja podando césped, actividad que le ha valido para mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar formado por su esposa y sus dos hijos de 11 y 8 años de edad.

Rogelio hoy pide la ayuda, necesita un préstamo para la compra de su herramienta principal que es una guadañadora.

E préstamo le permitirá seguir realizando su actividad con normalidad y agilidad.
texts.en:
Rogelio is an enterprising, hardworking, dreamer who wants to have a good life, surrounded by luxury and he dreams in the future to send his children to study in the city of Medellin.

He works moving lawns, a business that has allowed him to improve the quality of life of his household, which consists of his wife and two sons, 8 and 11 years old.

Rogelio asks for help today, as he needs a loan in order to buy his primary tool, which is a moving machine.

The loan will allow his to continue to conduct his business normally and with agility.

loans.use: to purchase his primary tool, a mowing machine.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es: Jaqueline tiene 43 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella implemento su bodega en su vivienda hace varios años. Ella tiene como finalidad construir el segundo piso de su vivienda. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción cemento ladrillos arenas. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Jaqueline es la segunda del lado derecho viste chompa negra
texts.en:
Jaqueline is 43 years old. She is in a civil union with two dependent children. Several years ago she started her corner store in her home. Her goal is to construct the second floor of her home. She will invest the loan in the purchase of construction materials such as cement, bricks, and sand.

The group thanks the KIVA investors for the loan they have offered. Jaqueline is the second from the right seen in the black sweater.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, and sheeting

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso es un hombre soltero de 50 años de edad, no tiene hijos ni pareja, genera recursos gracias a su negocio de cría de ganado porcino, un trabajo que le dedica de 10 a 12 horas diarias.

La forma de trabajar de Alfonso es algo que lo ha marcado desde joven por ello su propósito es mejorar y continuar con su profesión hasta que su salud se lo permita.


Alfonso en vista de querer mejorar sus ventas y seguir teniendo la sostenibilidad que ha traído estos últimos años, quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de 7 cerdos y 14 bultos de cuido para alimentarlos.
texts.en:
Alfonso is a single man of 50 years old, he has no children or partner, he generates resources thanks to his pig-farmng business, work to which he devotes from 10 to 12 hours daily.

The way Alfonso works is something that has marked him since he was young, therefore his aim is to improve and continue with his profession as long as his health allows.

Alfonso, with an eye toward wanting to improve his sales and continue having the sostainability that he has had in recent years, wants to apply for a loan for the purchase of 7 pigs and 14 packages of chow to feed them.

loans.use: buy 7 pigs and 14 packages of chow to feed them.

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
Una tienda está marcando el progreso de la familia de Juan quien es un hombre trabajador de 49 años de edad, padre de dos niñas y que vive con su pareja, inicio su negocio en el año 1987 y esta ha sido el sustento de su familia y espera que lo siga siendo por muchos años más.

La principal preocupación del señor Juan es competidor contra un fuerte adversario que son los supermercados que poco a poco están incursionando en los barrios.

Juan quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar, quiere tener surtido e inventario suficiente para cumplir las demandas y pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
A store is marking the progress of Juan´s family. He is a hard-working man, 49 years old, father of two daughters, and lives with his partner. He began his business in 1987 and this store has been the livelihood of his family. He hopes that it continues to be for many years to come. 

Juan´s main concern is competing against a strong adversary which are the supermarkets that are gradually expanding into the neighborhoods. 

Juan requests a loan to buy an assortment of basic staple products. He wants to have an adequate assortment and inventory to fulfill the demands and orders of his customers.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of basic staple products. He wants to have an adequate assortment and inventory to fulfill the demands and orders of his customers.

loans.name: Jhonn Fredys

texts.es:
Jhon es un joven soltero de 25 años, una persona trabajadora que quiere un mejor futuro para su él y su familia, en el momento se le puede ver trabajando en su local, pues iniciara un cibercafé y tu puedes ayudarle, darle el ultimo empujón que necesita esta persona para montar el negocio del que espera se convierta en el sostenimiento económica de su hogar.
