Ella es una persona muy luchadora que pone todo de si para poder crecer, pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
LLeidy is from the city of Caaguazú, she’s studying management in agricultural sciences, and through her studies she wants to make her way in order to be able to help her family.
She is a person who strives and gives her all in order to be able to grow. She’s asking for this loan to be able to pay her school fees and thus be able to continue.

loans.use: pay university fees.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married woman with four children. She owns a house that has piped water and electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
Sarah has operated a tailoring business for the past 20 years. She makes suits for men and women. She dreams of establishing a boutique shop in the future. 

With the loan Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase cloth, materials, and sewing thread for her business. 

She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, materials, and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Erkamo

texts.en:
Erkamo is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1974. She is living in a big city with her family. She is married and has two children. 

Her husband is a constructor. She is housekeeper. She helps her husband and also keeps livestock at home. They do not have a refrigerator to put food in during the hot weather. She wants to buy a refrigerator in order to keep their food from spoiling. She appealed to IMON for financial support to buy a refrigerator. 

She awaits KIVA lenders compassion and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is  a married woman and has five children. She  owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past ten years, Amalia has operated a fruit-selling business. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she wants to purchase sacks of fruit for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruit for resale

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a seller from Ungheni in Moldova. She owns a small shop in the city where she sells clothes, especially for women, with beautiful dresses and fine lingerie. Her products are particularly appreciated for celebrations (weddings, birthday…). She is married, her husband is a builder and they have two children, a boy and a little girl. Experienced, Cristina works with her mother and wants to expand her business in the coming years.

Cristina will use the loan to buy a new place to sell her clothes on the open air market.

loans.use: to buy a new place to sell her clothes on the open air market

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a professional truck driver from the Ungheni region. He owns this truck for more than 10 years and has crossed thousands of kilometers with it, carrying cereals, which helps farmers selling their products to a good price. He is married. His wife takes care of his daughter and three sons. 
He will use the loan to buy a trailer to transport more cereals from local farmers to be sold on market and exported.
The income that result will help Lilian to pay his children’s school and especially to finance his daughter’s studies.

loans.use: to buy a trailer to transport more cereals

loans.name: Ion

texts.en:
Ion is a farmer from Coseni village, Ungheni region in Moldova. He is owning a small land where he grows crops for his sheep, goats and chickens. Ion manages his sheep and goats farm many years, producing goat, sheep cheese and wool that he sells locally. Ion is a loving father of a little daughter. His wife is a medical assistant and helps Ion in managing this farm. 
This hard-working farmer wants to develop his business around the sheep that he owns and increase his income as well as improve the conditions his animals are living in.
Ion will use the loan to build a new fold for his sheep and goats and extend by this mean his farm's capacities.

loans.use: to build a new fold for his sheep and goats

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman is 36 years old. He is married and has 2 children. His wife Natalia and Roman have been working for 5 years in a grocery. Roman wants to buy fruits and vegetables to sell them at worktable from open air market. He is requesting 50000 MDL loan from Smart Credit, which will help him to have his own business. 
This loan will help Roman not just to support the family, but will be a big step to fulfill his dreams.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell at worktable on open air market

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en:
Bosco is a married man who is 28 years old. He lives in a rural area with his wife. He deals in agriculture, specifically the growing of passion fruit and pineapples. He works six days a week, 10 hours a day.

Bosco started his business in 2005 with the aim of earning a living since he dropped out of school at a tender age. He has obtained this loan in order to buy fertilizers to boost his passion-fruit plantation yields.

Bosco's clients are traders from surrounding towns. His dream is to be the leading producer of passion fruit, but his biggest challenges are lack of sufficient capital and unpredictable weather changes.  Bosco describes himself as a hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is farmer from Untesti village Ungheni region, Moldova. She is married, has one boy Victor. Her husband Alexander and their boy Victor help her in their farm. She has grown for more than 10 years tomatoes and cucumbers. She has started a year ago to grow new culture of tree Paulownia. This tree, originated from China, grows up to 20 m in only 3 years. It is perfect to make luxury furniture, yachts, and small planes. Now plantation has 7000 of saplings. 
With this loan Maria wants to expand plantation of Paulownia and to plant 900 saplings of paulownia. It will permit to increase her income and develop stable business of producing valuable wood.

loans.use: to plant saplings of paulownia

loans.name: Mihail

texts.en:
Mihail is a warehouse employee from Ungheni in Moldova. He works in a depot everyday with his son and also develops his little farm beside. Married, Mihail and his wife have five children and take care of them : three daughters and two sons, one of them who works with him. Serious and motivated, Mihail wants to develop his farm to answer his family’s needs, and be self employed and sell his own products.
Mihail will use the loan to build a new stable for his animals.

loans.use: to build a new stable for his animals

loans.name: Chin's Group

texts.en:
Chin is a 39-year-old woman who lives in a rural area of Battambang province and who is the mother of two children. She earns income to support her family by selling fish and working in construction and has been doing so for fifteen years.

Having sufficient funds to buy fish for resale is Chin's main business challenge, so she has decided to take out a new loan from VisionFund. This is her eighth loan cycle, and her family’s standard of living has improved through the past loans. She is now applying for a new loan of 2,000,000 Cambodian riels (KHR), while another member of the group is seeking a loan of 1,500,000 KHR. As the group leader, Chin is going to use her entire loan portion to buy fish for resale. She hopes this loan will help her to earn more income and thus upgrade her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fish for resale

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia es una hermosa joven de 20 años de edad, que desea estudiar, comprar vivienda, apoyar a sus padres, por ello inicio un negocio de venta de alimentos fritos, como ven en la foto tiene un fogón improvisado, una mesa, un mantel y una sombrilla pero con esas pocas cosas logro algo genial y es generar recursos que ayudan al sostenimiento del hogar y que le están dando la oportunidad de estudiar para convertirse en toda una profesional.

Natalia en su negocio vende empanadas y pasteles principalmente, no ha podido aumentar su producción debido a sus obligaciones financieras y al alto costo de los insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos.

Natalia busca un apoyo financiero para la compra de insumos en cantidades su idea es tener disponibilidad de inventario y ganar algo de dinero comprándolos en cantidades mayores.
texts.en:
Natalia, aged 20, is a lovely young woman who wants to study, buy a house and support her parents and this is why she bought a fried food business. As you can see in the photo she has an improvised stove, a table, a cloth and an umbrella but with these few items she manages something great, which is generating an income which helps to support the household and which is giving her the opportunity to study to become a true professional. In her business Natalia sells mainly empanadas and pastries. She has not been able to increase her output because of her financial obligations and the high cost of the supplies for preparing her food.

Natalia is seeking financial support to buy supplies in bulk, with the idea of having stock available and making a bit of money by buying the supplies in larger quantities.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk with the idea of having stock available and making a bit of money by buying in larger quantities.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer veterana de 61 años de edad, vive con su esposo y por ningún motivo permite que este la mantenga, es una mujer con carácter, sería, centrada en lo suyo, tiene un negocio de venta de ropa con el cual genera el sustento para ayudar en los gastos del hogar y sus gastos personales.

Su meta es tener una entrada de dinero generado por su esfuerzo y trabajo y que le permite costearse sus antojos y ayudar al progreso y reparación de su hogar.

Ana quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de mercancía de ropa para dama, vende mercancía enfocada a adultos mayores.
texts.en:
61-year-old Ana is a senior citizen. She lives with her husband and in no way wants him to support her. She is a serious woman with character who is very focused on her family. She has a business selling clothing, from which she makes a living to help with the household costs and her personal expenses. 

Her goal is to have an income which she has earned through her own hard work, which allows her to buy whatever she wants and help towards improving and repairing her home.

Ana wants to ask for a loan to buy ladies' clothing. The clothing she sells is aimed at senior citizens.

loans.use: to buy ladies' clothing to sell, aimed at senior citizens.

loans.name: Fructuoso

texts.es:
Fructuoso es un hombre de 35 años de edad que se gana la vida vendiendo alimentos, principalmente carne de cerdo, la cual vende en sabaneta, dicho negocio ha sido el soporte económico de su familia constituida por él, su esposa y 4 hijos de 14, 13, 7 y 5 años de edad.

Su propósito con el negocio es brindar una estabilidad económica  y un ambiente rodeado de positivismo de un sí se puede comprar casa, de un sí se puede estudiar, de que es posible salir adelante y tener mejores bienes.

Para lograr su cometido Fructuoso necesita vender mayor número de alimentos por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de carne de cerdo en cantidades, ofertara mayor cantidad para llegar a más personas.
texts.en:
Fructuoso is a 35-year-old man who makes a living selling food, mainly pork, which he sells in Sabaneta. This business has provided the financial support for his family which is made up of him and his wife and their 4 children aged 14, 13, 7 and 5 years. His aim is for the business to provide financial stability and surround them with a positive environment where yes, it is possible to buy a house and yes, it is possible to have an education, where it's possible to make progress in life and be better off.

To achieve his mission Fructuoso needs to sell a larger quantity of food, which is why he is asking for a loan to buy pork in bulk, so he can sell a larger quantity to more people.

loans.use: to buy pork in bulk in order to have a larger quantity to sell to more people.

loans.name: Karem Margarita

texts.es:
Karem es una joven de 20 años de edad, una persona humilde, trabajadora la cual tiene un negocio de tienda de abarrotes que inicio con el deseo de apoyar económicamente a su madre, no tiene hijo, ni pareja, solo trabaja por mantener a sus viejos que tanto ama.

Esta mujer aunque es poco creíble pero verdad trabaja la increíble cantidad de 17 horas por día, solo ese número denota lo comprometida que está con ayudar a sus padres y mejorar su condición económica.

Karem para mejorar su vivienda, vender mayor cantidad de surtido, tener mejor surtido solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos como refrescos, abarrotes, granos y productos de aseo personal y doméstico.
texts.en:
Karem is a young woman who is 20 years old, a humble person, hard-working, who has a business of a grocery store which she started with the wish of helping her mother economically. She has no partner and no spouse, she only works to support her parents, whom she loves.

Although it is hard to believe, but true, this woman works the incredible amount of 17 hours per day. Just this number shows how committed she is to helping her parents and improving her economic situation. 

Karem, to improve her house and to have and sell a larger amount of stock, asks for a loan to purchase products like sodas, groceries, grains, and personal care and cleaning products.

loans.use: to buy products such as sodas, groceries, grains, and personal care and cleaning products.

loans.name: Lucie

texts.en:
Lucie is aged 49. She is married with three children between the ages of 7 and 13. They all go to school. She is a farmer and has been in business for the past eight years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings and to pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en:
Joselyne is 26-years-old. She is married with two children aged between 2 and 5. One of them goes to school. She is a farmer and has been in a business for the past five years. Her husband is a business man. With the loan from Kiva, Joselyne would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to buy piece.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Sveta

texts.ru: Света, 32 года, замужем, мать 4 детей школьного и дошкольного возраста. У нее среднее образование. Света в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи в 2003 году начала свой бизнес в полеводстве и животноводстве. Благодаря упорному труду она на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеет 2 коровы, 10 овец, 2 лошади. На участке 0,31 Га она выращивает ячмень. Видя хороший источник дохода в сельском хозяйстве, Света обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для отгона на пастбище и откорм. Доходы от кредита Света планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства, что позволит накопить на покупку мебели.
texts.en:
Sveta is 32 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children of school and pre-school age. She has a secondary education. In search of a source of income for her family, Sveta began her field and animal husbandry business in 2003. Thanks to her very hard work, her farm now has 2 cows, 10 sheep, and 2 horses. She grows barley on a 0.31 hectare plot of land.

Seeing a good source of income in agriculture, Sveta has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to put to pasture and fatten up. Sveta plans to invest the proceeds from her loan in the further improvement of her farm, which will allow her to buy some furniture.

loans.use: to buy some cows for fattening in the field and subsequent resale.

loans.name: Anipa

texts.ru: Анипа, 49 лет, вдова, есть 5 детей. У Анипы среднее образование. На протяжении 15 лет в качестве дохода для своей семьи занимается разведением скота и полеводством. У Анипы есть 0,60 Га земли, где выращивает кукурузу, помидоры, капусту. Она известна, как трудолюбивый, честный, добрый человек. На сегодняшний день деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 8,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для продажи экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и намерена в будущем построить летнюю кухню.
texts.en:
Anipa is 49 years old, a widow, and has five children. Anipa has a high school education. As a source of income for her family, she has worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation for a period of 15 years. 

Anipa has 0.60 hectares of land, where she grows sweet corn, tomatoes and cabbage. She is known as a hardworking, honest and good person. Currently the business brings her a monthly income of 8,000 som (KGS). 

To further develop her business, Anipa turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase a dairy cow to sell ecological milk. She plans to use the income from the loan to further develop her business, and also intends to build an outdoor kitchen in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow in order to sell ecological milk

loans.name: Nargis

texts.ru: Наргис 29 летняя женщина. Она замужем и не имеет детей. Наргис уже год живет одна. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Наргис смелая и активная женщина. Она у себя дома предоставляет услуги портнихи уже более 10 лет. У нее много клиентов, и постепенно вырастают количество клиентов. У нее средняя образования, и она мечтала стать швеей, потому что Наргис любить любит кроить и шить. Наргис живет в городке Исфара в старом доме. Она много лет назад хотела отремонтировать дом, но то время у них не было возможности, муж был без работы.  Сейчас Наргис очень хочет отремонтировать дом, она копила немного денег и ей не хватает для завершения ремонта. Она решила взять кредит и закончить ремонт. Наргиса очень хочет жить комфортно и уютно. Вы можете поддержать ее сейчас!
texts.en:
Nargis is a 29 years old woman. She is married but does not have any children. Nargis has lived alone for a year. Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation. 

Nargis is a brave and active woman. She has provided a sewing service from her home for more than 10 years. She has many customers and step by step grows the number of them. She has a high school education and dreamed of becoming a seamstress, as she loves to cut and sew. 

Nargis lives in the city of Isfara, in an old house. She has dreamed of renovating her home for many years, but to this day she has not had the possibility to do so, as her husband was without work. Currently Nargis would very much like to renovate her home. She saved up some money, but this is not enough to complete the renovation. She decided to take a loan and finish the renovation. Nargis would very much like to live comfortably and cozy. You can currently help her!

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Guldariha

texts.ru: Гулдариха, 34 года, замужем, вместе с мужем воспитывает 2 детей. Образование  -высшее, работает в Общественном Фоде, помогающем детям. Ежемесячная заработная плата составляет 36,000 сом (KGS). Гулдариха обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на обустройство и ремонт ванной комнаты в доме. На полученные средства приобретет кафель, раковину, душевую кабину. Свои доходы Гулдариха планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en:
Guldariha is 34 years old, married, and is raising 2 children with her husband. She has a post-secondary education, and she works in a public foundation that helps children. Her monthly salary is 36,000 som (KGS). 

Guldariha has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) for the construction and renovation of a bathroom in her house. She will purchase tile, a sink, and a shower with the money she receives. Guldariha plans to use her income to continue improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase tile, a sink, and a shower to make some improvements to her bathroom.

loans.name: Buzubaida

texts.ru: Бузубайда, 46 лет, замужем, дети взрослые, есть трехгодовалая внучка. У Бузубайды среднее образование, в качестве источника доходов для семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав бизнес в 1993 году с 5,000 сом (KGS). Супруг и дети активно помогают по хозяйству. На сегодня в хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 10 овец, на 1,0 Га земли выращивает арбузы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бузубайда обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы с теленком для увеличения объемов реализации экологически-чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Бузубайда планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Buzubaida is 46 years old and married. Her children are adults, and she has a three years old grandchild. Buzubaida has a high school education. 

As a source of income for her family, she works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started this business in 1993 with 5,000 som (KGS). Her husband and children help her actively with the farm. Currently Buzubaida has four cows and ten sheep on her farm. She grows watermelon on 1.0 hectares of land. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Buzubaida turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase a dairy cow with calf to increase the volume of ecological milk for selling. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow with calf in order to increase the volume of ecological milk for selling

loans.name: Mayra Alejandra

texts.es:
La juventud, las ganas de progresar, de apoyar a su madre llevaron a la joven Mayra a montar un negocio de salón de belleza, inicio con un capital bajo, ella es una persona humilde que desea salir adelante y cambiar su presente.

Su meta es comprar una vivienda propia, una para regalarla a su madre como agradecimiento por tanto que le ha dado, y ahora pide ayuda, es joven no cuenta con capital y necesita equipo para desarrollar su profesión con normalidad.

Mayra desea solicitar un apoyo financiero para la compra de un secador y una máquina de motilar, el resto del capital será para adecuaciones de su puesto de trabajo.
texts.en:
Youth, a desire to progress and support her mother brought young Mayra to open a beauty salon with a little capital. Mayra is humble and wants to do better and change her life.

Mayra's goal is to buy her own house to give to her mother to show how grateful she is for all that she has given her. Mayra is asking for help: she does not have any capital and needs to buy equipment to continue with her business.

Mayra is applying for a loan in order to buy a hairdryer and clippers; the rest of the loan will be used to make changes to her working area.

loans.use: to buy a hairdryer and clippers; the rest of the loan will be used to make changes to her working area.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique está ´poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder cumplir su meta de ser un profesional exitoso en ingeniería química, comenta que su anterior préstamo recibido de kiva lo uso en poder comprar sus materiales de estudio, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Enrique is putting forth his best effort to accomplish his goal of being a successful chemical engineering professional. He says that he used his previous Kiva loan to buy study materials, which was a big help.

Today, he requests a new loan in order to be able to pay university fees, and thus be able to continue his studies as he is doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en:
Marie Rose is 35 years old. She is married and has three children aged between 4 and 10 years. Two of them go to school. 

She is a farmer and she has been in this business for the past seven years.  Also, her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and to pay school fees of her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is age 35 years. She is married and has three children between 2 and 8 years. Two of them go to school. 

She is a farmer and she has been in this business for the past six years. Also, her husband is a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings and to pay school fees of her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is age 46 years. She is married and has four children between 10 and 21 years. They all go to school. 

She is a farmer and she has been in this business for the past seven years. Also, her husband is a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings and to pay school fees of her children and to buy medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is age 49 years. She is married and has two children, 17 and 22 years old. They both go to school. 

She is a farmer and she has been in this business for the past eight years. Her husband is a businessman. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.name: Daprose

texts.en:
Daprose is age 46 years. She is married and has four children between 12 and 21 years old.  They all go to school. 

She is a farmer and she has been in this business for the past seven years. Also, her husband is a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and to buy a piece of land. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Gaudance

texts.en:
Gaudance aged 41 years. She is married with 4 children aged between 6 and 16 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 7 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay the workers who harvested her maize.

loans.name: Lydie

texts.en:
Lydie is 61 years old. She is married with 5 children aged 15 and 27 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and he has been in a business for the past 7 years.  Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to improve his welfare and to increase milk production.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more cows for rearing. and producing more milk for sale

loans.name: Pedro Martes

texts.es:
Él es Pedro un orgulloso zapatero de 50 años de edad que se siente feliz y motivado al ver que su negocio va en vía de ascenso, saber que su familia conformada por su esposa y sus dos hijas tienen una buena calidad de vida y de que en el momento está solicitando un apoyo, no para mantenerse, para ampliarse y producir mayor número de mercancía mejorando sus ingresos.

Pagar la educación de sus hijos cada vez está mas cerca, por ello Pedro necesita un apoyo financiero para la compra de materiales para la elaboración y reparación de calzado como suelas, tela, cuero, pegamento, entre otros.

Este préstamo será determinante en el plan de crecimiento del zapatero Pedro, anímate apóyalo, tu préstamo brindara a este hombre la herramienta para forjar un mejor futuro para su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro is a proud 50 year old shoemaker who is very happy and motivated that his business is growing.  His family is made up of his wife and two daughters who enjoy a good quality of life.  He's currently requesting support, not for his sustenance, rather to grow his business and produce a larger quantity of merchandise to improve his income.
Paying for the education of his children is getting closer so Pedro needs financial support to buy materials for making and fixing shoes, including soles, cloth, leather, glue, and other materials.  This loan will determine Pedro's growth plan.  Support him!  The loan will give this man the tools to work for a better future for his family.

loans.use: to buy materials for making and fixing shoes, including soles, cloth, leather, glue, and other materials.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is 44 years old. He is married with 5 children aged between 8 and 19 years, they all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 7 years. While his wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay the workers who harvested his maize.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo vive con su padre y un hermano, está trabajando en un centro de estética y a la vez está estudiando la carrera de enfermería para poder crecer y mejorar.
Actualmente su deseo es llegar a trabajar en un hospital renombrado en la ciudad para que de esa manera pueda aumentar sus ingresos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar los gastos de su titulacion, para cubrir sus gastos y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Pablo lives with his father and a brother. He works at an aesthetic center and also studies nursing so he can grow and improve.  Currently his goal is to work at a renowned hospital in the city so that he can increase his income.  
He's requesting the loan to pay for his college fees, cover his expenses, and in this way be able to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to cover his college expenses.

loans.name: Madeleines Del Carmen

texts.es:
Todo empezó en el año 2002 cuando preocupada por la situación económica de su familia Madeleines comenzó a poner a producir sus conocimientos en confección que adquirió años anteriores y monto un pequeño negocio donde confeccionaba línea ropa de propia.

Gracias a su buenos resultados ha mejorado las condiciones de su familia, su esposo sus dos hijas de 16 y 14 años viven mejor e incluso se sueña con darle a su hija menor una gran fiesta de 15 años, con vestido, mariachis, con el baile, la celebración con amigos y familia.

Madeleines quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de tela, broches, remaches, cuero para la fabricación de prendas para hombre y caballero.
texts.en:
Everything started in 2002 when Madeleines started her own business making clothes.  She started it out of concern for the economic situation of her family and because she had experience making clothes for some years already.  Thanks to her good results she's been able to improve her family's living conditions, including her husband and 2 daughters of 14 and 16 years of age.  
She dreams of having a big celebration for her youngest daughter's 15th birthday including the dress, mariachis, dance, and sharing the occasion with friends and family. 
Madeleines is requesting a loan to buy cloth, brooches, rivets, and leather for making men's clothing.

loans.use: to buy cloth, brooches, rivets, and leather for making men's clothing.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Solo palabras de admiración se puede llevar la señora Luz Marina una persona de 55 años de edad, madre cabeza de familia la cual crio y levanto a tres hijos, su único apoyo fue su negocio, su tienda de abarrotes que ha significado progreso y estabilidad en su familia.

Luz Marina ahora que crió y levanto a sus muchachos va por un viejo deseo comprar una vivienda propia y pondrá toda su experiencia para lograr este sueño.

Solicita un préstamo para potenciar y ampliar su surtido de granos y lácteos, busca tener una gran disponibilidad de alimentos semejándose a un mini-mercado.
texts.en:
Only words of admiration can be used for Luz Marina, a 55 year old person. She is a single mother who raised her three children with her only support being her general store. It has meant progress and stability in her family.

Now that Luz Marina has raised her kids, she is turning to an old desire to own her own home. She will use all of her experience to achieve this dream. 

She is asking for a loan to boost and expand her selection of grains and dairy products. She seeks to have a wide availability of food, to be more like a mini-market.

loans.use: to boost and expand her selection of grains and dairy products.

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francios is 31 years old. He is married with two children aged 7 and 13 years. They both go to school. He is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past five years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalia una mujer de 48 años de edad, una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora, que monto un negocio de sala de computo, su  negocio surgió de una necesidad de empleo para ella y de la falta de un negocio que ofertara estos servicios en el pueblo.

Rosalia vive con su pareja, tiene el negocio en su hogar y lucha por ganar dinero para pagar educación de calidad a sus dos hijos que tienen 14 y 15 años de edad.

Mejorar las ventas, sostenibilidad del negocio, ser competitiva es lo que busca Rosalia con un préstamo que necesita realizar para la compra de una impresora multifuncional y un computador, ya que tiene la necesidad de ampliar su capacidad de servicio y la urgencia de tener el servicio de impresión y fotocopiadora en su local.
texts.en:
Rosalia is a 48-year-old woman, enterprising and hard-working. She started a business running an internet café. This business arose from a need for employment on her part, as well as the lack of any business offering these services in town.

Rosalia lives with her partner. She runs her business out of her home and strives to earn money to pay for a quality education for her two children, who are 14 and 15 years old.

With this loan, Rosalia hopes to improve sales, achieve sustainability for her business and be competitive. She needs the loan in order to buy a multi-purpose printer and a computer, as she must expand her service capacity and it is important that she offer printing and photocopying services on her premises.

loans.use: buy a multi-purpose printer and a computer.

loans.name: Adrienne

texts.en:
Adrienne is 35 years old. She is married with four children aged between 3 and 15 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past five years. Her husband is a businessman. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand is 37 years old. He is married with two children aged 3 and 5 years. One of them goes to school. He is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past four years. His wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: A sus 69 años de edad María sigue siendo el pilar económico de su familia, ella una humilde mujer que usó su cocina como herramienta de trabajo para montar un negocio de comidas hoy pide tu ayuda, un apoyo para comprar activos e insumos que le permitan llevar su negocio a otro nivel, pues gracias a las capacitaciones, charlas, visitas por parte de los asesores de interactuar noto el gran potencial que tiene su empresa y como una licuadora industrial, un fogón, micro-hondas y mayor cantidad de insumos le servirían para mejorar sus ventas mensuales, por tal razón solicita un apoyo económico para comprar estos implementos, buscando un objetivo de organizar su hogar como siempre había soñado.
texts.en: At 69 years old, María continues to be the economic pillar of her family. She is a humble woman who used her kitchen as a tool to open a food business. Today she is asking for your help to buy assets and materials that will allow her to bring her business to another level. Thanks to her trainings, talks, and visits with consultants, she saw the great potential her business has. An industrial blender, an oven,  micro-wave and a larger quantity of materials will improve her monthly sales. That is the reason she is asking for financial support to buy these items, seeking the objective of organizing her home, as she has always dreamed.

loans.use: an industrial blender, a stove, a micro-wave, and a larger quantity of materials to increase her monthly sales.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with five kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Grace operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells in the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Theara's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province, Theara is 29 years old. She is a mother of three children. One is in school and the other two are too young. To support her family, she grows rice and works for others for a fee to earn more income. She can earn about 24,200 KHR per day. This is her first time with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy wood to renovate her house. She hopes that she can update her lifestyle to be better than before.

loans.use: to buy wood to renovate her house

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has piped water and electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
Jane has operated a tailoring business for the past 15 years. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. With the 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Dancille

texts.en:
Dancille is 45 years old. She is married with seven children aged between 4 and 22 years. Five of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past six years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to increase her welfare.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Livasoa Dina

texts.fr:
Livasoa Dina est une femme courageuse et travailleuse de 29 ans. Elle est mère d'un enfant de 4 ans et elle doit l'élever toute seule. Le père a fuit ses responsabilité et l'a laissé à se débrouiller toute seule. 
Elle exerce une activité de vente ambulante de friperie depuis 2010 spécialement des pantalons jeans.  Elle quitte toujours sa maison à 4 heure pour joindre le marché le matin et n'y revient qu'à 19h 30 le soir .C'est le genre d'activité exploitée par la plupart des membres de sa famille. Elle va renouveler ses stocks de marchandises avec le prêt et elle va en profiter de proposer d'autres articles comme des ballerines et sandales.
Elle habite dans une maison d'héritage non encore partagée et de ce fait , elle désire construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Livasoa Dina is a brave and hard-working woman of 29 years old. She has a 4-year-old child that she is raising alone since the child’s father abandoned them. 

She started selling second-hand clothing as an itinerant vendor in 2010, offering mainly denim jeans. She leaves her house at 4:00 AM to get to the market early in the morning, and only returns at 7:30 PM at night. Most of her family members practice a similar activity. 

She will use her loan to replenish her stock of merchandise to sell and she wants to add different items such as ballet flats and sandals. 

Her ambition is to have her own house as she currently lives in a house that is part of an inheritance not yet settled.

loans.use: to buy second-hand jeans for resale.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 26 years old and is married with two children between the ages of one and four. Her children do not yet go to school. For the past three years, Jacqueline has been a farmer. Her husband is a farmer too. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.  

Jacqueline is requesting a Kiva loan to pay workers who harvested her maize. She will use the profit from her loan to increase her welfare, to pay school fees of her children, and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to pay workers who harvested maize

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is 30 years old and is married with a 13.5 year old child who goes to school. For the past four years, Olive has been a farmer who grows maize. Her husband is a farmer too. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.  

Olive is requesting a Kiva loan to pay workers who harvested her maize. She will use the profit from her loan to improve her welfare, to pay school fees for her children, and to buy a cow.

loans.use: to pay workers who harvested maize

loans.name: Koryun

texts.en: Koryun is 51 years old and lives in the village Tsovagyugh in the Gegharkunik region. He lives with his wife. Koryun used to work as a driver but now he is farmer who does his best to develop and enlarge his farm. On his farm, Koryun has cows, calves, a bull, and also piglets. The assortment of his farm products, such as milk, meat, and macun (the national dairy product), are greatly limited and the income hardly covers his family’s needs. Koryun is more than hopeful that his farm will become more profitable in the near future. He needs to buy fodder for his farm's cattle, and this loan amount will be a great support for Koryun.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his cattle

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman with seven children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a cereals shop, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans

loans.name: Laurent

texts.en:
Laurent is 54 years old and is married with four children between the ages of 15 and 22. His children go to school. For the past nine years, Laurent has been a farmer who grows maize. His wife is a businesswoman. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.  

Laurent is requesting a Kiva loan to pay workers who harvested his maize. He will use the profit from his loan to pay school fees for his children and to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to pay workers who harvested maize

loans.name: Phorl

texts.en:
Phorl is 62 years old and the mother of nine children. She lives in a rural area of the Kampong Chnang province. Nowadays, she works rice farming and catching fish to earn an income to support her family. Phorl earns about 7.26 USD daily.

Phorl is requesting a 645 USD loan to buy a solar light system. This will be her eighth loan with the Kiva partner VisionFund. Phorl hopes her loan will help her to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy a solar light bulb

location.town: Kampong Chnang Province, Chol Kiri District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, sweets, biscuits, and soap to sell

loans.name: Zuhrojon

texts.ru: 58 летняя женщина Зухрочон. Она счастливая бабушка и мама. У нее муж, сын, невестка и внук. Муж и сын находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации уже много лет. Невестке 28 лет, она помогает в работе Зухрочон. Зухрочон 20 лет занимается шитьем женской одежды. Еще она занимается животноводством у себя во дворе. У нее все получается, она старается, и не ждет отправки денег мужа и сына. Зухрочон сильная и трудолюбивая женщина. Несмотря на свой возраст, продвигает деятельности вперед. Зухрочон хочет купить скота и корма для запаса. Больше времени она проводят на скотном дворе. Зухрочону нужны деньги для расширения животноводческой деятельности. С большими надеждами она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Zuhrojon is 58.  She is a happy mother and grandmother.  She has a husband, a son, a daughter-in-law and a grandson.  Her husband and her son have been working in the Russian Federation for many years already.  Her daughter-in-law is 28 and helps her with her work.  Zuhrojon has been sewing women's clothes for the past 20 years.  In addition, she is involved in animal husbandry at home.  She has met success in all her activities; she works very hard and doesn't wait for the money that her husband and son send her.  

Zuhrojon is a strong and hardworking woman.  In spite of her age, she is able to always develop her activity.  At the moment, she wants to buy cattle and stock up on animal feed.  She spends the majority of her time with her livestock.  She needs money to increase her animal husbandry activity.  She is placing all her hopes in this loan.

loans.use: to increase her animal husbandry activity and to buy cattle.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego es un humilde, adorable, consentido abuelito de 71 años de edad, una persona de admirar ya que a su edad, a pesar de las enfermedades y otros inconvenientes sigue en pie de lucha trabajando en su negocio de cría de aves ya que él es el encargado de generar los recursos para su mantenimiento y el de su esposa.

Diego es padre de 4 hijos ya ellos tienen familia y como no le gusta molestarlo trabajo y adquiere por sus méritos su sustento y comida diaria.

Dejar el negocio de apoyo para sus hijos es su meta, vivir una vejez tranquila sin pasar necesidades es su sueño.-

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de pollos y alimento para aves.
texts.en:
Diego is a humble, charming, favourite grandpa. He is 71 years old and admirable because at his age, despite illnesses and other disadvantages, he is still standing and fighting to work. He has a business raising poultry and is responsible for the income to support himself and his wife.

Diego is a father of four children who have families themselves. As he does not like to bother them, he works and gains his daily food and sustenance by his own means. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of chickens and bird feed.

His goal is to leave his business to his children to support themselves, and his dream is to live peacefully into old age without suffering hardships.

loans.use: to buy chickens and bird feed.

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Agée de 35 ans et mariée, Amélé est une femme qui habite à Baguida avec deux enfants.  Amélé est une commerçante de friperies qui vend ses articles dans son quartier et alentours pour satisfaire favorablement ses clients. Cette activité permet à  Amélé d’avoir une bonne épargne pour investir dans la vie éducative de ses enfants.  Amélé s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché.  Amélé demande ce crédit pour commander des serviettes, des draps et des rideaux. Grâce au bénéfice,  Amélé souhaite améliorer ses prestations et bien s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Amélé is 35 years old, married and lives in Baguida with her two children. Amélé sells second-hand clothing in her neighborhood and nearby, trying to meet customer demand well. This business allows Amélé to grow her savings intended for her children’s education. She stocks up at the market twice a month. 

Amélé is requesting this loan to buy towels, sheets and curtains. Thanks to this loan, she would like to improve her earnings and take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy 20 sheets, 20 towels and 30 curtains.

loans.name: Nematullo

texts.ru: Неъматулло молодой 25 летный бизнесмен. Он из района Хамадони. Неъматулло живет вместе отцом, матерью, женой и детьми. Отцу 50 лет. Мама 48 лет. Жене 21 лет. Дети еще маленькие. Неъматулло имеет свой не большой бизнес. Он занимается животноводством. Неъматчон выращивает крупнорогатого скота, где имеет коровник. В притяжение  2 года он научился ухаживать о животных и вести бизнес. Неъматчон покупает скота и откармливает их несколько месяцев, потом перепродает их на скотном рынке. У него сейчас осталось малое количество скота, который видите на фотографии. Он хочет увеличить поголовья скота и расширить бизнес. Для совершения данной операции ему нужны деньги. И по этой причине Неъматчон обратился за кредитом.
texts.en: Nematullo, age 25, is a young businessman from the Hamadoni district of Tajikistan.  He lives with his father, mother, wife and children.  His father is 50,  his mom 48.  His wife is 21 years old.  Nematullo owns a small animal-husbandry business.  He raises cattle and has his own barn.  He has learned his business, and how to take care of animals, over the past two years.  He buys cattle and feeds them for a few months before selling them again at the cattle market.  At the moment, as you can see in the photo, he only has a small number of animals.  Nematullo therefore wants to increase his cattle headcount and expand his business.  However, he needs money to do so, which is the reason why he is taking a loan.

loans.use: to increase his cattle headcount and expand his business.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is a married woman with three children. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 
With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize
 flour, beans and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize  flour, beans and wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more seeds

loans.name: Osmar

texts.es:
Osmar es estudiante de la carrera de contabilidad, está cursando el cuarto año, vive con mis padres, y comenta que se esfuerza para poder ser un buen profesional y ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Está contento por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar su matrícula y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Osmar is a college student majoring in accounting. He is in his fourth year, and lives with his parents. He remarks that he is trying hard so he can be a professional and help his loved ones. 
He is pleased to have this opportunity to continue studying, as he has been. 
He is requesting this loan to pay his tuition so he can continue with his studies.

loans.use: pay university tuition

loans.name: Jesus Hernando

texts.es:
Un accidente (ver manos) no es ningún impedimento para un hombre soñador, con hambre de triunfo y progreso, este empresario llamado Jesús es un hombre de 58 años de edad, se separó de su esposa con quien tuvo un hijo dejándoles el hogar.

Ahora Jesús tiene un restaurante el cual atiendo 12 horas del día, busca obtener de nuevo lo que había logrado en su juventud y sabe que con trabajo duro, humildad y alegría lo conseguirá.

Para disminuir los costos de la preparación de los platos típicos, disponer de capital de trabajo, inventario y realizar pago a los proveedores, Jesús solicita un apoyo económico, dicho apoyo será muy beneficioso pues le permitirá salir de sus deudas quedando solo con una que las puede ir pagando en cómodas cuotas cumplidamente.
texts.en:
An accident (see his hands) is no impediment for a man with a dream. With a hunger to triumph and progress, this businessman, named Jesus, is a 58 year old man. He separated from his wife, with whom he has a child, leaving them the home.

Now Jesús has a restaurant, where he works 12 hours a day. He seeks to obtain again what he achieved in his youth. He knows that with hard work, humility and cheerfulness, he will get it.

To lower the costs of preparing traditional dishes, have working capital and inventory available, and pay suppliers, Jesús is asking for financial support. This  support will be very beneficial because it will allow him to pay off his debts and he will only have one, which he can pay off with comfortable payments.

loans.use: to buy materials and assets for his restaurant.

loans.name: Sokhoun's Group

texts.en:
A young woman who has two children, Sokhoun is 24 years old and living in Kampong Cham province. Sokhoun does rice fields as the main source for her family’s income and she works for others farm for a fee to earn more income for six years to support her family. She could make income about 41,000KHR per day and she is able to save around 20,000KHR each day from her business.

Low rice yields and drought are the main challenge for her business. She has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle already and completely repaid her loan. The past loan has helped her better to support her family’s living. She is now leading a group of five members to ask for a new loan and she will use her loan portion to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that this loan will help her to get more income to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Kima

texts.en:
Kima, with her son’s family, lives in Sevan a city of Gegharkunik region. She is 56 years old and she has her own small business, a small animal and ornamental fish store, where she sells fishes and some animals, food for them and also various accessories for it as well.  Kima works very hard and she managed to gain a lot of customers during the years which now became her regular customers. 

As she mention her customers are mainly children with their parents and Kima is always happy to welcome them in her shop and she is always ready to give advises how to take care of it or what to feed. Kima each time mentions for her young customers that even very small fish needs care and love if you decided to keep it at your house. Kima now needs Kiva support as she wants to refresh her fish and animal assortment so to have better sale and attract new customers.

loans.use: to restock her small animal and ornamental fish store so to have better sales and attract new customers

loans.name: Diane Ester

texts.es:
Diane quien es una mujer de 42 años de edad felizmente casada ella trabaja como confeccionista a terceros, inicio su negocio con la convicción de tener una vivienda propia pero en su recorrido ha visto que le falta algo ese ingreso extra para ver este sueño más posible.

Diane en base a su conocimiento y a sus clientes concluyo que el proyecto más viable es tener una línea de ropa propia por ello hoy solicita la ayuda de la comunidad Kiva para tener ese primer empujón con que iniciar la confección de las prendas,

Este apoyo le permitirá mirar con mayor ambición su sueño de comprar una vivienda.
texts.en:
Diane, who is a 42 year old woman, is happily married. She works as a seamstress for third parties. She started her business with the idea of owning her own home. However, over time, she has seen that she lacks the extra income to see this dream come true.

Based on knowledge and her customers, Diane concluded that the most viable project is to have her own line of clothing. To do that, she is asking for help from the Kiva community to have that first boost to start making the clothing.

This support will allow her to treat her dream of buying a home with more ambition.

loans.use: to obtain fabric and supplementary items to make clothing.

loans.name: Felicienne

texts.en:
Felecienne aged 49 years. She is married with 4 children aged between 15 and 21 years and they all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been in business for the past 7 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more cows for rearing. The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings and to pay school fees of her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more cows for rearing.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie aged 41 years. She is married with 4 children aged between 5 and 21 years. All of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 7 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to increase her welfare and to pay school fees of her children to renovate her house. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay the workers who harvested her maize.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonse, 46, is married with five children between 9 and 23 years old. She is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past eight years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers to harvest her maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and pay school fees of her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers to harvest maize.

loans.name: Hay's Group

texts.en:
Hay lives in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province, is 47-year-old and is a mother of three children, only one of them is in school. Nowadays, she does rice farming, sells grocery items and raises pigs as the main sources for her family’s income and she works for others farm for fee to earn additional income. Having been in these businesses for twenty-nine years, she could make income about 48,000KHR per day and save around 20,000KHR each day from her expenses. 

Having many competitive sellers and received low rice yields are the main challenges for her family’s living. Now she is leading a group to take a loan with VisionFund and she is a group leader of four women members who have never been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Hay, who is the leader, will use her loan portion to buy piglets for raising. She hopes that her business will do well and generate her more income by this loan, so as she could keep her son in school.

loans.use: to buy piglets for raising and selling and so pay her sons school fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sylvain

texts.en:
Sylvain is 45 years old. He is married and has four children, aged between 2 and 13 years. Two of them go to school. He is a farmer, and he has been growing maize for the past seven years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to pay for medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a married woman with five children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past three years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. With the 15,000 KES loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize  flour, beans and wheat flour

loans.name: Manale

texts.en:
Manale is a 33-year-old Lebanese married woman for three children. In 2012, she started working from her home and she opened a small nursery where she equipped a room with all the needed details in order to receive the kids in order to provide her family with extra financial support. She is well-known in her region with the special talents in her domain. 

To better improve her job, she is requesting to borrow a second loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy child sized toys and tables. In the future, she plans to borrow more Kiva loans to further develop her work.

loans.use: to buy child sized toys and tables for her nursery

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en: Ruzanna is from the village of Arevshat in the Shirak region of Armenia where she is engaged in agribusiness. Ruzanna has a big family, but currently she lives only with her daughter-in-law and young granddaughter. Ruzanna's husband and eldest son left the country to find a job and sustain the family's income. Her second son serves in the army; thus, Ruzanna is the only person to take care of the family farm. She cultivates wheat, potato, carrot, and garlic on her farm. She keeps cattle, but the meat and milk gathered is for family use only. Ruzanna has asked for this loan to purchase fertilizer and forage for the cattle. Because the region where Ruzanna's village is located is considered poor and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Her loan has been approved within the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF, which provides loans to the under-served population of the Shirak region to help them access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and forage for her cattle.

loans.name: Lester Adalis

texts.es:
Los padres son el ejemplo a seguir para el futuro de cada hijo o hija, para Lester, su papá fue quien lo guió y lo apoyó para convertirse en el hombre trabajador que es ahora con su pulpería. A sus 41 años de edad, es padre de tres hijos de nueve, cuatro y dos años de edad, y esposo de una gran mujer que lo apoya día a día para salir adelante con su familia. Anteriormente Lester solicitó un préstamo para comprar productos de alta demanda como leche, pan y arroz, con el cual pudo generar grandes ganancias, por lo que agradece a todas las personas que le ayudaron con ese crédito. 
Lester también trabaja como cobrador de crédito de ropa y lleva más de ocho años con su pulpería y desea seguir invirtiendo en ella para que siga creciendo. Por esta razón, solicita un crédito para comprar una frízer y carne de pollo, pues es un producto que todos los días la mayoría de clientes solicita. Con esta inversión podrá tener grandes cantidades para siempre ofrecer a sus compradores. En sus planes tiene mejorar su casa y expandir su negocio, por lo que estos nuevos ingresos que tendrá le servirán de mucho para cumplir con ese sueño.
texts.en:
For every son or daughter, parents are an example to follow for the future. For Lester, his dad was the one who guided and supported him in becoming the hard-working man he is today with his grocery store. At 41 years old, Lester is the father of three children, nine, four, and two years old, and the husband of a great woman who supports him day in and day out to get ahead with his family.

Lester previously requested a loan to buy high-demand products like milk, bread and rice. With this he was able to make a large profit, for which he thanks all the people who helped him with that loan.

Lester also works as a clothing credit collector and has had his grocery store for more than eight years. He wishes to continue to invest in it so that it continues to grow. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy a freezer and chicken, as this is a product that the majority of his clients request every day. With this investment, he will be able to store large quantities and always be able to offer it to his customers. His plans include improving his house and expanding his business, and the additional income he will have will help him very much in achieving this dream.

loans.use: to buy chicken and a freezer.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
