James is a married man aged 24 year. He lives in rural area with his wife and they have two kids who are still young. He deals in agriculture specifically growing bananas and he supplements his family income with banana trading. He works six days a week and each day she works for 10 hours.
He started his business in 2005 with the aim of getting money for his family welfare since he dropped out of school at tender age.. 

He is acquiring this loan facility in order to buy fertilizers to boost the yields of his banana plantation.
His clients are traders from surrounding towns. He apparently lives in a semi permanent house and dreams of building  a better residential house house for his family. He still has challenges limited capital which he envisages to be history in the near future.
He describes himself as a hard working man.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers for his banana plantation

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Una luchadora incansable así es Carolina una mujer viuda de 63 años de edad que ante la ausencia de su esposo busco una alternativa para generar ingresos y gracias  a los consejos y apoyo de amigos y familiares monto un negocio de tienda de abarrotes.

Carolina es madre de dos hijos ya mayores de edad, su principal preocupación pasa por generar los recursos para mantener el hogar que le dejo su esposo.

Tratando de incrementar el número de clientes a partir de nueva exhibición de productos carolina busca un apoyo financiero que le permita aumentar y variar su inventario en productos de aseo personal, aseo doméstico y granos.
texts.en: Carolina, a 63 year old widow, is a tireless fighter.  In light of her husband’s absence, she looked for an opportunity to generate income and, thanks to the advice of her family and friends, she set up a grocery store business.  Carolina is the mother of two adult children.  Her main concern is generating income to maintain the home that her husband left her.  Trying to increase the number of customers from her new product display, Carolina is seeking financial support, which will allow her to increase and vary her inventory of personal care and household cleaning products as well as grains.

loans.use: to increase and vary her inventory of personal care and household cleaning products as well as grains.

loans.name: Orn's Group

texts.en:
Orn, 35, lives with family members in a rural area of the Kampong Thom province and is a mother of three dependent children. For her family’s living, she can earn income via cassava, cashew apple growing and rice growing. Moreover, she can earn more income via working for others for a fee. She has been involved her business for ages and earns her about 22,600KHR per day. 

This is third cycles for Orn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans successfully. In a group of four members, she is the group leader. She will use her loan portion to renovate her family's latrine. She hopes that her family can live in healthy than before.

loans.use: to renovate her latrine for the health and welfare of her family

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 55 years old, a widow and mother of 4 children.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She is doing it for many years with her son (also shown in the photo). They earn enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested for a loan of 45000 PKR  to buy sewing material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons etc to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons etc to sew more dresses on time

loans.name: Zeeban

texts.en:
Zeeban is 52 years old, a married woman and mother of 4 children. She is working hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education.   She with her husband is doing work of agriculture for some years. They grow different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.  

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds with the packs of insecticides and pesticides, currently Zeeban has applied a loan of 40000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops which ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with the packs of insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 30 years old. He is married and has three children, aged 4 and 9 years. They all go to school. He is a farmer, and he has been growing maize for the past three years. His wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Dúo Eclipse Group

texts.es: Dúo Eclipse: es grupo esta conformado por la señora Sindy Consuelo de 25 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de pan y a la venta de frutas, se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia para la venta, espera que le pedan ayudar con el credito para seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Sindy Consuelo, age 25, is a member of The Dúo Eclipse group.  She sells bread and fruits.  She has been engaged in this business activity for several years.

At this time she is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise to sell.  She hopes that you can help her with the loan in order to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy supplies to sell bread and to buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: Frodonatha

texts.en:
Frodonatha aged 56 years and is married with 3 children aged between 17 and 24 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 9 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow for rearing.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay the workers who harvested her maize.

loans.name: Kaneezan

texts.en:
Kaneezan is 47 years old, married woman and a mother of 4 children.  She with her husband (shown in the photo) is doing work of agriculture for some years. They grow different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.  She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

In order to purchase different types of seeds along with good quality soil and mud, currently Kaneezan has applied for a loan of 45000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops which ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds along with good quality soil and mud.

loans.name: Kun

texts.en:
Kun is a farmer 58-year-old, living in the Kampong Chnang province’s Chol Kiri district and she is a mother of six children. Nowadays, she farms rice fields to support her family’s living condition. Her daily income earns about 3.28USD per day. 

For Kun, she has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two cycles already. The previous loans have helped her to have a better house to stay. She is now applying for new loan to buy a solar light system to use. She hopes that this loan will help her to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy a solar light system to use

location.town: Kampong Chnang Province, Chol Kiri District

loans.name: Saheb

texts.en:
Saheb is a 52-year-old woman; she deals in a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 30,000  to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. 

She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales

loans.name: Amanecer Anteña Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “AMANECER ANTEÑA”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teofila ella es casada y tiene 61 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.


Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de panadería, venta de moraya, venta de chicha, tienda de abarrotes, venta de leche, venta de fruta, agricultura, cafetería, venta de desayunos.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partners belong to communal bank 'Amanecer Anteña'. This bank is situated in the Anta district. It belongs to the Anta province and the department of Cusco.
Teofila, 61, is married and has three children.
She alternates her daily activities with her food-selling business. She cooks several dishes such as roasted chicken, soup, and stir-fry meat. She works from 8 am to 6 pm.
She has been engaged in this activity for several years and it has been going very well.
Her dream is to own a restaurant.
She is applying for the loan to buy ingredients such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.
The member of the group whose picture is at the bottom was not able to attend the group photo session because she had to be at work, so her picture was taken afterwards and added to the main one.
The other members of the group are bakers, sell dried potatoes, sell chicha (a cold drink made from maize or fruit), have a grocery shop, sell milk, sell fruit, are farmers, have a small café, or sell breakfast to go.
Teofila is grateful to all who form part of this dream through these means, and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
From the city of Vanadzor in the Lori region, Marine is a pedagogue of higher education with 20 years of work experience in the field. A widow who lives with her daughter and son, she works as a teacher of Russian Language and Literature. 

Like many pedagogues, Marine also gives paid private courses for some pupils preparing for entrance exams. Very patient and clever, she presents all of her lessons in a very interesting manner and full of new information. 

Marine will use this loan of 500.000 Armenian drams to buy a computer and also some professional methodological literature.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some professional methodological literature

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is a farmer. He lives with his mother, wife and three infant children.

Armen has been running his farm since he was a young age, and is very successful farmer in the region. Armen's farm includes 4 cows, 6 calves and 20 hens. He also cultivates wheat, barley and potatoes, which he sells in the market. 

Armen asks for this loan to purchase fertilizer and fuel for land cultivation work. 

Because the region where Armen's village is located is considered poor, and the unemployment rate here is very high, people face numerous difficulties in developing their businesses. Armen's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region to help them to access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and fuel for land cultivation work

loans.name: Elari

texts.en:
Elari is a proud beneficiary of the Kiva loans. He cannot thank the lenders enough for the milestones he has achieved because of their great support and generosity. In his fifth loan cycle Elari has witnessed his business growing, and it is still expanding, (See the stock, in the photograph.)

Elari is a divorced man aged 49 years, with five children who are all attending schools. He lives in a rural setting with his children. He is a businessman who deals in produce trading, and he supplements his family income with retail trading and agriculture. He has done this business for ten years. He works for seven days each week, and each day he works for six hours. He started this business to increase his family income. He has acquired this loan facility in order to re-stock his business. His clients are local traders from around.

His dream is to educate his children to the high levels of education. He still faces the challenges of delayed payments by his customers who take goods on credit, and limited funds with which to run his businesses. He describes himself as an honest man.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Maria Doris

texts.es:
Mantener todo en orden y bien surtido es lo que ha llevado a la señora María Doris a consolidarse en el mercado con su “tienda del peluquero”, que es un establecimiento donde se encuentra productos para el cuidado facial, capilar, productos para realizar manicura, pedicura y todo tipo de insumo para salón de belleza.

María es madre de dos hijos, felizmente casada, con sueños e ilusiones como tener vivienda propia, vehículo, dejar su negocio a sus hijos, pero para ella en este momento prima mantener el local y no dejarse vencer pro la competencia. 

Ya que tener siempre unidades disponibles fue la fórmula que la llevo al éxito María desea solicitar un préstamo para la comprar tinturas para el cabello, producto de mayor venta en su almacén.
texts.en:
Displaying everything in its proper place and carrying enough stock of each product – such is the key to María Doris's specialised beauty products shop's success.
There, she sells face skincare products, hair products, mani-pedi products, and various other types of supplies for beauty salons.
María is a happily married woman and a mother of two.
Her dreams and hopes include having a house of her own, buying a car, and leaving her business to her children.
However there are more immediate challenges that require her attention, namely keeping her shop well-stocked and facing the competition.
Since her success has always relied on having as many items as possible in stock, María wants this loan to buy hair dye, by far her best-selling product.

loans.use: to buy more stock of her star product.

loans.name: Sreyem

texts.en: A resident of Takeo Province, Sreyem is the 34-year-old mother of three children, two of whom are in school. To make a living, she has been engaging in rice farming and selling cows for five years. Her daily family income is about 41,000 KHR per day, and she is able to save around 9,000 KHR each day, after covering her family expenses. Shortages of funds and of water for her farm are the main challenges for her business. This is her first loan from VisionFund. She will use her loan to buy a cow for resale. She hopes to increase the income from her business, so as to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a cow for resale.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Kalsoom is a 44-year-old married woman, the mother of four children. In order to help her husband take care of the family’s needs, she went into the business of selling milk. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income that is generated. She has applied for a loan of 60,000 PKR to buy another buffalo to increase her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo to increase her sales of milk and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen is a hardworking woman. She has been successfully running a business selling bed sheets and bedspreads for many years. She always has a good selection to offer, and she has built up a regular list of customers. She wants to grow her business, so she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy bundles of bed sheets and bedspreads in various colors and designs. This will help her to increase her sales. She wishes to spend part of her revenues on her family expenses. She also wants to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy bundles of bed sheets and bedspreads in various colors and designs, to sell in her business.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 33 years old, a married woman. She is a mother of three children. Her husband has been doing a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. Asia fully supports and assists her husband with his work. 

Now she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount  to purchase more cattle for selling in the market. 

She desires to improving her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for selling in the market

loans.name: Yurik

texts.en:
In the village Ddmashen of Gegharkunik region lives Yurik who already ended his first Kiva loan and has plans already for the second loan and greatly hopes to be supported again. 

Yurik lives with his wife and with her, he is busy with farming and agriculture. Here he has cows, heifers, pigs and chickens. On his plot of land Yurik cultivates potatoes, beans, cabbage and greens, also sunflowers. Yurik sells his farm produce  little by little at the city wholesale market. 

Yurik mentions that as before, he works in his farm with pleasure and admires its every corner very much with great hope that he will be strong enough to continue to keep it as beautiful as he manages it now. Yurik is asking for this loan as he wants to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer, diesel fuel and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, fertilizer, diesel fuel and also fodder for all his farm cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in wood, nails, beams, and pins in order to change the roof of his home.

loans.name: Jean Chrisostome

texts.en:
Jean Chrisositome is 34 years old. He is married with three children aged between 3 and 8 years. One of them goes to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past five years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of his children and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Oeurn's Group

texts.en:
A villager living in Kampong Cham province, Oeurn is 46 years old and a mother of two children. She grows rice on two hectares area and works for others for a fee to get more income. She can earn about 21,000. In a group of two, she is the group leader. 

She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her farm. She hopes that she can get more income to expand her farming more than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en: Vanna lives in Battambong Province. She is 39 years old and has two small kids, one of whom is in school. She earns income to cover her family’s living expenses by cassava farming. Selling grocery items and working on other farms have provided additional sources of income for her family for around fifteen years. Due to a lack of funds, she is applying for a loan. She has been a VisionFund borrower for three prior cycles. The previous loans helped her to have enough food for her family. Vanna, who is the group leader, will use her portion of the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She hopes this loan will help her improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard  is a 29 years old man from Kakamega region, he is married and support three people in his family together with his wife.

He operates a motorbike transport, a business he has been doing for the last one year and generates a monthly income of KES. 17,700, he has applied for her first loan with Visionfund Kenya which he will use to purchase a new motorbike, he will use the anticipated profit to maintain his business and support his family.

His dream is to have a stable business so as to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase new motorbike so as to be able to raise income for supporting his family

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy raw material to make baby's clothing.

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik is 45 years old, and he lives with his wife and daughter in the city of Vanadzor in the Lori region. Garik has vocational education, and for over 15 years he has worked as a tailor at his private workshop. 

At his house in a separate room, Garik takes orders to make clothing for both women and men. These can be dresses, trousers or some order of special clothes or uniforms. He also sews bedding, and by the help of his wife, he sells it perfectly. Garik has very good taste and great imagination, and thanks to these skills his sewed clothes which he makes for sale are also sold very quickly. 

Garik is requesting this loan of 300,000 Armenian drams because he wants to buy a computer in order to find new models and ideas for making more interesting and nice clothes for sale.

loans.use: to buy a computer in order to find new models and ideas for making more interesting and nice clothes for sale

loans.name: Judyline

texts.en:
Judyline has been an active member of CCT since 2010. She already acquired several loans, for capital which she used for her business. She never failed to repay all her amounts due on time. She succeeded in improving their way of life, through her investments.

For years now, she has engaged in direct-selling business. Most of her relatives, friends and neighbors are purchasing the direct selling products that she sells. In addition to the fact that they know her well, she has given them reasonable discounts so they will choose to order more items. The items she sells range from clothing, footwear and undergarments, to cosmetic products and others, of the popular direct-selling brands like Avon, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, Dakki, etc. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer, and then delivered to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. The prices dealers pay are lower than those in the catalog, and the difference is the profit that the dealers are earning as their income. She earns a minimum of Php 3000 in sales, every week.

To improve her sales and profit, she is asking her ever-generous lenders for a loan amounting to Php 30,000. She will be buying more merchandise products, which she needs in her business. She will also use her loan to buy more frozen goods, like hot dogs, meatloaf, nuggets, and similar products.

Judyline hopes to have a peaceful and happy life, together with her family. She aims someday to own and manage a bigger business, which would help her cope with their daily needs and expenses. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy and sell frozen foods and direct-selling products.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is a 33-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and pensioner mother-in-law in the small village of Bakhvi located in the Ozurgeti district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of land where they grow maize and nut trees. Nino is a very hardworking woman and does her best to ensure a good harvest. She sells the harvested products locally at a good price.

Nino wants to open a shop, so she has requested a loan. The Start Up Program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan to open a shop. She will sell sugar, flour and other products in her newly opened shop. Nino hopes that the business will be profitable. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a shop and sell sugar, flour and such products

loans.name: Asesewa Group

texts.en:
These members are part of Asesewa group and are beginning their fourth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The group is made up of two members. The members’ businesses include tea, bread, noodles, and frozen food. This loan will help with their small businesses, including Patience's. 

This is Patience's fourth loan from ID-Ghana, having joined on a friend’s invitation. She has a business selling tea, bread and noodles and says that she started this business with a little bit of capital on her parents’ recommendation. She will use the money from this loan as working capital to buy more milk, Milo (breakfast drink), tea leaves, and noodles in quantity from the wholesalers market to prepare tea to sell to her customers. This work will allow her to generate income with which to support her family. She is married and has three children. 

When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she says that she likes the health care that the institution provides. The group will need a total of GHS 3,500 to better their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more milk, Milo, tea leaves, and noodles in quantity from the wholesalers market so as to prepare tea and sell it to her customers.

loans.name: Pak

texts.en:
An old woman living in Kampong Cham province, Pak is 57 years old and a mother of five dependent children. She grows rice on two hectares area as the main source of income. Moreover, she can earn more income via working for others for a fee. She can earn income about 8USD per day. 

For Pak, this is her fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans completely. She will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm. She hopes that she gets more income than before to expand her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farm

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is a 33 years old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. He wants to change the van's engine, as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its work. 

That is why Uzma  has availed herself of a loan of 55000 PKR for her husband to buy a new engine for the van to provide better facilities to his customers. Uzma is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her husband's taxi to provide better facilities to his customers

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: Claudia de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia a lado de su esposo y sus dos  hijos de de 17 y 10 años de edad. Claudia es una  mujer muy responsable y luchadora que pensando siempre en el bienestar de su familia  hace dos años con ayuda de su esposo pudo establecer un negocio de venta de hilos y bisutería lo cual es de mucho beneficio a su comunidad por la variedad de productos que tiene a la venta y gracias a esta actividad logra llevar lo necesario a su dos hijos. Claudia está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertirlo en variedad de hilos, piedra de bisutería, exhibidores de gargantilla, exhibidores de pulseras, vitrina, etc. y así vender otros productos que aumenten el inventario de  su negocio y  de esta manera aumentar sus ganancias para ir mejorando la calidad de vida de sus familia.
texts.en:
Claudia is 39 years old and lives in her own house along with her husband and her two children, 17 and 10 years old. Claudia is a very responsible and tenacious woman. Always thinking of the well-being of her family, she was able to start a business two years ago with the help of her husband. She sells threads and costume jewellery, which is of great benefit to her community for the variety of products she has for sale. Thanks to this business, she has managed to provide the necessities to her children.

Claudia is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in a variety of threads, costume jewellery stones, necklace and bracelet display stands, display cases, etc. This way she can sell additional products, which will increase the inventory of her business and thus increase her profits, improving her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: invest in a variety of threads, costume jewellery stones, necklace and bracelet display stands, display cases, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more sorghum for selling.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
In Sevan city of Gegharkunik region lives Samvel with his big family. Samvel has four children, three daughters and a son. Samvel is a farmer and his farm is a rather rich one; here he has cows, calves, and a lot of sheep, lambs, piglets, and also a lot of chickens.  With his farm milk, he makes macun (a national dairy product) and he sells a great amount of meat (mutton, beef, pork and poultry). 

Since his farm’s meat is of very high quality and always fresh, many city butchers cooperate particularly with Samvel. Samvel mentions that he does his best to develop his farm since it is the only way of providing a good living for his nice family. He is requesting this loan as he needs to buy fodder for his farm livestock since he has a lot of animals and always lacks fodder.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm livestock since he has a lot of animals and he is always lacking fodder

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi vit à Baguida et est âgée de 25 ans. Mariée, Afi a un enfant et œuvre dynamiquement pour favoriser son éducation. Afi vend de la boisson locale dans son quartier pour avoir un revenu leur permettant de faire face aux charges quotidiennes. Afi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des bidons de boissons, Afi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et tirer sa rentabilité pour aider son enfant dans son éducation.
texts.en:
Afi, age 25, is a married mother of one who lives in Baguida. She works hard to support her child’s education. She sells a local beverage in her neighborhood to earn revenue that helps to cover day-to-day expenses. She stocks up twice a month at the market. 

Afi is seeking this loan to buy jugs of this local beverage that she sells. Her profits will allow her to help her child get an education

loans.use: to buy 5 jugs of local beverage.

loans.name: Sine

texts.en:
A residing living in Kratie province, Sine is 56 years old and a mother of four dependent children. Because of her living, she grows cassava and sells coconuts as her main source of income. 

For Sine, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm. She hopes that she can get more income to renovate her house better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm.

loans.name: Yudith Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yudith es una persona amable, servicial, sencilla, trabajadora, se dedica a la confección de línea propia de ropa.

Trabaja 10 horas diarias los 7 días de la semana persiguiendo un sueño reparar y reformar su hogar, tiene una vivienda humilde desea verla convertida en algo más bello que ella pueda levantarse y ver su esfuerzo reflejado en uan reforma a su hogar.

A parte de su hogar Yudith junto con su pareja deben preocuparse por la educación de sus hijos, tiene dos de 15 y 20 años de edad que desean inscribirlos a que estudien una técnica ya que para una carrera no les alcanza el capital.

Yudith busca un apoyo económico para comprar los insumos necesarios para fabricar sus prendas como lo son telas, hilos, botones.
texts.en:
Yudith is a friendly helpful, simple and hard-working person who works sewing her own line of clothing.

She works ten hours per day, seven days a week following a dream to repair and renovate her house. She has a simple house and she wants to see it transformed into something more beautiful. Then she can get up and see her efforts reflected in the alterations on her house.

Besides her house Yudith together with her partner have to worry about the education of their children. She has two children aged 15 and 20 years old and she wants to register them to study in a technical school as she doesn't have the money to send them to university.

Yudith is looking for economic support to buy the supplies needed to make her clothing such as fabric, thread and buttons.

loans.use: to buy the supplies needed to make clothing like fabric, thread and buttons.

loans.name: Damira

texts.ru: Дамира, 51 год, замужем, воспитала 2 детей. Образование-высшее. С 1990 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. Бизнес начала с 4,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день Дамира успешный фермер своего небольшого хозяйства, а в хозяйстве у нее имеется: 2 коровы, 10 овец, 3 лошади. Ежемесячная прибыль Дамиры составляет 38,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади для отгона на пастбище и откорма. Дети помогают вести домашнее хозяйство. На доходы от кредита Дамира планирует увеличить поголовье скота и накопить на свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Damira is 51 and married with two children. She has a higher education and has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture since 1990, a business she started with 4,000 KGS. She is currently a successful farmer with her own small farm, which includes two cows, 10 sheep and three horses, with a monthly income of 38,500 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Damira has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase a horse to fatten at pasture. Her children help with the farm. She plans to use profits from the loan to increase her head count of livestock and save toward her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy a horse to fatten at pasture

loans.name: Alberto Enrique

texts.es:
Alberto es un padre de familia responsable, trabajador, honrado de 63 años de edad, que vive con su pareja y genera ingresos gracias a su negocio de panadería el cual lleva ejerciendo desde el año 2012 y que inicio pro necesidad económica pues no encontraba trabajo.

Gracias a las enseñanzas y motivación que recibió por parte de un amigo Alberto logro montar su panadería, ha visto muy buenos resultado y toda su ganancia está destinada al crecimiento y consolidación de su negocio dado que desea ejercerlo hasta que su salud se lo permita.

Alberto tiene dos hijas su deseo es que ellas puedan beneficiarse del negocio una vez él no esté en condiciones de hacerlo.

Buscando tener sostenibilidad, aumento en ventas Alberto desea solicitar un préstamo con el que comprara la materia prima que es harina y grasas, el resto del capital será destinado para comprar una nevera.
texts.en:
Alberto, 63, is a responsible, hardworking, honest family man.  He lives with his partner, and generates income thanks to his bakery business, in which he has been engaged since 2012.  He started this business out of financial necessity because he couldn’t find work.

Thanks to the training and motivation he received from a friend, Alberto managed to set up his bakery.  He has seen very good results, and all of his profits are allocated to the growth and consolidation of his business because he wants to engage in it as long as his health permits. Alberto has two daughters, and he wishes them to benefit from the business once he is unable to do so.

Seeking sustainability and sales growth, Alberto wishes to request a loan with which he will purchase basic ingredients such as wheat and fat.  He will allocate the remainder of his capital to the purchase of a refrigerator.

loans.use: to purchase basic ingredients such as wheat and fat.  He will allocate the remainder of his capital to the purchase of a refrigerator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix his house's deteriorated roof

loans.name: Sirley Saidith

texts.es:
Sirley es una mujer de 32 años de edad, madre de un pequeño de 8.

SIrley durante su embarazo ha estado sola,  su tenacidad, perseverancia, su coraje y responsabilidad son las virtudes que la han sacado adelante, claro muy apoyada de su negocio de farmacia, negocio que fue montado para servir a la comunidad y con el que ha logrado generar el sustento diario en su hogar.

Su meta principal es pagar la educación de sus hijos, dejar el negocio a su hijo para que este no pase necesidades.

Pensando en llamar la atención de sus clientes, tener un negocio mejor consolidado y posicionado Sirley quiere solicitar un préstamo con el que comprara vitrinas, góndolas e inventario de medicamentos.
texts.en:
Sirley, aged 32, is the mother of an 8-year-old child. Sirley was alone throughout the pregnancy, and her tenacity, perseverance, courage and responsibility have got her through. She has also been supported by her pharmacy business, which she set up to serve her community, and which has allowed her to provide for her household.

Her main goal is to pay for her child's education, and to be able to leave her son the business so that he will never want for the necessities. Sirley is requesting a loan to buy cabinets, shelving and an inventory of medicines so that she can grab the attention of her clients, and consolidate and better position her business.

loans.use: to buy cabinets, shelving and an inventory of medicines.

loans.name: Wilson David

texts.es:
Insumos agrícolas, asistencia técnica de los cultivos son los dos motivos que llevan al señor Wilson a solicitar un apoyo económico para cubrir estos dos falencias presentes en su cultivo de plátanos.

Wilson es un hombre de 32 años de edad, se separó de su esposa, ya superado  los inconvenientes del divorcio se puso en la tarea de levantar su cultivo, razón por la cual solicita la ayuda.

A pesar de ser separado no se olvida de su responsabilidad la cual es mantener a sus dos hijas de 9 y 11 años de edad y su mayor sueño que es pagarles la educación y se conviertan en profesionales dispuestas a cambiar su futuro.
texts.en:
Agricultural inputs and technical assistance for his crops are the two reasons that lead Wilson to request financial support to cover these necessities for his banana cultivation. 

Wilson is 32 years old. He is separated from his wife and has overcome the disadvantages of their separation with the task of raising his crops, which is why he is requesting a loan.

Despite being separated, he does not forget his responsibility to support his two daughters, aged 9 and 11. His biggest dream is to pay for their education so that they become professionals willing to change the future.

loans.use: to grow bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in metal sheets, wood, nails and wire to improve her washing area.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Doña Juana es originaria del área de San Martin Jilotepeque  y desde hace más de 16 años es propietaria de un deposito de gaseosas en el cual ofrece a sus clientes un gran surtido de gaseosas de todos sabores, marcas y presentaciones, su negocio está ubicado en el exterior del mercado municipal de dicha área y es allí donde sus clientes llegan a comprarle sus productos. Doña Juana implemento  productos de veterinaria en su depósito y esto permitió que sus ganancias aumentaran.  Solicita el crédito para la compra de Jugos por bandeja en diferentes sabores, marcas y presentaciones y ahora productos veterinarios. Y sus pagos los realizo sin ningún día de atraso.
texts.en:
Juana is a native of San Martin Jilotepeque. For more than 16 years, she has owned a beverage shop where she sells her customers a wide range of soft drinks in all flavors, brands, and packaging. Her business is located outside of the municipal market in the area, where her customers come to buy her products. 

Juana has begun to sell veterinary medicines in her warehouse, which has increased her income. She is requesting a loan to purchase drinks of different flavors and packaging and also products for animals. She will make her repayments without delay.

loans.use: to buy water, sodas, and juices to sell.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.en:
Zulfiya is an honest woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1970. She is living in a village with her family. She is married and has five children. 

Zulfiya has five years of experience doing a business in agriculture. She plants vegetables and cereal on her land. Now, it is time to collect her harvest and she wants to plant different types of agricultural products. 

She appealed to CSC MDO IMON International, asking for financial support to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals to obtain a good harvest for the next season. She really takes cares of her land and has well-cultivated land and she wishes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals to obtain a good harvest for the next season.

loans.name: Vedaste

texts.en:
Vedaste is 31 years old. He is married to a businesswoman and he is a businessman as well. Vedaste sells foodstuffs and he has been doing this business for the past eight years.

Vedaste would like a loan to buy more foodstuffs to sell and with the profits, he wishes to put aside some savings and buy food for his family.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to  sell.

loans.name: Vaghinak

texts.en:
Vaghinak is 27 years old and he lives with his wife, daughter and retired mother in Gagarin village of Gegharkunik region. Vaghinak works at the city’s police station as a policeman. Simultaneously he runs farming which is good way of both, having always fresh farm products for his family and it also brings some income. 

Now on his farm he has heifers, a bull, sheep, lambs and chickens. Vaghinak from his farm perfectly organizes the sale his farm meat and also eggs for which he has a small, but regular group of customers. 

Vaghinak asks a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams as he wants to buy two cows for his farm and this will mean that very soon he will sell dairy products from his farm also with great profit and use for his family.

loans.use: to buy two cows for his farm

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos es un hombre de 35 años de edad, una persona tierna, trabajadora, honesta que lucha por salir adelante y cambiar su futuro.

Se dedica a prestar servicios de taller de mecánica, actividad que inicio en el año 2005 y que aprendió de su padre.

Es padre de un hijo de 6 años de edad que a pesar de que no vive con él, trabaja por su forjar su futuro y por pagar su educación.

La mejora continua es a lo que se direcciona Juan Carlos y necesita maquinaria y equipo que respalde su negocio, por ello solicita un préstamo para la compra de un compresor, suministros para el mantenimiento del compresor, llantas, neumáticos, aceites.

La herramienta e insumos servirán para mejorar sus ventas y atender un mayor número de clientes.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, aged 35, is a gentle, hard-working and honest man, who works hard to get ahead and change his future. He has been a mechanic since 2005, and learned his trade from his father.

He has a 6-year-old son, and, although his son doesn't live with him, works hard to be able to ensure his child's future and to pay for his education. Juan Carlos strives continually to improve, and needs machinery and equipment for his business. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to pay for a compressor, supplies for maintaining the compressor, wheels, tires and oil. The tools and supplies will allow him to improve sales, and provide services to a greater number of customers.

loans.use: to buy a compressor, supplies for the maintenance of the compressor, wheels, tires and oils.

loans.name: Qrestina

texts.en:
The shining woman in the photo is Qrestina from Khachpar village of Ararat region. She lives with her husband and two children. They are farmers with many years of experience behind them. Qrestina and her husband keep three cows, and 10 hens. They also cultivate haricot beans and greens and sell the produce in the market. This family is nice and hard-working and they have never avoided the difficulties that are in the agricultural sector. 

Wishing to enlarge their farm, Qrestina is asking for this loan to  purchase  two calves and  build a small barn for the cattle. 

 As this is Qrestina's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn't have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Qrestina get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. Assuring responsible monthly payments of the loan, Qrestina and her husband hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for two calves and  build a small barn for the cattle

loans.name: Thank You Jesus Group

texts.en:
Juliana is 46 years old. She comes from Mankessim in the Mfantseman District of Central Region of Ghana.  She is member and a leader of “Thank You Jesus”. Juliana is married with three children. The ages the children are as follows 4, 6 and 8. All the children are currently schooling. 

Juliana is a petty trader and has been in this kind of business for the past 25 years. She sells ladies and gents wear. She has two employees who support her in running the business. In five years to come she wants to see consistent business progress and sales to help her generate more income to care for the family. 

Her inspiration came from an auntie she started with after her “Form Four education”. She started doing this in a small kiosk, but due to hard work and determination she has been able to erect a container. Juliana has been growing her microenterprise with microfinance facility from the field partner since 2009. She was consistent with the repayments in all her previous 10 loan cycles.  

Juliana still wants to do more; she needs additional micro loan support to buy more ladies and gents wear to increase her stock to sell to her customers. 

The profit from her sales will help Julian support her family and business needs. Juliana is grateful to all her micro lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: To buy ladies and gents wear to sell

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophelia is 32 years old, has four children, and lives with her family in Teshie. Ophelia works selling corn, cassava, and plantains. She has more than five years of experience in this business, which is located at her home, and she has good personal and professional references in the area.

She will use this loan to buy a larger quantity of corn, cassava, and plantains. With this, Ophelia hopes to offer better produce to her customers, enabling her to generate greater income, ultimately improving her and her family's life.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of corn, cassava, and plantains

loans.name: Yesu Anaweza Grp Group

texts.en:
Jane is married and a mother of seven children who are at school. She is 49 years old, supporting her family with a general store, selling a variety of products: sugar, drinking water, juices, sodas, rice, baking and maize flour. She works hard, from 7 am to midnight and is able to make a very good profit each month. 

This is her eighth credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania, to be apportioned among YESU ANAWEZA, a two-member group. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.  

Jane used the previous loans, all previous loans being paid back in full, to improve her shop with missing inventory. She bought sacks of sugar, baking flour, maize flour and rice in the amount demanded. She really thanks Kiva lenders for the support they have shown to her group. In the coming years, Jane would like to grow her shop in the extent of being able to sells more products than others. 

She will invest her loan to buy inventory for her shop for resale.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her shop for resale

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en:
Japhet is 53 years. He is married with 6 children aged between 7 and 28 years. They all go to school. 

He owns a shop and he has been doing a business for the past eight years, while his wife is a business lady also. 

With the loan, he would like to buy more cement and iron sheets to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more cement and iron sheets to sell.

loans.name: Fayzigul

texts.en:
Fayzigul is a responsible woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1960. She is living in a remote district far from the city. She is a widow and has one son. 

She has her own store where she sells grocery products. She buys goods and products from the city and sells them in her store. She has been doing business in this sphere since 2005. 

The summer season is too hot this year. They do not an air conditioner in their house. She is willing to buy an air conditioner. She appealed to IMON and KIVA to get a loan to buy an air conditioner. 

She hopes to spend this summer is without any problems and comfortable. She awaits the kindness of KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner

loans.name: Meral

texts.en:
Meral is married and a mother of two.  She has been in a fresh flower sales business with her husband for 21 years. She designs and sells her flowers according to her customer's needs.  

With the help of the loan from Maya she bought flower materials and expanded her business.  

Her aim is to provide a good future for her children.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Meral hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Yirmi bir yıldır eşiyle beraber canlı çiçek işi yapıyor.  Müşterinin isteği üzerine çiçekleri tasarlayarak satış yapıyor.  Mayadan kullandığı krediler ile çiçek malzemesi alarak işini geliştirdi. Çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek hazırlamayı hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy flower materials

loans.name: Jose Vicente

texts.es:
Los rayos del sol se deslizan sobre los cultivos de José, un hombre de 44 años de edad, que lleva más de treinta años trabajando en el campo cultivando frijoles y maíz, teniendo de ejemplo a seguir a su padre cuando apenas era un adolescente. Ahora que ya es cabeza de familia y está bajo el cargo de tres hijos de 21, 19 y 17 años de edad, además de su esposa que la apoya en su día a día, su esfuerzo por trabajar ha escalado, por lo que además de cultivar viaja en verano a Costa Rica con uno de sus hijos para conseguir más ingresos. 
Anteriormente tenía el apoyo de una organización para producir y vender sus productos. Ahora ha ido invirtiendo con préstamos y lo ha visto como una gran oportunidad. Por esta razón, solicita un préstamo para comprar 12 litros de glifosato, urea, abono, ocho kilogramos de refrescante, dos litros de cipermetrina y para pagar a los trabajadores. Con esto podrá cosechar un cultivo de calidad para obtener grandes ganancias. En sus planes está comprar un terreno en un futuro y construir una casa para su hijo.
texts.en:
The sun's rays fall on Jose' crops. He is 44 and has been working in the country growing beans and corn for more than 30 years as his father taught him when he was just a boy. Now that he is the head of the household and responsible for three children ages 21, 19 and 17 as well as his wife whom he supports, he has worked even harder. That is why, in addition to growing his crops, he and one of his sons go to Costa Rica every summer to earn more money. 

Before he had the support of an organization for the production and sale of his crops. Now he has invested using loans and he sees this as a great opportunity. Because of this he is requesting a loan to buy 12 liters of glyphosate, urea, fertilizer, 8 kilos of stimulant, two liters of cypermethrin, and to pay workers. With this he will be able to harvest a quality crop and generate greater earnings. Among his plans is to buy a plot in the future and build a house for his son.

loans.use: to buy 12 liters of glyphosate, urea, fertilizer, 8 kilos of stimulant, two liters of cypermethrin, and pay workers.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is a farmer from Lehvaz village of Syunik region. She is mother of three grown-up children who help their mother around the farm. The farm includes 4 cows, a calf and 20 goats. 

The cattle Lusine keeps help her to receive milk and prepare dairy products for selling. Lusine is sure she can enlarge her farming business and earn more income for agribusiness and that's a reason she has applied for this loan. She plans to purchase a cow and an oxen. 

This is Lusine's second loan. Unfortunately the first loan, which she got from local financial institutions, was very difficult to return back, and Lusine faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, Lusine, her children and her husband have been able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

Lusine has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and no access to credit products.

Please help this hard working village woman to invest in her farm and develop it.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and an oxen
